original: thun mong nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is common to both.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / dbang po dang don phrad pa dang / khyad par shes pa dag gzhan gyi tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / dbang po dang don phrad pa dang / khyad par shes pa dag gzhan gyi tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the assertion that the cognition of seeing, the sense faculty and object, and the cognition of the specific are valid cognitions of others,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na gzhal bya'i ngo bo nyid bor nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na gzhal bya'i ngo bo nyid bor nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause of that, having abandoned the nature of the object of comprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa gnyis po de dag ces bya ba ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis po de dag ces bya ba ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi shes pa dag ste /
translated: The two cognitions are the cognition of the specific and the cognition of the basis of the specific.

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po dmigs pa can nyid kyis de dag tha dad pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdus snga phyir 'byung ba'i shes pa yul gcig pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus sngar byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni tshad ma nyid la /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po dmigs pa can nyid kyis de dag tha dad pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // dus snga phyir 'byung ba'i shes pa yul gcig pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus sngar byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni tshad ma nyid la /
translated: They are subjects of different objects because they are the observation of things that are the specific and the basis of the specific.üîΩThe cognition that occurs earlier in time and has a single object is a valid cognition.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The cognition that occurs later in time and has a single object is the result of the valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar phrad pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dngos po cha med pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar phrad pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dngos po cha med pa ni /
translated: If it does not enter into some aspect of contact, then,

original: bdag nyid thams cad nye ba yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad nye ba yin //
translated: it is said that the entire self is present.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is what is intended.

original: shes pa la skyes pa'i shes pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma las skyes pa ni phyi ma'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa la skyes pa'i shes pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma las skyes pa ni phyi ma'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause of consciousness that arises in consciousness means that what arises from a prior consciousness is the cause of a subsequent one.

original: dngos po la rten par byed ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la rten par byed ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The support of an entity means the establishment of action and agent.

original: shes pa de dang de la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa de dang de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa de dang de la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa de dang de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In dependence on this or that consciousness means in dependence on this or that consciousness that superimposes.

original: de ltar na sta re'i rdzas steng 'og tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba dmigs na /
analyzed: de ltar na sta re'i rdzas steng 'og tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba dmigs na /
translated: Thus, when one observes the uninterrupted occurrence of the axe-substance above and below,

original: steng 'og tu rgyu ba'i bya ba'i khyad bar la byed pa ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: steng 'og tu rgyu ba'i bya ba'i khyad bar la byed pa ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one superimposes a difference in the action that moves above and below, and a consciousness that superimposes arises.

original: da ltar sta re dang 'brel pas shing la sogs pa yul tha dad par dmigs nas bcad pa la sogs pa'i bya bar sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar sta re dang 'brel pas shing la sogs pa yul tha dad par dmigs nas bcad pa la sogs pa'i bya bar sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, because of the connection with the axe, the cognition that superimposes the action of cutting, etc. arises, observing the different objects such as the tree, etc.

original: de'i dbang gis bya ba dang byed par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bya ba dang byed par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: And on the basis of that, the presentation of action and agent is made.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i rdzas las tha dad par te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i rdzas las tha dad par te /
translated: An action that is a different object does not exist, i.e., separate from the substances that are the object of cutting and the cutter,

original: de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not observed as having the characteristic of being observed.

original: de med pa'i phyir te don gzhan du gyur ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te don gzhan du gyur ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of that, i.e., because of the nonexistence of an action that is a different object.

original: gang las byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni ma yin te byed pa por rnam par gzhag pa ni bya ba'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni ma yin te byed pa por rnam par gzhag pa ni bya ba'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From what would the agent be? The presentation of the agent is due to action.

original: de ltar na re zhig phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas de rtogs pa ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas de rtogs pa ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Thus, first, accepting external objects, the cognition of them is the effect.

original: don dang 'dra ba ni tshad ma yin la phyi rol ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bshad do//
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba ni tshad ma yin la phyi rol ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bshad do//
translated: That which is similar to the object is valid knowledge, and the external object is the object of comprehension.

original: @218b da ni phyi rol gyi don 'gog pa sngon du song ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: @218b da ni phyi rol gyi don 'gog pa sngon du song ba can yin gyi /
translated: Now, in order to explain the passages beginning with

original: rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'chad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'chad par bzhed nas /
translated: the result is self-awareness,üîΩhe says,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: consciousness itself, etc.üîΩThe passages beginning withüîΩapart from the experience of the object, there is no experience, etc.

original: gzhal bya nyams su myong ba ma gtogs par nyams su myong ba yod pa ma yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyams su myong ba ma gtogs par nyams su myong ba yod pa ma yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba'i'o //
translated: are those of the proponents of the existence of external objects.üîΩThe passages beginning with

original: de nyid 'dir ni dpyad par bya //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir ni dpyad par bya //
translated: that itself should be investigated here, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'i'o //
translated: are those of the author of the treatise.üîΩThe passages beginning withüîΩbecause ultimately these conventions do not exist, etc.

original: don dam par tha snyad 'di med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar bya ba ni 'di yin zhing 'di'i nyams su myong ba ni 'di yin zhes de lta bu'i tshul gyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: don dam par tha snyad 'di med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar bya ba ni 'di yin zhing 'di'i nyams su myong ba ni 'di yin zhes de lta bu'i tshul gyi tha snyad do //
translated: refer to the conventions of the form ‚Äúthis is the object of experience and this is the experience of that.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid ni yod pa can dang ldog pa can du 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi ma lus pa la khyab pa'i phyir yod pa can dang mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa can te khyab pa med
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni yod pa can dang ldog pa can du 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi ma lus pa la khyab pa'i phyir yod pa can dang mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa can te khyab pa med
translated: If you say that the definition is ‚Äúthat which is existent and that which is reversed,‚Äù then it is not a definition because it pervades everything that is a basis of definition and because it is not applied to what is not intended.

original: pa dang shin tu khyab ches pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa dang shin tu khyab ches pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from over-pervasion and non-pervasion.

original: du ma nyid kyi phyir dang rdul phran nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir du ma nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dra ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma nyid kyi phyir dang rdul phran nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir du ma nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dra ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of being manifold and because of being atomic, because of being manifold, it is not similar.

original: rdul phra rab du ma'i rnam pa ni snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab du ma'i rnam pa ni snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspect of many atoms does not appear.

original: rdul phran nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phran nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of being atomic, it is not similar.

original: rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa'i phra ba'i rnam pa ni shes pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa'i phra ba'i rnam pa ni shes pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the subtle aspect belonging to the atom does not appear to consciousness.

original: de'i tshe don mtshungs can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yul mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde skad du gang gi tshe yul sngon po la nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'dis sngon po nyams su myong ba de nyid la dran pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i dran pa de ni sngon po nyams su
analyzed: de'i tshe don mtshungs can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yul mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba'i don to // de skad du gang gi tshe yul sngon po la nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'dis sngon po nyams su myong ba de nyid la dran pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i dran pa de ni sngon po nyams su
translated: At that time, the meaning of ‚Äúhaving a similar object‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving a similar object.‚Äù

original: myong ba dang yul mtshungs pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir 'dra ba dang de las mtshungs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: myong ba dang yul mtshungs pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir 'dra ba dang de las mtshungs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: In that way, when a consciousness arises experiencing a blue object, this similar immediately preceding condition produces a memory consciousness of just that experience of blue. That memory is similar to the experience of blue because it has a similar object.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyams su myong bas skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyams su myong bas skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is similar to that because it is produced by the experience of similarity.

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i dran pa yang nyams su myong ba'i shes pa snga ma yul gyi ngo bo thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i dran pa yang nyams su myong ba'i shes pa snga ma yul gyi ngo bo thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is demonstrated that even a memory that observes an external blue object and so on is a prior consciousness that experiences the entity of the object.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin pa ni 'di ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni gsal bar snang ba yin la dran pa ni mi gsal ba yin na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa de ma thag pa'i shes
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin pa ni 'di ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni gsal bar snang ba yin la dran pa ni mi gsal ba yin na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa de ma thag pa'i shes
translated: It does not conform to all aspects, because the consciousness that experiences is a clear appearance, while memory is unclear.

original: pa la de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa la de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The immediately preceding condition does not exist in that way in the immediately preceding consciousness.

original: 'di ma thong zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i dran pa ni phyi rol gyi don la zhen pas @219a * //üîΩ'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ma thong zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i dran pa ni phyi rol gyi don la zhen pas @219a * // 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not like that‚Äù means that the just-mentioned memory engages by way of grasping an external object.

original: de la brten nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don la brten nas so //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don la brten nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising in dependence on that‚Äù means arising in dependence on an external object.

original: zhen pa de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pa de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgrasping in that way‚Äù means grasping as ‚ÄúI saw‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i yul gyi mtshan nyid brten pa yin zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa de dag yul gyi mtshan nyid brten pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yul gyi mtshan nyid brten pa yin zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa de dag yul gyi mtshan nyid brten pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe characteristic of its object is dependent‚Äù means that seeing and hearing are dependent on the characteristic of the object.

original: rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ltar na de yul gyi mtshan nyid brten pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ltar na de yul gyi mtshan nyid brten pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is posited in that way‚Äù means that the characteristic of the object is posited in that way.

original: gcig la gcig rten yin pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'di mthong ngo //
analyzed: gcig la gcig rten yin pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'di mthong ngo //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: the object and the experience of the object are established as being mutually dependent.

original: 'di thos so zhes zhen pa la brten nas mthong ba dang thos pa dag yul dang 'brel pa grub pa yin te /üîΩde la brten nas kyang 'di mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di thos so zhes zhen pa la brten nas mthong ba dang thos pa dag yul dang 'brel pa grub pa yin te / de la brten nas kyang 'di mthong ngo //
translated: The establishment of the connection between the object and the experience of the object is based on the attachment to the idea that ‚Äúthis is seen‚Äù or ‚Äúthat is heard.‚Äù

original: 'di thos so zhes zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thos so zhes zhen pa yin no //
translated: And on the basis of that, there is the attachment to the idea that ‚Äúthis is seen‚Äù or ‚Äúthat is heard.‚Äù

original: de yi sngo sogs ngo bo yi //üîΩrang bzhin de nyams myong de yang //
analyzed: de yi sngo sogs ngo bo yi // rang bzhin de nyams myong de yang //
translated: The experience of the nature of blue, etc.üîΩis the experience of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan par sngon par sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams su myong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan par sngon par sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams su myong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The experience of the nature of blue, etc. is the experience of the nature of pleasure, etc.üîΩTherefore, the experience of the nature of blue, etc. is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams su myong ba yin gyi sngon po'i nyams su myong ba ni sngon po'i nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams su myong ba yin gyi sngon po'i nyams su myong ba ni sngon po'i nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
translated: but not the experience of blue, etc. is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: However, it is established by the power of seeing, i.e., by the power of error.

original: don nyams su myong ba yang de ltar rigs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba yang de ltar rigs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIt is also reasonable that the object is experienced in that way.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba na yang don nyams su myong ba yang nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba na yang don nyams su myong ba yang nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that when the nature of consciousness is experienced, it is reasonable that the nature of the experience of the object is also experienced.

original: blo ni rnam pa tha dad pa la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don du smra ba yin te /
analyzed: blo ni rnam pa tha dad pa la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don du smra ba yin te /
translated: Because the mind does not depend on different aspects. This is the position of the proponents of external objects.

original: blo ni nyams su myong ba de don gyi rnam pa la ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: blo ni nyams su myong ba de don gyi rnam pa la ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: The mind that experiences that does not depend on the aspect of the object.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa la rag las pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa la rag las pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on its own appropriation.üîΩIf it does not depend on that,

original: de la ltos pa med pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni don la ltos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni don la ltos pa nyid yin no //
translated: then it depends on the object.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba la'o //
translated: That means the experience.

original: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
analyzed: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
translated: If the mind has that aspect,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: This and the rest is the statement of the philosophical position.

original: gal la rnam pa'i khyad par yod pa de ni rnam pa'i khyad par can no //
analyzed: gal la rnam pa'i khyad par yod pa de ni rnam pa'i khyad par can no //
translated: That which has a particular aspect is ‚Äúhaving a particular aspect.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: That itself is explained by the phrase ‚Äúhaving the aspect of blue, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam pa des zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa des so //
analyzed: rnam pa des zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa des so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that aspect‚Äù means by the aspect of blue, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ci ltar tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ci ltar tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as before‚Äù means just as the presentation of valid cognition was explained.

original: thams cad la nyams su myong ba'i bdag @219b nyid du khyad par med pa'i don dang 'dra ba med par las so so'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la nyams su myong ba'i bdag @219b nyid du khyad par med pa'i don dang 'dra ba med par las so so'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no distinction in the nature of experience for all objects, and there would be no division of individual actions.

original: ji ltar myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa nyid rtag tu myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa nyid rtag tu myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the object of experience is reversed‚Äù means that the aspect of consciousness is always experienced, this is the intended meaning.

original: 'di la don khyad par du byed pas na khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di la don khyad par du byed pas na khyad par ro //
translated: Since it is a special object, it is a distinction.

original: shes pa nyid khyad par yin pas na mthong ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid khyad par yin pas na mthong ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Since consciousness itself is a distinction, it is a distinction of seeing.

original: shes pa la gzhag pa'i don rtag tu rtogs pa'i phyir de skad du bstan te /
analyzed: shes pa la gzhag pa'i don rtag tu rtogs pa'i phyir de skad du bstan te /
translated: It is taught in this way because the object is always realized as being based on consciousness.

original: tha dad pa med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason is clarified: because it is observed without distinction.

original: gcig tu dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig tu dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it is observed as one.

original: shes pa la nyams su myong ba gnyis yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: shes pa la nyams su myong ba gnyis yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If there are not two experiences in consciousness,

original: gang gis na bdag dang sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis na bdag dang sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa yin /
translated: by what is the self and blue, etc. observed?

original: 'on kyang rang la dmigs pa kho na sngon po la sogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang la dmigs pa kho na sngon po la sogs pa yin zhing /
translated: However, it is only blue, etc. that is observed in itself.

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyang shes pa la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyang shes pa la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: And blue, etc. is also observed in consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba ma gtogs par gzhan mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba ma gtogs par gzhan mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the experience of blue, etc., there is no other eye consciousness, etc.

original: de'i phyir tha dad par snang ba nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'khrul pa bzhin du zhen pa la brten nas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad par snang ba nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'khrul pa bzhin du zhen pa la brten nas de skad du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, although they appear to be different, this is said in dependence on the conception that is like an error.

original: de kho na nyid du ni bde ba la sogs pa myong ba nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i myong ba yang gnyis su med pa nyid yin no zhes rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni bde ba la sogs pa myong ba nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i myong ba yang gnyis su med pa nyid yin no zhes rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: In reality, the experience of pleasure, etc. is not different from the experience of blue, etc. This has been explained in detail.

original: gcig nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they are observed as the same, means because they are observed as not different.

original: de bas na rang gi sems las byung ba dang rgyud gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis sgo nas 'khrul par brjod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gtan tshigs kyi don mi shes pa yin no zhes gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi sems las byung ba dang rgyud gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis sgo nas 'khrul par brjod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gtan tshigs kyi don mi shes pa yin no zhes gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that those who speak of error in terms of one‚Äôs own mind and mental functions and the minds and mental functions of other continua do not understand the meaning of the reason.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la gcig tu dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la gcig tu dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind and mental functions are not observed as the same.

original: thams cad so sor tha dad par bdag nyid nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad so sor tha dad par bdag nyid nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each of them has the nature of being experienced separately.

original: gcig nyid du dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs la 'gal bar brjod pa yang ring du gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid du dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs la 'gal bar brjod pa yang ring du gsal ba yin no //
translated: The statement of the contradiction in the reason ‚Äúbecause of being perceived as one‚Äù is also quite clear.

original: cig car dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don la 'gal bar dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig car dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don la 'gal bar dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: There is the possibility of a contradiction in the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being perceived simultaneously,‚Äù

original: cig car ba la sna tshogs pa nyid 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car ba la sna tshogs pa nyid 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error in the diversity of what is simultaneous.

original: 'di la nges pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te bzlog na gnod pa can gyi mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la nges pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te bzlog na gnod pa can gyi mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no certainty here, because there is no possibility of a counterexample.

original: 'di ltar shes pa gcig la @220a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gcig la @220a * //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that it is not possible for a single cognition

original: bdag nyams su myong ba dang gzhan nyams su myong ba mi rung ngo zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: bdag nyams su myong ba dang gzhan nyams su myong ba mi rung ngo zhes bstan zin to //
translated: to experience itself and experience another.

original: gcig la rang bzhin gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for one thing to have two natures.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The fact that the reason is not established is also eliminated by this.

original: kho bo cag gis don 'di yang gzhan du rgyas par dpyad zin pas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis don 'di yang gzhan du rgyas par dpyad zin pas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since we have already analyzed this matter extensively elsewhere, we will leave it for the time being.

original: zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like two moons.üîΩThe meaning is that it is like the case of the cognition of two moons due to an error, where one moon is observed, and there is no difference from that.

original: dper na 'khrul pas zla ba gnyis par shes pas gcig tu dmigs pas de las tha dad pa med pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na 'khrul pas zla ba gnyis par shes pas gcig tu dmigs pas de las tha dad pa med pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like the case of the cognition of two moons due to an error, where one moon is observed, and there is no difference from that.

original: dkar po snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dkar po snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The cognition that has the mode of appearance of white, and the resultant cognition, should be connected in this way.

original: 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: Some say that the cognition

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: is any of the active forms of consciousness.

original: nang gi bag chags zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bag chags zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: The internal habitual propensities are the potentials that exist in the foundation consciousness.

original: rab tu sad par byed pa ni khyad par can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba la nus pa thogs pa med pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sad par byed pa ni khyad par can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba la nus pa thogs pa med pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The activation is the production of a special form of consciousness, which is the production of an unobstructed potential for the production of a special form of consciousness.

original: des na shes pa gang gi zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skye bar 'dod pa'i lhan cig byed par gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin par rab tu sad par byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na shes pa gang gi zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skye bar 'dod pa'i lhan cig byed par gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin par rab tu sad par byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúof any consciousness‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúthat which is activated as the consciousness that is the co-originator of the arising of a consciousness of blue, etc., and is called ‚Äòthe arising of the effect.‚Äô

original: skad cig ma re re'i nus pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re'i nus pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyis te /
translated: ‚Äù It is by means of the other and other natures of the potential of each moment.

original: skad ma khyad par can phyi ma phyi ma gzhan skyed par byed pas so ;
analyzed: skad ma khyad par can phyi ma phyi ma gzhan skyed par byed pas so ;
translated: It is because the later and later special moments produce the other.

original: / yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: / yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Transformation‚Äù is the characteristic of producing the effect.

original: nye bar 'gro ba ni kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du byed pa na'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro ba ni kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du byed pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching‚Äù is when it is made into the nature of the consciousness called the foundation consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa gcig la ma rig pas bslad pa'i phyir tshul gnyis yod ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa gcig la ma rig pas bslad pa'i phyir tshul gnyis yod ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, because of the contamination of ignorance in one consciousness, it is said that there are two modes, and so on.

original: tshul gnyis bzhin du snang ba'i phyir tshul gnyis yod ces brjod de /
analyzed: tshul gnyis bzhin du snang ba'i phyir tshul gnyis yod ces brjod de /
translated: Because it appears as if there are two modes, it is said that there are two modes.

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is posited in accordance with error.

original: shes pa de tshul gnyis pa nyid ni ma yin te gnyis med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de tshul gnyis pa nyid ni ma yin te gnyis med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That consciousness is not of a dual nature, because it is nondual.

original: gang gi tshe grub pa de'i dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe grub pa de'i dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas de skad du brjod do //
translated: When that is established, then the so-called external object is said to be a mere representation of consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa de'i de ltar myong ba yin /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de'i de ltar myong ba yin /
translated: That consciousness experiences it in that way.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i sgo nas yul nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa nyid yul nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i sgo nas yul nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa nyid yul nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: The so-called experience of the object through desire and non-desire is the consciousness itself experiencing the object.

original: 'on kyang yul rtags par bya ba bzhin du sgro btags nas de la nyams su myong ba zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul rtags par bya ba bzhin du sgro btags nas de la nyams su myong ba zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
translated: However, just as an object is imputed, it is conventionally said to be experienced.

original: de dang des phyi rol gyi don la phyi rol gyi gzhal @220b byar rtogs pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi re zhig rang rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dang des phyi rol gyi don la phyi rol gyi gzhal @220b byar rtogs pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi re zhig rang rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The external object is cognized as an external object by that and that, but self-awareness is not so at first.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa la 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni zhes bya nang gi yin par smra ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas gnyis pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa la 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni zhes bya nang gi yin par smra ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas gnyis pa zhes bstan te /
translated: This is taught as the second theory of the result in terms of the theory of the internalists.üîΩWhen it is established, this passage, ‚ÄúThe result is the thing itself,‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe grub pa de'i dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'dis /üîΩbyed dang bcas par rtogs nyid phyir //
analyzed: gang gi tshe grub pa de'i dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'dis / byed dang bcas par rtogs nyid phyir //
translated: and so on,üîΩis explained as follows:üîΩBecause it is understood to be the result of valid knowledge,

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid 'gyur ba'i //
translated: it is the result of valid knowledge.üîΩThis is the result that is intended in the passage from the chapter on perception in the Compendium of Valid Knowledge, ‚ÄúWhat is the result of valid knowledge?üîΩIt is the thing itself.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mngon sum gyi le'u'i gzhung du ji lta bur gyur pa'i 'bras bu mngon par bzhed pa'i de bshad pa yin par blta bar bya'i ngang rig pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mngon sum gyi le'u'i gzhung du ji lta bur gyur pa'i 'bras bu mngon par bzhed pa'i de bshad pa yin par blta bar bya'i ngang rig pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It should be seen as the explanation of that, but it is not the result of reflexive awareness.

original: de bas na 'og nas ba'i //
analyzed: de bas na 'og nas ba'i //
translated: Therefore, the following passage from the Compendium of Valid Knowledge,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mngon 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mngon 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe result is the thing itself,‚Äù and so on, does not have such a presentation of the result of perception.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung gang yin pa 'di la gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don gzhan bya yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung gang yin pa 'di la gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don gzhan bya yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When external objects are other than consciousness,üîΩthen the valid knowledge of this appearance of an object is called ‚Äúthe valid knowledge of that.‚Äù

original: yul snang ba 'di'i tshad ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba la yang rang rig pa 'bras bu yin par rigs so zhes 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gsum pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yul snang ba 'di'i tshad ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba la yang rang rig pa 'bras bu yin par rigs so zhes 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gsum pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows the third conception of the result, that reflexive awareness is the result, even for those who assert the existence of external objects.

original: de yang 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: phyi rol gyi don med pa la //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa la //
translated: When there are no external objects,

original: rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin //
translated: reflexive awareness is the result.

original: zhes brjod nas /üîΩdon nges pa ni de dngos yi //
analyzed: zhes brjod nas / don nges pa ni de dngos yi //
translated: Having said that,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: it is explained:üîΩThe ascertainment of the object is its result.

original: de'i 'brel pa ni gang gi tshe yul dang bcas pa'i shes pa don yin pa de'i tshe rang rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa de'i don rtogs pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa ni gang gi tshe yul dang bcas pa'i shes pa don yin pa de'i tshe rang rig pa dang rjes su mthun pa de'i don rtogs pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The connection is this: when consciousness with an object is the object, then the ascertainment of the object that is in accordance with reflexive awareness is called ‚Äúdesired‚Äù or ‚Äúundesired.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That is also stated:

original: gang tshe yul bcas shes pa yi //
analyzed: gang tshe yul bcas shes pa yi //
translated: When there is consciousness with an object,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: yul dang bcas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: yul dang bcas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with ‚Äúalong with its object,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rtog pa 'di bshad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rtog pa 'di bshad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the explanation of the effect-representation of mere representation.

original: rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin //
translated: Self-awareness is the effect.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dis rang rig pa tsam gyi 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de don nges pa ni de dngos yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bshad cing rtogs pa bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dis rang rig pa tsam gyi 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de don nges pa ni de dngos yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bshad cing rtogs pa bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This explains that the effect of mere self-awareness is the effect-representation. The text from ‚Äúthat is its actuality‚Äù and so on establishes the understanding that the effect of mere self-awareness is the effect-representation.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi sngar bshad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par rtog pa las 'di 'bras bu rnam par rtog pa gzhan yin no zhes blta bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi sngar bshad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par rtog pa las 'di 'bras bu rnam par rtog pa gzhan yin no zhes blta bar mi bya ste /
translated: The effect-representation of mere representation that was explained earlier should not be viewed as a different effect-representation.

original: de nyid 'dis bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar na re zhig tshad @221a * //
analyzed: de nyid 'dis bstan pa'i phyir ro // de ltar na re zhig tshad @221a * //
translated: This is what is being taught here.

original: ma kun las btus par 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bshad pa la /
analyzed: ma kun las btus par 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bshad pa la /
translated: Thus, in the Compendium of Epistemology, two effect-representations are explained.

original: phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas phyi rol gyi don myong ba 'bras bu yin zhing don med pa la rang rig pa 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas phyi rol gyi don myong ba 'bras bu yin zhing don med pa la rang rig pa 'bras bu yin no //
translated: If external objects are accepted, the experience of external objects is the effect, and if there are no objects, self-awareness is the effect.

original: da ni phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that self-awareness is the effect in regard to external objects, he says:

original: phyi rol don dag yod na yang //
analyzed: phyi rol don dag yod na yang //
translated: Even if external objects exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgcig la blo rnam pa du ma can du 'gyur bas na don yang rnam pa du ma can thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbang gis blo rnam par gzhag pa na rtogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas blo la rnam pa ji srid snang
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gcig la blo rnam pa du ma can du 'gyur bas na don yang rnam pa du ma can thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbang gis blo rnam par gzhag pa na rtogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas blo la rnam pa ji srid snang
translated: and so on.üîΩSince a single thing would have many aspects in cognition, the object would also be obtained as having many aspects.

original: ba de dag thams cad don la brten par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba de dag thams cad don la brten par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When cognition is posited by the power of the object, all the aspects that appear in cognition through the door of different realizations would become dependent on the object.

original: de ltar na don yang rnam pa du ma can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don yang rnam pa du ma can du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the object would also become having many aspects.

original: 'di ni lan nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni lan nyid ma yin te //
translated: This is not a proper response.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'i smra ba'i yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'i smra ba'i yin no //
translated: and so on, is the statement of the philosophical position.

original: lus dang sems kyi 'gyur ba dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'chi ba ston par byed pa ni 'chi ltas yin no //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi 'gyur ba dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'chi ba ston par byed pa ni 'chi ltas yin no //
translated: The signs of death are the changes in body and mind that cause the sensory consciousnesses to become confused.üîΩWhat is non-linking?

original: mtshams sbyor ba med pa yang gang yin zhe na /üîΩrnam pa gzhan nyid du'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba med pa yang gang yin zhe na / rnam pa gzhan nyid du'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is a different type.

original: srog chags kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: srog chags kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i bye brag ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúparticular living being‚Äù refers to a particular animal.

original: rdzas gcig la rgyab kyis phyogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gcig la rgyab kyis phyogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is possible that a particular living being turns away from a single substance.üîΩIf you say that it is when the sense faculty is impaired,üîΩwe would reply that a particular living being turns away from a particular substance.

original: gal te de ni dbang po la gnod pa byas pa la yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du srog chags kyi khyad par rdzas 'ga' zhig la rgyab kyis phyogs pa gang yin pa de dngos po de la sngar dbang po la gnod pa byas
analyzed: gal te de ni dbang po la gnod pa byas pa la yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du srog chags kyi khyad par rdzas 'ga' zhig la rgyab kyis phyogs pa gang yin pa de dngos po de la sngar dbang po la gnod pa byas
translated: The living being turns away from that substance because the sense faculty was previously impaired.

original: pas rgyab kyis phyogs pa de bas na de mthong ba las de'i dran pa sad pas yid kyi shes pa rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang 'brel pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: pas rgyab kyis phyogs pa de bas na de mthong ba las de'i dran pa sad pas yid kyi shes pa rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang 'brel pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness that is associated with the turning away arises from the memory of that substance that is recalled when the living being sees that substance.

original: dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: But the sense consciousness does not change.

original: gal te de phyi rol gyi don la myong ba 'bras bu yin zhing don dang 'dra ba nyid tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de phyi rol gyi don la myong ba 'bras bu yin zhing don dang 'dra ba nyid tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the experience of external objects is the effect of valid knowledge and the likeness to the object is the valid knowledge itself,

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu dag ni yul tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu dag ni yul tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: then the valid knowledge and the effect of the valid knowledge will have different objects.

original: myong ba'i bdag nyid yul nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dang 'dra ba'i don yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: myong ba'i bdag nyid yul nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dang 'dra ba'i don yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because the object of the experience is the object itself, and the object of the likeness to the object is the object itself.

original: de'i phyir don dam par 'di rang rig yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par 'di rang rig yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAlthough ultimately this is reflexive awareness, etc.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang cha 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir don nges pa ni rang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir cha 'di tsam gyis te /
analyzed: 'on kyang cha 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir don nges pa ni rang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir cha 'di tsam gyis te /
translated: However, by this much alone, etc. means that because the ascertainment of the object is of the nature of reflexive awareness, by this much alone,

original: don rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: by the mere cause of the definition of the presentation of the object, etc.

original: nye bar btags nas zhes bya ba ni don rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu @221b yin pa'i phyir don dang 'dra ba zhes nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar btags nas zhes bya ba ni don rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu @221b yin pa'i phyir don dang 'dra ba zhes nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The phrase designating in terms of that means that because it is the cause for positing the object, it is designated as being similar to the object.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gsum pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gsum pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: When external objects are the object of evaluation, etc., this passage explains the third type of effect-based conception.

original: des ni 'di skad du gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don ni gzhal bya yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don ni gzhal bya yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: This is what it says: When external objects are the object of evaluation,

original: yul snang ba 'di'i tshad ma yin //
analyzed: yul snang ba 'di'i tshad ma yin //
translated: then this appearance of the object is the valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung gang yin pa'i gzhung de las 'di tha dad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung gang yin pa'i gzhung de las 'di tha dad par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is the passage from the Compendium of Valid Cognition that is the basis for the statement, and it should be understood that this passage is different from the one cited above.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: When external objects are the object of evaluation,

original: ni'i sgra ni yang gi sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni yang gi sgra'i don yin no //
translated: the word ni has the meaning of the word also.

original: rang rig pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it is the effect of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i tshe sgra khong nas dbyung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra khong nas dbyung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the sound is to be emitted from within.

original: des na dag gi don ni gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don yang gzhal bya yin pa de'i tshe rang rig pa 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na dag gi don ni gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don yang gzhal bya yin pa de'i tshe rang rig pa 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the passage is this: When external objects are also objects of knowledge, then self-awareness is the effect.

original: de bas na 'di 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gsum par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa gsum par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this is the third conception of the effect.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bu nyid du khas len pa de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bu nyid du khas len pa de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Just as external objects are accepted as the object of knowledge, so too the aspect of the apprehender must be accepted as valid knowledge.

original: shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩyul snang 'di yi tshad ma yin //
analyzed: shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir / yul snang 'di yi tshad ma yin //
translated: In order to dispel the qualm of the position that the object of knowledge is internal,üîΩthe passage, ‚ÄúThis appearance of the object is valid knowledge‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di yin no //
translated: is stated.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rang rig pa 'bras bu yin pa la brten pa na yul du snang ba nyid shes pa 'di'i tshad ma nyid yin gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rang rig pa 'bras bu yin pa la brten pa na yul du snang ba nyid shes pa 'di'i tshad ma nyid yin gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When the proponent of external objects relies on self-awareness as the effect, the appearance as the object itself is the valid knowledge of this consciousness, but the aspect of the apprehender is not.

original: ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i rkyen nye ba na zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang snang ba la sogs pa nye ba na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i rkyen nye ba na zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang snang ba la sogs pa nye ba na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen other conditions are present‚Äù means when form, light, and so on are present.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni dbang po med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni dbang po med na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen they are not present‚Äù means when the sense faculties are not present.

original: de ltar re zhig don yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar dbang po dang yid la byed pa nye ba na yang sngon po la sogs pa stong pa'i sa phyogs la shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig don yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar dbang po dang yid la byed pa nye ba na yang sngon po la sogs pa stong pa'i sa phyogs la shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the object is also a cause. Even when the sense faculty and attention are present, a cognition does not arise with respect to an empty place that is devoid of blue and so on.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du nang gi bag chags kyis byas pa la yang 'dir 'bras bu ldog pa brjod par nus mod kyi /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du nang gi bag chags kyis byas pa la yang 'dir 'bras bu ldog pa brjod par nus mod kyi /
translated: As was previously explained, the cessation of the effect can be stated here in terms of the internal residual impression.

original: 'on kyang khas blangs nas de bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khas blangs nas de bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, this is taught by way of an assumption.

original: ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tshad ma nyid yin par 'dod pa 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tshad ma nyid yin par 'dod pa 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe way in which the aspect of apprehension is asserted to be valid knowledge will be explained‚Äù is as follows.

original: de dag tshad ma'i 'bras bu yang //
analyzed: de dag tshad ma'i 'bras bu yang //
translated: The result of valid knowledge

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa myong ba yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa myong ba yin //
translated: Is the experience of the aspect of apprehension.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of apprehension is the valid cognition.

original: snang ba can gang de gzhal bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs dang sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩtshad @222a * //
analyzed: snang ba can gang de gzhal bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs dang sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba la / tshad @222a * //
translated: That which is luminous is the object of cognition.

original: ma kun las btus pa la snang ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ba'i gzhung gi skabs gang yin pa de dang sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma kun las btus pa la snang ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ba'i gzhung gi skabs gang yin pa de dang sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is connected with the context of the passage to be explained, beginning with ‚ÄúThat which is luminous is the object of cognition,‚Äù in the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: gal te sngags la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: gal te sngags la sogs pa yi //
translated: If it is argued that the object of cognition is not established,üîΩbecause it is not established as either one or many,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: then it is replied:üîΩThe object of cognition is not established as either one or many,

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'o //
translated: but it is established as the object of cognition.üîΩIf it is argued that the object of cognition is not established,üîΩbecause it is not established as either one or many,üîΩthen it is replied:üîΩThe object of cognition is not established as either one or many,üîΩbut it is established as the object of cognition.üîΩIf it is argued that the object of cognition is not established,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir don dam par yod pa min yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rig pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid gcig yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir don dam par yod pa min yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rig pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid gcig yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not established as either one or many,üîΩthen it is replied:üîΩThe object of cognition is not established as either one or many,

original: dpag bya dpog pa'i 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: dpag bya dpog pa'i 'bras gnas pa //
translated: but it is established as the object of cognition.üîΩIf it is argued that the object of cognition is not established,üîΩbecause it is not established as either one or many,üîΩthen it is replied:üîΩThe object of cognition is not established as either one or many,üîΩbut it is established as the object of cognition.

original: zhes bya ba la gal te yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di gzhal bya dang 'jal byed la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gal te yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di gzhal bya dang 'jal byed la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that even though it does not exist, it is still the case that the object of evaluation and the means of evaluation are posited.

original: de ltar na yod pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gang la yod pa ste /
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúcharacterized‚Äù means that it is a thing that exists.

original: de kho na nyid du 'dod pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i rtags dngos po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du 'dod pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i rtags dngos po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The reason that characterizes the particular that is accepted as reality is a thing that exists. That is what it means.üîΩFor example, like pleasure and pain, etc.

original: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni de'i khyad par ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni de'i khyad par ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The particular of that is characterized by existence.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa gcig la yang gal te dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa gcig la yang gal te dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, even in the case of a single consciousness, if the particular of the object of inference, etc., were to exist,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du du ma nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du du ma nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: then, like the cognition of pleasure, etc., it would be inferred to be manifold.

original: gal te shes pa yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin na yang gcig nyid du 'dod pa de ltar bde ba la sogs pa la yang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin na yang gcig nyid du 'dod pa de ltar bde ba la sogs pa la yang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is endowed with the special aspect of the existence of consciousness, then pleasure, etc. would also be one, just as you assert consciousness to be.

original: de yang mi 'dod do de ni bde ba la sogs pa gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgcig nyid yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni blo gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo la gcig nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod do de ni bde ba la sogs pa gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gcig nyid yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni blo gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo la gcig nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not accepted, as stated in the line ‚ÄúNor is pleasure, etc. different from consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩIt is not reasonable that it be one, because the nature of consciousness is not twofold.

original: ji ltar blos yongs su gcad pa de ltar ngo bo des de gcig yin par mi rung ngo zhes de skad du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar blos yongs su gcad pa de ltar ngo bo des de gcig yin par mi rung ngo zhes de skad du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not possible for it to be one, as it is discerned by the mind, because it is not reasonable for it to be one, given that it is discerned by the mind in that way.

original: ngo bo gcig mthong ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig mthong ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Because there is no cause for the perception of a single nature. The phrase ‚Äúbecause of error‚Äù is supplied.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir te rang nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir te rang nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That aspect of apprehension is the nature of determination because it is the nature of self-realization.

original: rgyu de'i phyir bdag rig ste /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir bdag rig ste /
translated: For that reason, it is self-awareness.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya bar khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya bar khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The meaning is that the aspect of apprehension is posited.

original: rnam pa 'dis ni rang rig pa 'bras bur gyur pa de @222b rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis ni rang rig pa 'bras bur gyur pa de @222b rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By this method, the aspect of apprehension is posited as the result of self-awareness.

original: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //üîΩde'i bdag yul can dpog pa la //
analyzed: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do // de'i bdag yul can dpog pa la //
translated: That itself is the nature of experience, which is clarity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dis bsdus pa'i don ni shes bya nang gi yin pa'i phyogs la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dis bsdus pa'i don ni shes bya nang gi yin pa'i phyogs la ;
translated: The meaning of this is that the object of awareness is internal.

original: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
translated: The object of evaluation is the evaluator, and the result is the basis.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum sngar bshad pa la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum sngar bshad pa la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is what is to be applied to the assertion of the proponents of external objects that attachment and so on are reflexive awareness, as explained above.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum la shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum la shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba /
translated: The proponents of reflexive awareness assert that the object of knowledge is internal.

original: gzhal bya dang 'jal byed dang 'bras bu bzhag pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya dang 'jal byed dang 'bras bu bzhag pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The presentation of the object of comprehension, the means of comprehension, and the result is the same.

original: de nyid ni de la 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni de la 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: This is explained by ‚ÄúHere, in this regard, ‚Äòmere awareness‚Äô and so on.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSome think that sometimes it is contradictory‚Äù means that

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'dod chags la sogs pa rang rig pa yin no zhes gsungs pas bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang rig pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can la tshad ma nyid du bshad do lo'o //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'dod chags la sogs pa rang rig pa yin no zhes gsungs pas bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang rig pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can la tshad ma nyid du bshad do lo'o //
translated: the master DignƒÅga asserts that attachment and so on are reflexive awareness and explains that reflexive awareness, which has the characteristic of activity, is valid cognition in the sense of being the result.

original: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba rung ba nyid tshad ma nyid du bshad pa de ltar 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba rung ba nyid tshad ma nyid du bshad pa de ltar 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: Now, the master DignƒÅga has explained that the aspect of the apprehender is valid cognition.

original: don la phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is contradictory, because it superimposes the opposite of the fact.üîΩAnd that which is explained as self-awareness

original: rang rig pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This refers to what the master [DignƒÅga] explained as the result, which is the self-awareness of attachment and so on.

original: byed pa byed pa por byas nas //
analyzed: byed pa byed pa por byas nas //
translated: Having made the agent into the action,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rung ba nyid gang gis rang nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyams su myong ba de rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir yin gyi myong ba'i sgra dngos po sgrub pa ma yin no //

translated: Moreover, he presents the verse experience and so on, but does not explain the verse alone, but rather says, The object and the consciousness of that,

original: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
analyzed: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
translated: from the distinction of consciousness, there are two modes.üîΩThe author of the commentary explains, The object and the consciousness of that means

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung 'grel pa byed pa rang nyid yul shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung 'grel pa byed pa rang nyid yul shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: the apprehension of form and so on,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: the consciousness of the eye and so on.

original: yul shes pa dang de shes pa dag gi bye brag ces 'grel pa byed pa kha cig gi zlas dbye ba'i snying po can gyi de'i skyes bu'i drug pa yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: yul shes pa dang de shes pa dag gi bye brag ces 'grel pa byed pa kha cig gi zlas dbye ba'i snying po can gyi de'i skyes bu'i drug pa yin par rtogs so //
translated: Some commentators understand the distinction of the object and the consciousness of that as having a core of disjunction, and as the sixth case of that person.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir @224b rnam pa med pa yin na yang rnam par rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i sgo nas yul shes pa dang de shes pa dag gi bye brag gzhan gyis de'i tshe
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir @224b rnam pa med pa yin na yang rnam par rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i sgo nas yul shes pa dang de shes pa dag gi bye brag gzhan gyis de'i tshe
translated: That is illogical because even though it is devoid of aspects, it is still possible to state the difference between the consciousness that perceives the object and the consciousness that perceives that consciousness through the door of their distinct characteristics, conceptual and nonconceptual consciousnesses.

original: brjod par nus pa de'i phyir bsdu ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir yul shes pa la de'i shes pa ni yul shes pa de'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par nus pa de'i phyir bsdu ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir yul shes pa la de'i shes pa ni yul shes pa de'i shes pa ste /
translated: At that time, in order to demonstrate another type of inclusion, the consciousness that perceives that consciousness that perceives the object is the consciousness that perceives the object and the consciousness that perceives that consciousness.

original: yul shes pa la de'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i bye brag las bdun pa zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yul shes pa la de'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i bye brag las bdun pa zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe consciousness that perceives that consciousness that perceives the object‚Äù is taught to be an inclusion that is a seventh case genitive tatpuru·π£a compound through the difference in application.üîΩThe consciousness that experiences the object transformed into the aspect of the object through the aspect that becomes the object of the consciousness of the object is the consciousness that perceives the object.

original: yul gyi shes pa dmigs par gyur pa'i rnam pa des yul gyi rnam par bsgyur ba nyams su myong ba'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug pa phyis 'byung ba rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ni yul shes pa
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa dmigs par gyur pa'i rnam pa des yul gyi rnam par bsgyur ba nyams su myong ba'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug pa phyis 'byung ba rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ni yul shes pa
translated: The subsequent conceptual consciousness that engages through such characteristics is the consciousness that perceives that consciousness that perceives the object.

original: de'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called the consciousness of that.

original: de ltar bsdu ba la brten nas de'i sgra smos pa 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsdu ba la brten nas de'i sgra smos pa 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, the expression of that is fruitful, based on the inclusion.

original: yul gyi shes pa phyis 'byung ba'i shes pas bzung ba na /
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa phyis 'byung ba'i shes pas bzung ba na /
translated: When the consciousness of the object is apprehended by a subsequent consciousness,

original: yul gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa yul gyi shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis 'dzin par byed do zhes don de bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa yul gyi shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis 'dzin par byed do zhes don de bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: it is apprehended by the aspect of that consciousness of the object, which is related to the aspect of the object.

original: / de ltar na nga'i sngon po shes pa dang ser po shes pa 'byung ba yin no zhes yul gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de ltar na nga'i sngon po shes pa dang ser po shes pa 'byung ba yin no zhes yul gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the consciousness of blue and the consciousness of yellow arise, and the consciousness that apprehends the consciousness of the object that is related to the aspect of the object is apprehended by the consciousness that apprehends that.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yul gyi rnam pa shes pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yul gyi rnam pa shes pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that, he says, ‚Äúthe realization of the consciousness of the aspect of the object.‚Äù

original: yul gyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde nyid bye brag yin te zhes bya ba ni yul gyi shes pa ste shes pa nyid bye brag yin no zhes bya bas ni las 'dzin pa bstan to //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de nyid bye brag yin te zhes bya ba ni yul gyi shes pa ste shes pa nyid bye brag yin no zhes bya bas ni las 'dzin pa bstan to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcognition‚Äù is that it is aware in the aspect of ‚Äúthis is the cognition that experiences the aspect of the object.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThat itself is the difference‚Äù means that the cognition of the object is the cognition itself that is the difference. This shows that it apprehends the object.

original: yul gyi shes pa yul gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid du rang 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pas 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid bye brag yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa yul gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid du rang 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pas 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid bye brag yin te /
translated: That itself is the difference, which is the cognition of the object that is apprehended by the cognition that apprehends it as connected with the aspect of the object.

original: yul shes pa'i shes pa bzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du yul gyi shes pa bye brag tu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul shes pa'i shes pa bzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du yul gyi shes pa bye brag tu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of the object is distinguished by the cognition of the object in the aspect of apprehending the cognition of the object.

original: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don to zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don to zhes smos te /
translated: The meaning is that it is distinguished by the difference of the aspect of experience.

original: yul gyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis shes pa'i shes pa 'jug pa yul shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba de las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis shes pa'i shes pa 'jug pa yul shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba de las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: This is different from the cognition that apprehends the aspect of the experience of the object-cognition.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzung ba nyid kyi sgo nas yul gyi shes pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzung ba nyid kyi sgo nas yul gyi shes pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object-cognition is posited by the apprehension of the aspect of blue, etc.

original: de bas na ji srid du yul gyi rnam pa nyid du yul gyi shes pa rang 'dzin par byed pa na /
analyzed: de bas na ji srid du yul gyi rnam pa nyid du yul gyi shes pa rang 'dzin par byed pa na /
