analyzed: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, Its nature... and so on.

original: sa bon la sogs pa bye brag tu snang ba'i blo la de ma thag tu 'byung zhing skye ba'i zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa bon dang myu gur snang ba dang 'brel pa can gyi blo rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum dangüîΩmi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa bye brag tu snang ba'i blo la de ma thag tu 'byung zhing skye ba'i zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa bon dang myu gur snang ba dang 'brel pa can gyi blo rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase arises immediately after and is born from the mind that appears as the specific seed and so on teaches direct perception and non-observation that establish the relationship between the seed and sprout and the nature of cause and effect.

original: blo rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid can dag kyang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gal ba med do snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: blo rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid can dag kyang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gal ba med do snyam du dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that since the mind that has the characteristic of reflexive awareness is also an entity, there is no contradiction in establishing the nature of cause and effect.

original: ci ltar sa bon las myu gu zhes bya ba skye ba dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po skye bar 'gyur ro @230b zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci ltar sa bon las myu gu zhes bya ba skye ba dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po skye bar 'gyur ro @230b zhes sbyar ro //
translated: As for from a seed, a sprout arises, and so on, the phrase an entity called a sprout is to be supplied.

original: so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the certainty of the individual, means that the certainty of the concomitance and the reverse concomitance of that is followed.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpes bstan pa'i don 'god pa yin te /üîΩsa bon du snang ba can gyi blo rgyur gyur pa yod na zhes bya ba 'dis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpes bstan pa'i don 'god pa yin te / sa bon du snang ba can gyi blo rgyur gyur pa yod na zhes bya ba 'dis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan to //
translated: The statement In that case, . . . and so on sets forth the meaning of the example.üîΩThe phrase if there is the existence of a cognition that appears as a seed as a cause indicates the concomitance and the reverse concomitance.

original: myu gur snang ba can gyi shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur bar rtog pa na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: myu gur snang ba can gyi shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur bar rtog pa na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa la'o //
translated: When one conceives of the arising of a cognition that appears as a sprout, the result is posited.

original: 'gal ba med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin zhing 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa ni yod de blo ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin zhing 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa ni yod de blo ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas sgrub par byed do //
translated: There is no valid cognition that contradicts this, and there is a proof, because the mind is established by the valid cognition of direct perception.üîΩBecause the object is not established,

original: don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis phyi rol gyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de sngar bstan zin to //üîΩrnam par gzhag pa gcig bor nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ci ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par gzhag pa bor nas gzhan phyi rol gyi don rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas phyi rol gyi don ma grub
analyzed: don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis phyi rol gyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de sngar bstan zin to // rnam par gzhag pa gcig bor nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ci ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par gzhag pa bor nas gzhan phyi rol gyi don rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas phyi rol gyi don ma grub
translated: because external objects are not established by direct perception or inference.üîΩHaving abandoned one positing,

original: pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yod pa de ltar shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba'i yang rnam par gzhag pa gcig bor nas te /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yod pa de ltar shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba'i yang rnam par gzhag pa gcig bor nas te /
translated: just as the proponent of external objects has abandoned the positing of consciousness and relied on the positing of external objects, which has the fault of not establishing external objects, in the same way, the proponent of internal objects has also abandoned one positing.

original: phyi rol gyi don du rnam par gzhag pa yongs su btang nas rnam par gzhag pa gzhan la brten pa las 'byung ba can rnam par shes pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa las 'byung ba can yul dang dus nges pa med pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du rnam par gzhag pa yongs su btang nas rnam par gzhag pa gzhan la brten pa las 'byung ba can rnam par shes pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa las 'byung ba can yul dang dus nges pa med pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: Having relinquished the presentation of external objects, it is the consciousness that arises in dependence on the presentation of consciousness only, which has the defining characteristic of not being restricted to a specific place and time.

original: can gyis nyes pa 'di la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: can gyis nyes pa 'di la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: This fault does not apply to the system of consciousness only, which is based on the rejection of external objects and the positing of consciousness as real, because it is not characterized by restriction to specific times and places.

original: skyon sel ba ni rab tu byed pa gzhan la brjod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'di la yang sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon sel ba ni rab tu byed pa gzhan la brjod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'di la yang sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The refutation of this fault is stated in another chapter, and it has already been explained above.

original: du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa sngar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa sngar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition of smoke appears first,

original: dang por rtags yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang por rtags yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sign is ascertained first.

original: phyis rtags kyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa'i mer snang ba can gyi shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na dang por 'bras bu nyid thob pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis rtags kyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa'i mer snang ba can gyi shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na dang por 'bras bu nyid thob pa yin te /
translated: Later, the cognition of fire appears, following the sign. Thus, first the effect is obtained.

original: du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa ni dang por 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa ni dang por 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition that appears as smoke is the effect at first,

original: phyis rgyu yin te mer snang ba can gyi shes pa rgyu nyid du gzhan du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis rgyu yin te mer snang ba can gyi shes pa rgyu nyid du gzhan du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and later it is the cause, because it is accepted elsewhere that the cognition that appears as fire is the cause.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir snga ma ni 'bras bu ma yin zhing zhes bya ba'i lan smos so //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir snga ma ni 'bras bu ma yin zhing zhes bya ba'i lan smos so //
translated: In order to show that this is not reasonable, the response ‚ÄúThe former is not the effect‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtags su gyur pa du ba rtogs pa'i dus na'o //üîΩgang las du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa 'bras bur rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la gal te rtags su gyur pa rtogs pa nyid las sngar @231a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtags su gyur pa du ba rtogs pa'i dus na'o // gang las du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa 'bras bur rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la gal te rtags su gyur pa rtogs pa nyid las sngar @231a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means at the time of understanding the smoke that is the evidence.üîΩFrom what is the cognition that appears as smoke understood to be the effect? If the cognition that appears as fire, which is experienced internally, precedes the understanding of the evidence itself,

original: mer snang ba'i shes pa nang na myong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi du bar snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mer snang ba'i shes pa nang na myong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi du bar snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the cognition that appears as smoke, which has the character of arising later, is understood to be the cause.

original: bag chags ni nang gi nye bar len pa shes pa snga ma'i bdag nyid du phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin zhing gsal ba ni nus pa yin la sad pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags ni nang gi nye bar len pa shes pa snga ma'i bdag nyid du phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin zhing gsal ba ni nus pa yin la sad pa ste /
translated: Habit is the characteristic of the excellence of the prior consciousness in the form of the internal appropriator. The manifestation is the potentiality.

original: skye ba blo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba blo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That cognition in which there is the awakening is called that.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni du bar snang ba can gyi blo ni shes pa thams cad las skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni du bar snang ba can gyi blo ni shes pa thams cad las skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The condensed meaning here is that the cognition that appears as smoke is not produced from all cognitions.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa mer snang ba'i blo rgyun yongs su gyur pas skyed par nus pa gang yin pa de nyid du bar snang ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa mer snang ba'i blo rgyun yongs su gyur pas skyed par nus pa gang yin pa de nyid du bar snang ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: However, that which is able to produce the transformation of the continuum of the cognition that appears as fire is the cause of the appearance of smoke.

original: mer snang ba'i blos rnam par shes pa rgyur gyur pa ma yin pa ni la lar du bar snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mer snang ba'i blos rnam par shes pa rgyur gyur pa ma yin pa ni la lar du bar snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which does not serve as the cause of the cognition that appears as fire is not observed as the cause of the cognition that appears as smoke anywhere.

original: tshang mang la sogs pa mer snang ba'i blo dang bcas par du bar snang ba'i blo yang dag par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshang mang la sogs pa mer snang ba'i blo dang bcas par du bar snang ba'i blo yang dag par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that appears as smoke is observed in the kitchen, etc., along with the cognition that appears as fire.

original: gal te 'o na mer snang ba'i blo nyid du bar snang ba'i rgyu yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: gal te 'o na mer snang ba'i blo nyid du bar snang ba'i rgyu yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: But if you say that the cognition that appears as fire is the cause of the cognition that appears as smoke,

original: mer snang ba skyed par nus pa blo'i khyad par gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mer snang ba skyed par nus pa blo'i khyad par gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then there is no other special cognition that is able to produce the appearance of fire.

original: ma yin te rtags su gyur ba du bar snang ba'i blo ni sngar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can mer snang ba'i blo med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rtags su gyur ba du bar snang ba'i blo ni sngar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can mer snang ba'i blo med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the cognition that appears as smoke, which is the evidence, occurs in the absence of the cognition that appears as fire, which is the antecedent.

original: de bas na gang gi tshe yang mer snang ba de ma thag du bar snang ba'i blo rig pa yin pa de'i tshe yang mer snang ba'i blo bskyed par nus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i blo du ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi tshe yang mer snang ba de ma thag du bar snang ba'i blo rig pa yin pa de'i tshe yang mer snang ba'i blo bskyed par nus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i blo du ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the cognition that appears as smoke is known to immediately follow the cognition that appears as fire, then the cognition called the foundation consciousness, which is able to produce the cognition that appears as fire, is the cause of the cognition that appears as smoke.

original: de bas na rgyud gzhan gyur pa'i sgo nas mer snang ba skyed par nus pa'i rgyun gyi rnam par shes pa las du bar snang ba'i blo 'byung bar rgyun gyi rnam par shes pa rgyur gyur pa mer snang ba skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpogüîΩpar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na rgyud gzhan gyur pa'i sgo nas mer snang ba skyed par nus pa'i rgyun gyi rnam par shes pa las du bar snang ba'i blo 'byung bar rgyun gyi rnam par shes pa rgyur gyur pa mer snang ba skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: The consciousness of the continuum is inferred to be the cause, and the potential to generate the appearance of fire is inferred.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu las rgyu nyid dpog par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu las rgyu nyid dpog par 'gyur ro ;
translated: In that case, the cause is inferred from the effect.

original: / mer snang ba'i blos rang gi nye bar len pa rnam par shes pa snga ma mer snang ba'i blo skyed par byed pa'i nus pa dpog par byed pa'i don gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i me snang ba'i blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / mer snang ba'i blos rang gi nye bar len pa rnam par shes pa snga ma mer snang ba'i blo skyed par byed pa'i nus pa dpog par byed pa'i don gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i me snang ba'i blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition of the appearance of fire infers the prior cognition of the appearance of fire that is its own substantial cause, and it infers the cognition of the appearance of fire that will occur in the future by the meaning of the inference of the potential to generate the cognition of the appearance of fire.

original: du bar snang ba'i blo'i rgyur gyur pa rgyun gyi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma phyi ma phyi mar gyur pas mer snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: du bar snang ba'i blo'i rgyur gyur pa rgyun gyi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma phyi ma phyi mar gyur pas mer snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: because the subsequent moments of the consciousness that is the cause of the cognition of smoke are the cause of the cognition of fire.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbag chags gsal bar sad pa can //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / bag chags gsal bar sad pa can //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: blo nyid kyi go bar byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdu bar snang ba'i blo'i rgyu mer snang ba'i bag chags gsal bar sad pa can de dang rjes su 'brel pa skad cig ma gzhan du yongs su gyur @231b pas mer snang ba'i blo sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skyed par byed
analyzed: blo nyid kyi go bar byed pas zhes bya ba smos te / du bar snang ba'i blo'i rgyu mer snang ba'i bag chags gsal bar sad pa can de dang rjes su 'brel pa skad cig ma gzhan du yongs su gyur @231b pas mer snang ba'i blo sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skyed par byed
translated: the cognition itself, which is the manifestation of the latent impressions.üîΩThe cognition itself, which is the manifestation of the latent impressions of the appearance of fire, the cause of the cognition of smoke, is the cause of the cognition of fire, because it is the transformation into another moment that is connected with that.

original: par nus pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhes rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par nus pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhes rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inferred that it generates the capacity to generate the cognition of fire, the consciousness that appears as burning, boiling, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa byed pas 'gyur gyi zhes bye brag tu smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa byed pas 'gyur gyi zhes bye brag tu smos so //
translated: For this very reason, the author of the commentary says ‚Äúthe transformation.‚Äù

original: de ltar na don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i yang 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i yang 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the one who seeks to engage in the performance of an object‚Äôs function.

original: gags byed pa med pa na 'di na sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs par snang ba'i rgyu med snang ba'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i de lta bu'i bsam pa can 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gags byed pa med pa na 'di na sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs par snang ba'i rgyu med snang ba'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i de lta bu'i bsam pa can 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is no obstruction, the mind perceives the object, and the one who thinks, ‚ÄúHere is the cause of the appearance of burning, cooking, and so on,‚Äù engages in the performance of the object‚Äôs function.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la yang de mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la yang de mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the same for the proponents of external objects.

original: 'di ltar re zhig me gang gis du ba skyed pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i du bas dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig me gang gis du ba skyed pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i du bas dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The fire that generates smoke, which is the effect that is inferred, is past. Therefore it cannot be the capacity for burning and cooking.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ni du ba skyed pa ma yin pa de ltar na ci ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ni du ba skyed pa ma yin pa de ltar na ci ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: That which will arise does not generate smoke. Thus, how could one who seeks to engage in the performance of an object‚Äôs function do so?

original: de bas na des kyang 'di skad du 'bras bur gyur pa'i du ba las rgyur 'dod pa'i me don byed pa don du gnyer ba dag gis dpog par byed pa na 'di ltar dpog par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na des kyang 'di skad du 'bras bur gyur pa'i du ba las rgyur 'dod pa'i me don byed pa don du gnyer ba dag gis dpog par byed pa na 'di ltar dpog par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should say this: ‚ÄúWhen those who seek to perform the function of fire, which is the cause of smoke, which is the effect, infer fire, they should infer in the following way.

original: du ba'i rgyu me gang yin pa de gags byed pa med na me skyed par nus pa yin pa de bas na de las sreg pa dang 'tshed par nus pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur bas na gnod
analyzed: du ba'i rgyu me gang yin pa de gags byed pa med na me skyed par nus pa yin pa de bas na de las sreg pa dang 'tshed par nus pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur bas na gnod
translated: The fire that is the cause of smoke, when there is no obstruction, is able to produce fire. Therefore, fire that is able to burn and cook arises from that.‚Äù

original: pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since one would engage in that kind of conceptualization, one should say that there is no fault.

original: me ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi me'i go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi me'i go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFire is not‚Äù means that external fire is not the subject.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmer snang ba can gyi da ltar blo //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro // mer snang ba can gyi da ltar blo //
translated: That is not established as distinct from consciousness.üîΩ‚ÄúThe present cognition that appears as fire‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba can sreg pa dang 'tshed par nus pa'i blo da ltar gyi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba can sreg pa dang 'tshed par nus pa'i blo da ltar gyi ste /
translated: means the present cognition that appears clearly as fire, which is able to burn and cook.

original: du bar snang ba dang dus mtshungs pa can de ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du bar snang ba dang dus mtshungs pa can de ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, the fire that is simultaneous with the appearance of smoke does not exist.

original: 'on kyang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas rang gi nye bar len par gyur pa sems kyi rgyun mer snang ba'i blo bskyed par nus pa nyid kyi go bar byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas rang gi nye bar len par gyur pa sems kyi rgyun mer snang ba'i blo bskyed par nus pa nyid kyi go bar byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: However, it is the intention that the fire is the cause of the cognition of smoke because it is able to generate a cognition that appears as smoke in a continuum of consciousness that is its own antecedent, in the manner that has been explained.

original: mer snang ba'i blo skyed par nus pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid la skyes pa du bar snang ba'i blo me las skyes pa yin no zhes brjod kyi phyi rol gyi me las kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: mer snang ba'i blo skyed par nus pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid la skyes pa du bar snang ba'i blo me las skyes pa yin no zhes brjod kyi phyi rol gyi me las kyang ma yin la /
translated: The cognition that is able to generate a cognition that appears as smoke is called ‚Äúproduced from fire,‚Äù but not from external fire.

original: mer snang ba'i blo 'ongs kyang 'byung ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mer snang ba'i blo 'ongs kyang 'byung ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it from the mere appearance of smoke.

original: gang gis na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtags pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: gang gis na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtags pa'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù refers to the time of the inference.

original: du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa ste dmigs par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa ste dmigs par gyur pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that has smoke as its object‚Äù means that it has as its object the appearance of smoke.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi blo ni mer snang ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi blo ni mer snang ba'o //
translated: The cognition that has that kind of appearance is the appearance of fire.

original: blo med pa'i phyir sems @232a * //
analyzed: blo med pa'i phyir sems @232a * //
translated: because it would not have the mind,

original: bskyed par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur te skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur te skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be a mind that generates, because it would not be born.

original: gal te mer snang ba'i blo las du bar snang ba'i blo skye bar 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mer snang ba'i blo las du bar snang ba'i blo skye bar 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that the mind that appears as smoke arises from the mind that appears as fire, then this error would ensue.

original: mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid kyi sems kyi rgyun gyis du bar snang ba'i blo skyed par byed pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid kyi sems kyi rgyun gyis du bar snang ba'i blo skyed par byed pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The mind that is capable of generating the cognition that appears as fire generates the cognition that appears as smoke, but not all minds do so.

original: bstan pa'i phyir de lta na /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir de lta na /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúIn that case, it is reasonable that the latent impressions

original: de rung bag chags snying po can //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de rung bag chags snying po can // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that are its essence would generate it.‚Äù

original: snying po'i sgra ni rnam par 'grel pa skye ba'i rgyu dang rten zhes bya ba rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: snying po'i sgra ni rnam par 'grel pa skye ba'i rgyu dang rten zhes bya ba rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúessence‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúcause‚Äù and ‚Äúbasis‚Äù of the manifestation.

original: mer snang ba skyed par dung ba'i bag chags sems kyi bdag nyid phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi snying po skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen skad cig ma snga ma snga ma phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyun gang la yod pa de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mer snang ba skyed par dung ba'i bag chags sems kyi bdag nyid phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi snying po skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen skad cig ma snga ma snga ma phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyun gang la yod pa de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúessence‚Äù is the seed of the habitual propensity to generate the appearance of fire, which is the nature of mind. The ‚Äústream‚Äù is the succession of earlier and later moments that are the causes and conditions for the arising of that essence.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma gyur pas mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyun gyis du bar snang ba'i shes pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma gyur pas mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyun gyis du bar snang ba'i shes pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ‚Äústream‚Äù of the later and later moments is able to generate the consciousness that appears as smoke, by the stream that is able to generate the consciousness that appears as fire. This is what it means.

original: rgyu de'i phyir me las du ba yin //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir me las du ba yin //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of that cause, smoke is from fire.‚Äù

original: me las zhes bya ba ni mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid me yin te /
analyzed: me las zhes bya ba ni mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid me yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom fire‚Äù means that the appropriating consciousness that is able to generate the consciousness that appears as fire is fire.

original: de las byung ba na du bar snang ba can gyi blo me las 'byung ba yin no zhes brjod kyi phyi rol gyi me'am mer snang ba'i blo las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las byung ba na du bar snang ba can gyi blo me las 'byung ba yin no zhes brjod kyi phyi rol gyi me'am mer snang ba'i blo las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it arises from that, the cognition that appears as smoke is said to arise from fire, but not from external fire or from a cognition that appears as fire.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir du bar snang ba'i blo dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas de'i phyir rang gi rgyu nyid kyi mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid kyi chos rjes su dpog par byed pa de bas na 'bras bu nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir du bar snang ba'i blo dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas de'i phyir rang gi rgyu nyid kyi mer snang ba can gyi shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid kyi chos rjes su dpog par byed pa de bas na 'bras bu nyid
translated: Because it is dependent on a single collection with the cognition that appears as smoke, therefore one infers the property of being suitable to produce the cognition that appears as fire, which is its own cause. Thus,

original: las rgyu rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: las rgyu rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
translated: the effect is inferred from the cause.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in order to show that the effect is not inferred from the cause.

original: bag chags gsal bar sad pa'i snying po can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te mer snang ba'i blos rgyu thag nye ba nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag chags gsal bar sad pa'i snying po can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te mer snang ba'i blos rgyu thag nye ba nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase having the essence of the clear manifestation of latent impressions means that the cognition that appears as fire infers the proximity of the cause.

original: dper na tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa gzugs la sogs pa ros te /
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa gzugs la sogs pa ros te /
translated: For example, in the case of a single collection, form, etc. are dependent on the eye, etc.üîΩThe inference of the object of the cause is the inference of the subsequent cause.

original: rgyus rtogs pa rgyu chos rjes su dpag pa ste zhes bya ba de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rgyus rtogs pa rgyu chos rjes su dpag pa ste zhes bya ba de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary.

original: mkhas rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag pa'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba can rnam par shes par smra bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: mkhas rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag pa'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba can rnam par shes par smra bar ston par byed do //
translated: By the wise he shows that they follow the correct scriptures and are Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsod pa la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brtsad pa ni yang dag par rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsod pa la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brtsad pa ni yang dag par rtsod pa ste /
translated: Without regard for correct debate means that correct debate is correct argument.

original: tshad ma'i grogs can nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma'i grogs can nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba ste /
translated: Because it is accompanied by valid cognition, it is Vij√±aptimƒÅtra.

original: de la ltos pa med par rngams te smra bas phyi rol @232b gyi don la brten nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med par rngams te smra bas phyi rol @232b gyi don la brten nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is spoken with pride without regard for that, it is based on external objects and is expressed.

original: brten nas zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni khas blangs nas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni khas blangs nas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Based on is an explanation of accepting.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mi gsal ba 'dren ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di las so //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mi gsal ba 'dren ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di las so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the terms ‚Äúunclear,‚Äù ‚Äúmixed,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyin ci log pa'i kha don tu snang ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni dung dkar po la sogs pa ci ltar snang ba bzhin gyi kha dog dkar po las phyin ci log la sogs par snang bar mig ser can dag gi shes pas rjes su rtogs pa'i
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i kha don tu snang ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni dung dkar po la sogs pa ci ltar snang ba bzhin gyi kha dog dkar po las phyin ci log la sogs par snang bar mig ser can dag gi shes pas rjes su rtogs pa'i
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe appearance of an object that is the opposite of what it is‚Äù means that the consciousness of someone with jaundice perceives a white conch shell and so on as having the color yellow, which is the opposite of its color.

original: phyir ro // gsal ba mi gsal ba dang 'dren ma la sogs pa'i khyad par kha dog mtshungs pa nyid la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // gsal ba mi gsal ba dang 'dren ma la sogs pa'i khyad par kha dog mtshungs pa nyid la brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe difference in the clarity of the object‚Äù means that the object is either clear, unclear, or mixed.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni kha dog gzhan bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni kha dog gzhan bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to other colors.

original: don dam par gcig pa nyid khas blang bar bya ba yin pa de yang lhag ma rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa de ltar na yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par gcig pa nyid khas blang bar bya ba yin pa de yang lhag ma rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa de ltar na yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa grub pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe ultimate identity of the object and consciousness‚Äù means that the object and consciousness are ultimately the same.

original: de bas na rang las rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i 'dzin pa'i tshul gnyis pa can nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang las rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i 'dzin pa'i tshul gnyis pa can nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the nature of the cognition is twofold, that is, the apprehender.

original: de ni cha 'ga' zhig gis ni zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: de ni cha 'ga' zhig gis ni zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la sogs pa las so //
translated: ‚Äú In part‚Äù means in terms of shape, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod na yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod na yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Even if there were another cause, it would not be different‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúif there were no cause as desired.‚Äù

original: dbang po dang snang ba dang yid la byed pas bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i yul sa phyogs 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa'i shes pa bum pa la sogs pa la med par skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po dang snang ba dang yid la byed pas bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i yul sa phyogs 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa'i shes pa bum pa la sogs pa la med par skyed par byed do //
translated: The cognition that perceives only the place, which is empty of a pot, etc., is produced without a pot, etc., by the sense faculty, the light, and the mental activity.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang gal te de la ltos pa med par nus par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa de yang bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs la ci'i phyir skyed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang gal te de la ltos pa med par nus par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa de yang bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs la ci'i phyir skyed par mi 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, if the cognition of a pot, etc., were capable of arising without depending on that, then why would that cognition of a pot, etc., not be produced in the place that is empty of a pot, etc.?

original: de ltar na de la ltos pa med pa dag gi shes pa gzhan la nus nyid mthong ba ga la te de dag rnam pa thams cad du shes pa skyed pa'i nus pas stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyu gzhan gyi nus pa nyid yod parüîΩmi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de la ltos pa med pa dag gi shes pa gzhan la nus nyid mthong ba ga la te de dag rnam pa thams cad du shes pa skyed pa'i nus pas stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyu gzhan gyi nus pa nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are empty of the potential to generate consciousness in every way, then at that time, the potential of other causes would not exist.

original: gang gi phyir bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs la bum pa'i shes pa skyed par mi byed cing de dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs la skyed par byed pa de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa lhan cig pa de dag nyid kyi nus pa nyid yin no zhes rtogsüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs la bum pa'i shes pa skyed par mi byed cing de dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs la skyed par byed pa de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa lhan cig pa de dag nyid kyi nus pa nyid yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because a cognition of a vase does not arise in relation to a place devoid of a vase, but it does arise in relation to a place that possesses a vase, therefore it is ascertained that the potential of those coexistent vases and so on is the cause of the cognition of a vase.

original: ltos par bya ba dang bcas pa dang nye ba dag gis de tsam gyi rgyu can yin par zhes bya ba ni gang med na gzhan dag nye ba na yod na yang 'bras bu mi skye ba ni gang gi tshe ltos par bya ba gzhan de dang bcas
analyzed: ltos par bya ba dang bcas pa dang nye ba dag gis de tsam gyi rgyu can yin par zhes bya ba ni gang med na gzhan dag nye ba na yod na yang 'bras bu mi skye ba ni gang gi tshe ltos par bya ba gzhan de dang bcas
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they possess that which is relied on and that which is near‚Äù means that if something does not exist, then even if other things that possess it are near, the effect will not arise. When another thing that is relied on is present,

original: pa ste / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu nye bar 'gyur ba de dang @233a * //
analyzed: pa ste / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu nye bar 'gyur ba de dang @233a * //
translated: and the other causes that are present,

original: ldan pa de tsam gyi rgyu can gyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa de tsam gyi rgyu can gyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: are the causes of that much effect.

original: gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not see concomitance and reverse concomitance.üîΩIf there is no moon, etc.,

original: zla ba la sogs pa med na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don du snang ba la grags pa'i zla ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa med na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don du snang ba la grags pa'i zla ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: means that the moon, etc., which are renowned as external objects, do not exist.

original: ci ltar 'di ni 'bras bu ldog pa'i phyir mthong bar nus pa can nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pa bden pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar 'di ni 'bras bu ldog pa'i phyir mthong bar nus pa can nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pa bden pa'o //
translated: How is it possible to see that the effect is absent when the cause is present?

original: 'bras bu ldog pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pas stong ba'i sa phyogs na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dag yod na yang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pas stong ba'i sa phyogs na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dag yod na yang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the effect is absent when the cause is present, because even when the causes of the moon, etc., are present, the effect, the moon, etc., do not exist.üîΩSimilarly, the circle of fire, etc.,

original: de bzhin dug zhan dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni mar me las gzhan pa ni'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dug zhan dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni mar me las gzhan pa ni'o //
translated: means that the circle of fire, etc., which are different from the lamp, do not exist.

original: gal te mar me yod na yang mig mi gsal ba la sogs pa dag la dkyil 'khor du snang ba can gyi shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mthong bar nus pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mar me yod na yang mig mi gsal ba la sogs pa dag la dkyil 'khor du snang ba can gyi shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mthong bar nus pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cognition of the circle does not arise in the case of those whose eyes are not clear, even when the lamp exists, then it would be possible to see it.

original: mar me tsam gyi blo yod phyir //
analyzed: mar me tsam gyi blo yod phyir //
translated: The cognition of the lamp alone exists,

original: gnyi ga dag kyang rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga dag kyang rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and the lamp and the cognition of the lamp are not causes of each other.

original: sngon po dang ser po mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po lhan cig mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po lhan cig mthong ba ste /
translated: Just as one sees blue and yellow together,

original: sngon po dang ser po 'ba' zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po 'ba' zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: but not just blue and yellow alone, following the presence or absence of the other.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: gnyi ga dag gi yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga dag gi yang ngo //
translated: The cognition of the lamp and the lamp are the causes of each other.

original: gcig nyid kyi zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi phyi ma tha dad pa med pa yin pa zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi phyi ma tha dad pa med pa yin pa zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù in the verse is explained by the word ‚Äúseparately‚Äù in the commentary.

original: gnod pa ma byas par mtshungs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la mtshungs pa yang de yin la /üîΩdbang po la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ma byas par mtshungs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la mtshungs pa yang de yin la / dbang po la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the compound is: ‚Äúendowed with faculties, etc. that are similar and not impaired.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúSimilar‚Äù and ‚Äúendowed with faculties, etc.‚Äù are the two components of the compound.

original: yang gnod pa ma byas pa'i sgra ngang las 'dzin pa nyid bya'o //
analyzed: yang gnod pa ma byas pa'i sgra ngang las 'dzin pa nyid bya'o //
translated: Or, the meaning of the compound is: ‚Äúendowed with faculties, etc. that are not impaired.‚Äù

original: de nas skyes bu gang dag la de yod pa zhes bya ba ldan pa'i don can bya'o //üîΩnye ba dang shin tu nye bar gnas pa dag la zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar gnas pas nye ba dang shin tu nye bar gnas pa dag la ste /
analyzed: de nas skyes bu gang dag la de yod pa zhes bya ba ldan pa'i don can bya'o // nye ba dang shin tu nye bar gnas pa dag la zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar gnas pas nye ba dang shin tu nye bar gnas pa dag la ste /
translated: Then, the meaning of the compound is: ‚Äúthose persons who have that.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThose who are near and very near‚Äù means those who are near and very near because they are situated nearby.

original: nye ba dang ches shin tu nye bar gnas pa dag la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye ba dang ches shin tu nye bar gnas pa dag la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: those who are near and very far.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no //
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: de ltar na gnas pa zhes shin tu ring bar gnas pa dag la zhes bya ba la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas pa zhes shin tu ring bar gnas pa dag la zhes bya ba la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúthose who are situated very far away‚Äù should also be considered.

original: de ltar na mdo mdzad pas nye ba dang ring ba'i khyad par gyis yang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir don 'di brjod par bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mdo mdzad pas nye ba dang ring ba'i khyad par gyis yang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir don 'di brjod par bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the author of the sutra intends to express this meaning by applying the terms near and far.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang ches gsal ba dang mi gsal bas zhes bya ba dag gis ches gsal ba dang ches shin tu gsal ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang ches gsal ba dang mi gsal bas zhes bya ba dag gis ches gsal ba dang ches shin tu gsal ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The terms clear, unclear, clearer, and less clear should be viewed as referring to very clear and very unclear.

original: 'di ltar 'di thag ring por gnas pas mi @233b gsal ba dang / ches ring por gnas pas ches mi gsal ba dang / ches shin tu ring por gnas pas ches shin tu mi gsal bar zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di thag ring por gnas pas mi @233b gsal ba dang / ches ring por gnas pas ches mi gsal ba dang / ches shin tu ring por gnas pas ches shin tu mi gsal bar zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be applied as follows: unclear because it is located far away, less clear because it is located very far away, and very unclear because it is located extremely far away.

original: de bzhin du thag nye ba na gnas pas gsal ba dang shin tu nye ba na gnas pas shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thag nye ba na gnas pas gsal ba dang shin tu nye ba na gnas pas shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, clear because it is located near, very clear because it is located very near, and so on.

original: de chod ma chod pa yin na //
analyzed: de chod ma chod pa yin na //
translated: It is obstructed or not.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: This is the classification of the definite.

original: re zhig de dag gi nang nas kyang ma chod pa'i phyogs kyi skyon bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gi nang nas kyang ma chod pa'i phyogs kyi skyon bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the time being, we will show the fault of the position that is not refuted by any of them.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni snang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni snang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúillumination‚Äù is explained as follows:

original: don bzhin du tha dad pa rnyed par dka' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te snang ba yang gcig yin pa de'i tshe gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid mi rung ngo //üîΩci ste du ma nyid yin pa de lta na yang rdul phran tha dad pa nyid kyi bye brag med pa'i phyir gang las thag ring po na gnas pa'i lta ba bo'i gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag yin /
analyzed: don bzhin du tha dad pa rnyed par dka' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te snang ba yang gcig yin pa de'i tshe gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid mi rung ngo // ci ste du ma nyid yin pa de lta na yang rdul phran tha dad pa nyid kyi bye brag med pa'i phyir gang las thag ring po na gnas pa'i lta ba bo'i gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag yin /
translated: It is difficult to find a difference in illumination that corresponds to a difference in the object. If illumination is one, then it is not possible for it to have a clear and unclear nature.üîΩIf it is many, then, because there is no difference in the atoms, how can there be a clear and unclear appearance of an object that is distant?

original: snang ba la yang de yod /
analyzed: snang ba la yang de yod /
translated: There is no difference in the illumination of the object.

original: nye ba na srab pa nyid yod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye ba na srab pa nyid yod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is close, it is thin.

original: 'di ltar snang ba'i don nye ba'i snang ba chung ba la chung ba nyid kyis srab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba'i don nye ba'i snang ba chung ba la chung ba nyid kyis srab pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, the illumination of an object that is close is small, and because it is small, it is thin.

original: de lta ma yin na rdul la sogs pa yang nye ba na yod pa ji ltar na srab pa nyid yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rdul la sogs pa yang nye ba na yod pa ji ltar na srab pa nyid yin par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could subtle atoms, etc. be subtle when they are close by?

original: thag ring po bzhin du nye ba la yang sgrib par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni snang ba srab pa sgrib par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thag ring po bzhin du nye ba la yang sgrib par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni snang ba srab pa sgrib par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as they are far away, they would also obscure when they are close by.

original: gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni snang ba la zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni snang ba la zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúin the other‚Äù is an explanatory gloss for the term ‚Äúin the illumination.‚Äù

original: sgrib par byed pa dag la sad gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa dag la sad gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the obscuring cause is the illumination, the illumination is obscured.

original: srab pa med ces bya ba ni phal cher srab pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srab pa med ces bya ba ni phal cher srab pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout subtlety‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout much subtlety.‚Äù

original: de tsam pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba dang ring ba la sogs pa'i lta ba po'i khyad par gyis tha dad pa rnams so //
analyzed: de tsam pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba dang ring ba la sogs pa'i lta ba po'i khyad par gyis tha dad pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto that extent‚Äù refers to the differences in the observer‚Äôs position, whether close or far away.

original: de ltar na chos dang chos ma yin pa ston par byed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa'i don de ni chos su ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na chos dang chos ma yin pa ston par byed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa'i don de ni chos su ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, in the phrase ‚Äúteaching Dharma and non-Dharma,‚Äù etc., that which is beneficial is taught as Dharma, in the sense that it generates mental pleasure.

original: yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i sgo nas gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa bar bya ba yin pa de ltar na zlog pas chos ma yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i sgo nas gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa bar bya ba yin pa de ltar na zlog pas chos ma yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That which is harmful is taught as non-Dharma, in the sense that it generates mental displeasure.

original: de dag ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos dang chos ma yin pa phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can thams cad la phan pa dang gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrub par byed cing skyed par @234a * //
analyzed: de dag ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos dang chos ma yin pa phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // sems can thams cad la phan pa dang gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrub par byed cing skyed par @234a * //
translated: Dharma and non-Dharma have the characteristics of being beneficial and harmful, respectively, because they are the causes and effects of benefit and harm, respectively.

original: byed pas na sgrub par byed pa can te 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byed pas na sgrub par byed pa can te 'bras bu'o //
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúbeneficial and harmful to all sentient beings,‚Äù etc., the result is that which is accomplished and generated by the means of accomplishment.

original: las gang la phan pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa byed pa yod pa'am //
analyzed: las gang la phan pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa byed pa yod pa'am //
translated: Karma is called ‚Äúproductive‚Äù when it produces the effect of benefit or harm.

original: las gang la sems can la phan pa dang gnod pa sgrub par byed cing skyed par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: las gang la sems can la phan pa dang gnod pa sgrub par byed cing skyed par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Karma is called ‚Äúproductive‚Äù when it produces and generates benefit or harm for sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang gnod pa sgrub par byed pa can gyi las gang yin pa de bdag por byas pa las byung ba'i rta'i kha'i me yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang gnod pa sgrub par byed pa can gyi las gang yin pa de bdag por byas pa las byung ba'i rta'i kha'i me yin te /
translated: Karma that produces benefit or harm for all sentient beings is like the fire at the end of the cosmic age, since it arises from the dominant result.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The world of sentient beings and the physical world arise from virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: thams cad la gnod par byed pa'am phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad la gnod par byed pa'am phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: It would not produce benefit or harm for all,

original: yul bskal pa na gnas pa dag la gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul bskal pa na gnas pa dag la gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because neither benefit nor harm would exist for those in the highest realm.

original: de bas na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ston par byed pa dag yin pa de ltar na 'di nges pa ma yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bas na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ston par byed pa dag yin pa de ltar na 'di nges pa ma yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, since Dharma and non-Dharma are shown to be that which causes harm and that which causes benefit, it is not certain that they are the cause of the world.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: Here, the response is ‚ÄúEven though they are not the cause of the world, etc.‚Äù

original: rim gyis byed pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rim gyis byed pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are the cause of harm and benefit‚Äù means that they are the cause of harm and benefit in sequence.

original: gang gi tshe skye ba brgyud pas ring por gnas pa yin na yang de yul rung ba na gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba brgyud pas ring por gnas pa yin na yang de yul rung ba na gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they endure for a long time through the continuity of birth, when they are in a suitable place, then harm and benefit exist.

original: snang ba tha dad pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni chos dang chos ma yin pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni chos dang chos ma yin pa bzung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent appearances, etc.‚Äù The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rang gi ngo bo shes pa skyed par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rang gi ngo bo shes pa skyed par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: Direct perception and non-direct perception are so called because when it generates the cognition of its own nature,

original: mngon sum gyi yin zhing rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa na mngon sum ma yin pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yin zhing rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa na mngon sum ma yin pa'i yin no //
translated: it is direct perception, but when it generates a conceptual cognition, it is non-direct perception.

original: shes pa dang sgra dang mar me smos pa ni de rnams ni gzhan dag kyang skad cig ma nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdus mtshungs pa can ni 'bras bu bsgrub pa la nus pa med pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'bras bu dang rgyu dus mtshungs pa can yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes pa dang sgra dang mar me smos pa ni de rnams ni gzhan dag kyang skad cig ma nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro // dus mtshungs pa can ni 'bras bu bsgrub pa la nus pa med pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'bras bu dang rgyu dus mtshungs pa can yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: The terms cognition, sound, and flame are mentioned because others accept that they are momentary.üîΩSince those that are simultaneous with it are not capable of establishing the effect,

original: rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu yang grub pa de ltar na rgyu nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu yang grub pa de ltar na rgyu nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: when the effect and cause are simultaneous, then at the time of the cause, the effect is already established, and in that case, the cause is not capable.

original: gang phyir shes las med gsal yin //
analyzed: gang phyir shes las med gsal yin //
translated: Because the object is not clearly manifest from the cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir shes pa las yul med pa gsal ba ste rab tu gsal ba yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir shes pa las yul med pa gsal ba ste rab tu gsal ba yin par 'gyur /
translated: This is saying, ‚ÄúBecause the object is not clearly manifest from the cognition, it is clearly manifest, that is, very clearly manifest.‚Äù

original: de bas na sgra la sogs pa'i de ma thag pa'i shes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na sgra la sogs pa'i de ma thag pa'i shes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the immediately preceding object of consciousness, such as sound,

original: sgra la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa sgra la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma gang yin pa des bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa sgra la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma gang yin pa des bskyed pa'o //
translated: is the cause of the later consciousness that has the mode of the cause of sound, etc. It is produced by the former moment of sound, etc., which is the cause of consciousness.üîΩThat which is produced by a cause becomes manifest as just the same type as that cause.

original: gang @234b gi rgyus bskyed pa de dang rigs mthun pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa des bskyed pa'i shes pa'i rgyu de nyid dang rigs mthun pa de nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang @234b gi rgyus bskyed pa de dang rigs mthun pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa des bskyed pa'i shes pa'i rgyu de nyid dang rigs mthun pa de nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is produced by the cause of consciousness becomes manifest as just the same type as that cause of consciousness.

original: de'i rgyu'i de ma thag tu yod pa don dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa de'i rgyu skad cig ma nga mar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i ngang tshul de dang rigs mthun
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i de ma thag tu yod pa don dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa de'i rgyu skad cig ma nga mar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i ngang tshul de dang rigs mthun
translated: The consciousness that has the mode of existing simultaneously with the object, which is the cause of that, is the cause of consciousness that has the mode of arising in the next moment as the object. It becomes manifest as just the same type as that cause.

original: pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa'i don te /
analyzed: pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is included in the second moment of consciousness.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of arising simultaneously with that is so-called.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i don //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i don //
translated: Thus, the meaning of arising simultaneously

original: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don to //
translated: is the meaning of an object that arises simultaneously with consciousness, having the nature of arising in the second moment.üîΩBy having the same cause,

original: rgyu gcig pa can gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang rgyu mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: rgyu gcig pa can gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang rgyu mtshungs pas so //
translated: means by having the same cause as consciousness.üîΩThat which is similar to the arising of consciousness and the object that arises in the second moment from the previous moment of consciousness, and produces the third moment,

original: dus sngar gyi skad cig ma las skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don skyes pa dang shes pa 'dra ba skad cig ma gsum par byed pa gang yin pa de bas na dus snga ma skad cig ma gnyis pa bsdus pa'i don dang
analyzed: dus sngar gyi skad cig ma las skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don skyes pa dang shes pa 'dra ba skad cig ma gsum par byed pa gang yin pa de bas na dus snga ma skad cig ma gnyis pa bsdus pa'i don dang
translated: is the object included in the second moment of the previous time.

original: dus mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is simultaneous with consciousness.

original: skad cig ma dang por 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don nyid las 'dra ba nyid skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang por 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don nyid las 'dra ba nyid skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the very object that arises in the first moment gives rise to a subsequent state that is similar to it.

original: t'i k'a byed pa kha cig ni 'di ltar khas len te /
analyzed: t'i k'a byed pa kha cig ni 'di ltar khas len te /
translated: Some logicians accept this as follows.üîΩThe cognition of the object

original: yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
analyzed: yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
translated: is from the particular of that cognition.

original: bye brag las zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'dis yul du snang ba dang rang snang ba dag gis tshul gnyis nyid grub pa yin zhing /
analyzed: bye brag las zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'dis yul du snang ba dang rang snang ba dag gis tshul gnyis nyid grub pa yin zhing /
translated: By this reasoning called ‚Äúfrom the particular,‚Äù the two modes of the appearance of the object and the appearance of itself are established.

original: dus phyis dran pa las kyang yin //
analyzed: dus phyis dran pa las kyang yin //
translated: And also from memory later.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du shes pa nyid myong ba dang myong bar byed pa de nyid du grub pa yin no zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du shes pa nyid myong ba dang myong bar byed pa de nyid du grub pa yin no zhes rtogs so //
translated: This establishes that cognition itself experiences and is experienced by the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rigs pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rigs pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to clarify that, he says, by this reasoning, etc.

original: dus phyis dran pa las kyang yin //
analyzed: dus phyis dran pa las kyang yin //
translated: And also from memory later.

original: tshul gnyis pa nyid yin no zhes sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa mdzad pas so //
analyzed: tshul gnyis pa nyid yin no zhes sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa mdzad pas so //
translated: This is the application of the two modes.

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba gcig la ltos nas gtan tshigs gzhan sdud pa 'thad pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba gcig la ltos nas gtan tshigs gzhan sdud pa 'thad pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable to include other reasons in relation to a single probandum.üîΩThis is also indicated by ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of the object,‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang yul du snang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rnam pa mi 'dod pa de ltar na des tshul gnyis pa nyid rab tu grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de yang yul du snang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rnam pa mi 'dod pa de ltar na des tshul gnyis pa nyid rab tu grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin pa'i phyir
translated: Since this is already indicated by ‚Äúin that case, the two modes are established by that,‚Äù and so on,

original: ro // spyir bshad pa sngar yang yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ro // spyir bshad pa sngar yang yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the general explanation is given again.

original: yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
analyzed: yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
translated: The object and the consciousness of that

original: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis @235a * //
analyzed: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis @235a * //
translated: are the two modes due to their specific features.

original: nyid // ces bshad pa 'dir tshul gnyis pa'i sgra ni spyi'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid // ces bshad pa 'dir tshul gnyis pa'i sgra ni spyi'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äútwo modes‚Äù is used because it is the general cause.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of a digression is not the primary nature.

original: de ltar ni de bas na shes pa'i tshul gnyis nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gtso bo bstan nas rang rig pa nyid ni tshul gnyis pa nyid kyi zhar la 'ongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ni de bas na shes pa'i tshul gnyis nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gtso bo bstan nas rang rig pa nyid ni tshul gnyis pa nyid kyi zhar la 'ongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, since the two modes of knowledge do not exist, the primary topic is taught, and reflexive awareness is a secondary topic, because it is a consequence of the two modes.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid yin na ni bshad pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid yin na ni bshad pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the probandum were different, the explanation would be illogical.

original: gal te myong ba dang myong bar byed pa'i tshul gyis tshul gnyis pa nyid bzhed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te myong ba dang myong bar byed pa'i tshul gyis tshul gnyis pa nyid bzhed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the two modes were accepted in terms of the mode of experience and the experiencer,

original: de'i phyir tshul gnyis pa nyid yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba 'dis rang rig pa bshad par 'gyur ba de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba gzhan yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul gnyis pa nyid yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba 'dis rang rig pa bshad par 'gyur ba de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba gzhan yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the statement ‚ÄúThus, since the two modes do not exist‚Äù would not be a statement of reflexive awareness, and in that case the probandum would not be different.

original: myong med par ni de ma yin //
analyzed: myong med par ni de ma yin //
translated: It is not without experience.

original: zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa gzhan 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa gzhan 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not without experience‚Äù would not be an explanation of another proof.

original: gal te rang rig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If reflexive awareness were something to be established as being different,

original: de'i tshul gnyis pa nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa dag gi don gyi grub pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i tshul gnyis pa nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa dag gi don gyi grub pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: then it would be appropriate to state other proofs of its dual character, having first demonstrated the establishment of the meaning of the two proofs.

original: yang rang dbang du sgrub par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan brjod pa yin na mdzes par 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: yang rang dbang du sgrub par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan brjod pa yin na mdzes par 'gyur ro / // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: But if you state other proofs that are independent, that would be quite absurd.

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bo can gyi khyad par gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las bye brag tu gyur pas na khyad par ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bo can gyi khyad par gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las bye brag tu gyur pas na khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of apprehending the aspect of the object‚Äù means that it is a distinction because it is differentiated from the aspect of apprehension.

original: yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa ni bris pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa ni bris pa'o //
translated: Apprehending the aspect of the object is the drawing.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo ste rang bzhin khyad par gang la yod pa de'i khyad par des so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo ste rang bzhin khyad par gang la yod pa de'i khyad par des so //
translated: That is its nature, and the distinction that has that as its nature is by that distinction.

original: phan tshun tha dad par zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa dang ser po'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad par ro //üîΩde ltar yin gyi de lta min //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad par zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa dang ser po'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad par ro // de ltar yin gyi de lta min //
translated: ‚ÄúMutually different‚Äù means that the consciousness of blue is different from the consciousness of yellow, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa yin gyi ser po'i shes pa ma yin no zhe'o //üîΩde lta na yang tha dad par //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa yin gyi ser po'i shes pa ma yin no zhe'o // de lta na yang tha dad par //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is so, not otherwise‚Äù means that it is the consciousness of blue, not the consciousness of yellow.

original: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma re rer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma re rer ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so, it is different‚Äù means that it is different in each moment.

original: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba de bshad par bzhed pa de nyid kyi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba de bshad par bzhed pa de nyid kyi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-cognition‚Äù is what is to be explained. Therefore, it is said, ‚Äújust explained,‚Äù and so on.

original: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: ‚ÄúBy the definition of recognition, and so on‚Äù means

original: yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
analyzed: yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
translated: the object and the consciousness of that

original: bye brag las shes bya ba de //
analyzed: bye brag las shes bya ba de //
translated: are known from the distinction.

original: ngo shes pa yi sgra bshad do //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yi sgra bshad do //
translated: That is the explanation of recognition.

original: de ltar na yul shes pa'i yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa'i shes pas ngo shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yul shes pa'i yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa'i shes pas ngo shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the consciousness of the object is recognized by the consciousness that is the form of the consciousness of the object.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus phyis dran pa las yin zhes bya ba 'di bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus phyis dran pa las yin zhes bya ba 'di bzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the following: ‚ÄúIt is from memory that one knows that there was a prior experience.‚Äù

original: de yang myong ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni don dang @235b 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de yang myong ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni don dang @235b 'dra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is also an experience‚Äù means that it is similar to the object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa myong bar 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa myong bar 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one does not accept that the form of the object is experienced.

original: gal te shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa don dang 'dra ba myong ba yin pa de bas na shes pa yang myong ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa don dang 'dra ba myong ba yin pa de bas na shes pa yang myong ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is an experience that is similar to the object and is of the nature of consciousness, then consciousness is also an experience.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The words ‚Äúthat is also‚Äù and so on.

original: nges med par ni nges ma yin //
analyzed: nges med par ni nges ma yin //
translated: It is not ascertained.üîΩThe words of the sutra, ‚ÄúThere is no memory without experience,‚Äù and so on, are explained by the text of the commentary, ‚ÄúThere is no memory without experience,‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig de yang nyams su myong ba med pa la dran pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grel pa'i gzhung gis bshad cing kun las btus pa mdzas pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig de yang nyams su myong ba med pa la dran pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grel pa'i gzhung gis bshad cing kun las btus pa mdzas pas /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states:

original: shes pa gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba dgag pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba dgag pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe refutation of the claim that consciousness is itself the experience of consciousness is stated in the following passage:

original: gang gi tshe don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i tshul gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe shes pa'i tshul gnyis grub pa de'i tshe rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i snang ba nyams su myong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya
analyzed: gang gi tshe don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i tshul gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe shes pa'i tshul gnyis grub pa de'i tshe rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i snang ba nyams su myong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya
translated: When the two modes that are of the same nature as the object are established, at that time, since the appearance that is of its own nature is experienced, it is seen.

original: bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it is applied.

original: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yang de yin la snang ba yang de yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yang de yin la snang ba yang de yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba ste /
translated: Since it is of its own nature and it is an appearance, it is said that it is a particular inclusion.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the aspect of the object that is of the nature of consciousness.

original: de nyid ni don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is explained by the phrase ‚Äúit is of the same nature as the object.‚Äù

original: gal te re zhig yul gyi rnam par shes pas myong ba de bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe shes pa'i rang rig pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te re zhig yul gyi rnam par shes pas myong ba de bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe shes pa'i rang rig pa grub pa yin no //
translated: If the experience of the aspect of the object by consciousness is of its own nature, at that time reflexive awareness is established.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni shes pas bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo yul gyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
