analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni shes pas bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo yul gyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat has the aspect of the object‚Äù means that consciousness does not experience its own nature as modified by the aspect of the object.

original: yul gyi blo zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i blo'i gzung ba nyid du 'dod pa sngar byung ba'i blo 'gyur ba ni 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: yul gyi blo zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i blo'i gzung ba nyid du 'dod pa sngar byung ba'i blo 'gyur ba ni 'dod mod kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cognition of the object‚Äù means that the cognition that occurs later is the apprehender of the object that occurred earlier.

original: shes pa snga ma 'gags pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum du shes pa gzhan gyis myong bar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa snga ma 'gags pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum du shes pa gzhan gyis myong bar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: But since the earlier cognition has already ceased, it is not experienced by another cognition that is directly evident.

original: de las ma 'ongs pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par gyur pa'i 'dra ba gang yin pa de phyis 'byung bas myong ba nyid yin zhing de myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ma 'ongs pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par gyur pa'i 'dra ba gang yin pa de phyis 'byung bas myong ba nyid yin zhing de myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the later cognition does experience the object, because it is similar to the earlier cognition in the sense that it has the aspect of the object that was apprehended by the earlier cognition.

original: don yang myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don yang myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since the later cognition experiences the earlier cognition, it also experiences the object.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong bar khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong bar khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúbecause we do not accept that anything is self-evident to itself‚Äù is stated.

original: don gang la nyams su myong ba med pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gang la nyams su myong ba med pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which does not have an experience of an object is said to be without an object.

original: don du snang ba 'di la yod pas na don du snang ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don du snang ba 'di la yod pas na don du snang ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since it appears as an object, it is endowed with the appearance of an object.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other is blue, etc.

original: phyi rol du mngon du phyogs pa ste gzung ba nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam par chad pa'i rnam pa bdag nyid la bzhag pa yang rnam par chad pa bzhin du mthong bas gzung ba nyid du mthong ba de bas na
analyzed: phyi rol du mngon du phyogs pa ste gzung ba nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam par chad pa'i rnam pa bdag nyid la bzhag pa yang rnam par chad pa bzhin du mthong bas gzung ba nyid du mthong ba de bas na
translated: It appears as external, i.e., as the apprehended object. Since the form of the object is seen as if it were external, the apprehended object is seen.

original: gzung ba @236a * //
analyzed: gzung ba @236a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: nyid du yongs su bcad pa ni rnam pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de ltar na shes pa gzung ba nyid du snang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyid du yongs su bcad pa ni rnam pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de ltar na shes pa gzung ba nyid du snang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: the apprehended object is determined. The form is of the nature of consciousness. Thus, consciousness appears as the apprehended object.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas ji skad du bshad pa'i shes pa la snang bar gyur pa dmigs par mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa'am gzhan la yul du ste sngon po la sogs par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas ji skad du bshad pa'i shes pa la snang bar gyur pa dmigs par mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa'am gzhan la yul du ste sngon po la sogs par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: The cognition that is asserted to be the object that appears in the cognition explained in the above manner apprehends the object, such as blue, in the same way.

original: de bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i blo 'di yang zhes bya ba ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i blo phyis 'byung ba phyi rol du mngon du phyogs par snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i blo 'di yang zhes bya ba ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i blo phyis 'byung ba phyi rol du mngon du phyogs par snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis cognition that experiences‚Äù refers to the subsequent cognition that is asserted to be the apprehender of the previously experienced object. It appears as if it is directed externally.

original: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa'i khyad par gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa'i khyad par gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition that is the distinguishing feature of a different consciousness.

original: de rtag tu bdag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de rtag tu bdag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúIt always appears to me as if it were external‚Äù and so on.

original: nang mngon phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yin gyi /
analyzed: nang mngon phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the aspect of apprehending what is directed internally‚Äù means that it is suitable as the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not mean that it is in the aspect of the apprehended object.

original: de bas na blo 'di ni bdag nyid nyams su myong ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na blo 'di ni bdag nyid nyams su myong ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this mind is itself the experience.

original: shes pa gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba ni ma yin zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba ni ma yin zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not the experience of another consciousness.üîΩIf it is one‚Äôs own mind, then because it faces outward, etc.

original: gal te rang gi blo nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol du kha bltas pas zhes bya ba ni blo gang yin pa de shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba de ni rang gi blo nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo phyi rol du
analyzed: gal te rang gi blo nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol du kha bltas pas zhes bya ba ni blo gang yin pa de shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba de ni rang gi blo nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo phyi rol du
translated: The mind that is the experience of another consciousness is one‚Äôs own mind. Because of that reason, the mind that apprehends it does not engage by facing outward.

original: kha bltas pas 'jug pa ma yin te rang gi blo dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol du kha bltas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha bltas pas 'jug pa ma yin te rang gi blo dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol du kha bltas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit does not face outward‚Äù is that it does not become that which faces outward because it is the object of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: de'i tshe yang phyi rol du kha bltas pa la yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo la dmigs pa'i phyir dran pas kyang nyams su myong ba'i blo bzhin du gzung ba'i blo 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes byaüîΩba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang phyi rol du kha bltas pa la yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo la dmigs pa'i phyir dran pas kyang nyams su myong ba'i blo bzhin du gzung ba'i blo 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, it is not the case that it is directed externally. The meaning is that, because it observes its own awareness, the awareness that apprehends the object is seen in the aspect of the awareness that experiences it, as in memory.

original: dran pa'i gzung ba'i blo 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa'i gzung ba'i blo 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The awareness that is the object of memory does not appear in the aspect of the awareness that apprehends it.

original: 'di ltar gzung ba nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzung ba nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: It appears as the object that is the object of memory.

original: gal te de 'dra las myong ba //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra las myong ba //
translated: If it is an experience of something like that,

original: zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba tsam nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo can gyi shes pa yin no zhes sems so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba tsam nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo can gyi shes pa yin no zhes sems so //
translated: it is a consciousness that has a nature that is the experience of something like the object.

original: 'dra ba thams cad phyi rol rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dra ba thams cad phyi rol rnams kyang ngo //
translated: All that is like it is external.

original: 'o na myong ba 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: 'o na myong ba 'dra ba yin //
translated: But if it is an experience of something like it,

original: zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: it has the characteristic of being like the object.

original: myong ba ni yul nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: myong ba ni yul nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: Experience is the experience of an object.

original: 'dra ba tsam yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the case that a mere similarity is experienced as an object.üîΩThis is the meaning of the passage.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that with ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo myong ba gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi don dag la sgro 'dogs shing sgro @236b 'dogs pa de las phyi rol gyi don gyi myong ba 'di yin no zhes 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo myong ba gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi don dag la sgro 'dogs shing sgro @236b 'dogs pa de las phyi rol gyi don gyi myong ba 'di yin no zhes 'khrul pa ste /
translated: That which is the experience of the nature of blue, etc., which is of the nature of consciousness, superimposes external objects. From that superimposition, there is the error that this is the experience of external objects.üîΩ‚ÄúBy the adulteration‚Äù is the meaning of the compound.

original: bslad pas zhes bya ba yang phyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: bslad pas zhes bya ba yang phyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means that it occurs later.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgro 'dogs pas kyang 'khrul par byed do zhes bya bas dus snga phyi'i tha dad par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgro 'dogs pas kyang 'khrul par byed do zhes bya bas dus snga phyi'i tha dad par ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, he shows that there is a difference in the temporal sequence with ‚ÄúBy superimposition, it also causes error.‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa chod pa dag gi yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa chod pa dag gi yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means even those that are obstructed, such as pots, etc.

original: gzhan gyi yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of another‚Äôs object‚Äù is the cognition of blue, etc.

original: dkar sogs snang 'gyur ba rnam par 'chad pa'i ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: dkar sogs snang 'gyur ba rnam par 'chad pa'i ngo bo la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe form of the cessation of the appearance of white, etc.‚Äù

original: cig car skyes bu'i zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe dkar po la sogs pa'i myong ba de nyid kyi tshe nang gi myong ba dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i ngo bo can myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car skyes bu'i zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe dkar po la sogs pa'i myong ba de nyid kyi tshe nang gi myong ba dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i ngo bo can myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSimultaneously with the person‚Äù means that at the time of the experience of white, etc., there is the experience of the internal experience having the form of the apprehension of white, etc.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mngon sum nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa dmigs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mngon sum nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa dmigs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the object of white, etc., is not directly perceived‚Äù means that the object of white, etc., is not directly perceived.

original: srog chags thams cad kyi dkar po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa nang gi myong ba'i ngo bo gsal ba gang yin pa de gal te dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyi dkar po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa nang gi myong ba'i ngo bo gsal ba gang yin pa de gal te dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: The clarity of the internal experience of the object of white, etc., of all living beings, if it were the nature of the object of white, etc.,

original: mngon sum gyis myong ba'i don can gyi myong ba mngon sum yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis myong ba'i don can gyi myong ba mngon sum yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the experience of the object that is experienced by perception would be perception.

original: gang gi tshe dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa las nang gi myong ba don gzhan du gyur pa nyid mngon sum yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe dkar po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa las nang gi myong ba don gzhan du gyur pa nyid mngon sum yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe dkar po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: When the internal experience that is different from the object, such as white, etc., is accepted as perception, then the object, such as white, etc., is not perception,

original: gang gis gsal ba'i shes pa ni de las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmngon sum gzhan la gzhan mngon sum //
analyzed: gang gis gsal ba'i shes pa ni de las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // mngon sum gzhan la gzhan mngon sum //
translated: because the clear cognition is just the opposite of that.

original: zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that one perception is the perception of another.

original: de bas na bdag nyid myong ba la ltos pa med pa'i dkar po la sogs pa phyi rol na yod pa nyid tsam gyis gsal ba thob par 'gyur na de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid myong ba la ltos pa med pa'i dkar po la sogs pa phyi rol na yod pa nyid tsam gyis gsal ba thob par 'gyur na de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the mere existence of external objects, such as white, etc., independent of the experience of oneself, is clear.

original: de ltar na yul yod pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid kyis gsal bar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na yul yod pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid kyis gsal bar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the mere existence of the object is clear.‚Äù

original: gsal ba nyid la gsal bar byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba ni gsal ba ma yin pa gsal bar byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid la gsal bar byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba ni gsal ba ma yin pa gsal bar byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is that whatever is manifest is necessarily manifest-making.  The contradiction of that is that something non-manifest is manifest-making.  Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is a reductio argument.

original: gsal ba ma yin pa gsal bar byed pa yang gsal ba nyid kyi thams cad kyis thams cad dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'di nyid bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //üîΩde ltar ni dkar po la sogs pa snang bar @237a * //
analyzed: gsal ba ma yin pa gsal bar byed pa yang gsal ba nyid kyi thams cad kyis thams cad dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'di nyid bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no // de ltar ni dkar po la sogs pa snang bar @237a * //
translated: If something non-manifest were manifest-making, then everything would always be observed.  Therefore, when this is reversed, it is a valid cognition that contradicts the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: gyur pa gsal ba ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba bzlog pa bstan to //
analyzed: gyur pa gsal ba ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba bzlog pa bstan to //
translated: The reversal is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúA non-manifest appearance of white, etc.‚Äù

original: bzlog pas zhes bya ba ni thal ba bzlog pas rang rig pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pas zhes bya ba ni thal ba bzlog pas rang rig pa grub pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the reversal‚Äù means that reflexive awareness is established by the reversal of the reductio.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i gsal ba ni gsal bar byed pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i gsal ba ni gsal bar byed pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the manifestation of white, etc. is established as manifest-making.

original: yul la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yul la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa shes pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de yang rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir bdag nyid gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yul la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa shes pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de yang rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir bdag nyid gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: The so-called object-of-consciousness of the object is the second consciousness that is the object-of-consciousness of the object, but because we do not accept reflexive awareness, it is not itself clear.

original: de'i tshe ni yul la dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni yul la dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time, it is the time of the determination of the object-of-consciousness of the object.

original: la lar mthar thug pa yin na zhes bya ba ni gang la shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa nyams su myong bar mi 'dod pa de la shes pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa dang / yul gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa dang / yul gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa'i yul de dag cig car mngon par gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la lar mthar thug pa yin na zhes bya ba ni gang la shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa nyams su myong bar mi 'dod pa de la shes pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa dang / yul gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa dang / yul gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa'i yul de dag cig car mngon par gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to be terminated in some cases, then the nature of the consciousness, the nature of the object, and the object itself would all be simultaneously manifested, in the case where another consciousness does not experience the consciousness.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba yin na sngar yod pa'i shes pa yang de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba cig car don dang bdag nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa dag tu 'gyur te bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba yin na sngar yod pa'i shes pa yang de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba cig car don dang bdag nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa dag tu 'gyur te bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the previously existing consciousness would also be like that, that is, it would simultaneously manifest the object and itself, because there is no difference.

original: khyad par gang gis shes pa thams cad kyi tha ma la bdag nyid la yul dag cig car gsal bar 'gyur gyi shes pa snga ma dag kho na la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis shes pa thams cad kyi tha ma la bdag nyid la yul dag cig car gsal bar 'gyur gyi shes pa snga ma dag kho na la ni ma yin te /
translated: In particular, at the very end of all cognitions, the object is simultaneously and clearly manifest to the self, but not to the prior cognitions,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because there is no such distinction.

original: de bas na rang rig pa grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa med par shes pa'i bdag nyid dang yul cig car mngon par gsal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na rang rig pa grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa med par shes pa'i bdag nyid dang yul cig car mngon par gsal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, reflexive awareness is established, because it is impossible for the nature of cognition and its object to be simultaneously manifest without reflexive awareness.

original: de dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the object‚Äù means that white, etc. is experienced.

original: de nyid shes par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid shes par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself is not known‚Äù means that at the time of apprehending white, etc., the object is not known.

original: don mthong bas ci ltar khyad par can du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas 'di mngon par gsal bar mthong zhing /
analyzed: don mthong bas ci ltar khyad par can du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas 'di mngon par gsal bar mthong zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it distinguished by seeing the object?‚Äù means that this is clearly seen by the eye consciousness.

original: 'di rna ba'i rnam par shes pas mngon par gsal ba thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rna ba'i rnam par shes pas mngon par gsal ba thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the case when one says, ‚ÄúI hear that sound with my auditory consciousness.‚Äù

original: skyes bu gzugs mthong ba na de mthong ba yang rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par chad pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa na gzugs la dmigs pa nang yin nam ma yin zhes rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu gzugs mthong ba na de mthong ba yang rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par chad pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa na gzugs la dmigs pa nang yin nam ma yin zhes rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: When a person sees a form, he does not understand that he sees it, because when one apprehends a form that is interrupted, one does not understand whether the form is internal or external.

original: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one does not accept reflexive awareness.

original: des khyad par du gyur pa gzhan 'dzin pa ni khyad par rtogs pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: des khyad par du gyur pa gzhan 'dzin pa ni khyad par rtogs pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: When one apprehends something else that is qualified by that, one does so on the basis of prior understanding of the qualifier.

original: khyad par rtogs pa med pa des khyad par du gyur pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi 'dzin par @237b mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa med pa des khyad par du gyur pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi 'dzin par @237b mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because one cannot apprehend the basis of the qualifier that is qualified by that without prior understanding of the qualifier.

original: 'di la khyad par rtogs pa med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa ste thal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la khyad par rtogs pa med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa ste thal ba yin no //
translated: Here, the non-apprehension of the cause is the consequence of the absence of the prior understanding of the qualifier.

original: cig car ram rim gyis zhes bya ba ni 'dir cig car mthong ba ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can yin no //
analyzed: cig car ram rim gyis zhes bya ba ni 'dir cig car mthong ba ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can yin no //
translated: Simultaneously or sequentially, here, the simultaneous seeing is for one who follows reasoning.

original: rim gyis kyang bshad pa gang yin pa de ni khas blangs nas yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis kyang bshad pa gang yin pa de ni khas blangs nas yin te /
translated: And that which is explained gradually is accepted.

original: gal te yul dang de dmigs pa'i dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can 'brel par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rim gyis kyang 'dzin pa yod pa na 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul dang de dmigs pa'i dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can 'brel par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rim gyis kyang 'dzin pa yod pa na 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object and that which observes it were to occur simultaneously, they would be related. But if there were observation of an object that occurs gradually, then it would not be said ‚ÄúThis is seen.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang dus mtshungs pa ma yin par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don dang dmigs pa dag las 'brel pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus mtshungs pa ma yin par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don dang dmigs pa dag las 'brel pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if the object and the observation do not occur simultaneously, they would not be related.

original: shes pa'i dus na don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i dus na don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not exist at the time of consciousness.

original: gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /üîΩde'i tshe don zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba'i shes pa gsal ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ma yin te / de'i tshe don zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba'i shes pa gsal ba'i dus na'o //
translated: It is not the illuminator,üîΩbecause at that time the so-called object is the time of the illumination of consciousness that resembles the object.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: And that is the object that resembles the object that is the nature of consciousness.

original: de rab tu myong ba can zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don dang 'dra ba rab tu myong ba na'o //
analyzed: de rab tu myong ba can zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don dang 'dra ba rab tu myong ba na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the nature of a very clear experience‚Äù means that it is like an object that has an internal nature, which is very clear.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo dang yul ma bzung ba can yin na yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo dang yul ma bzung ba can yin na yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo ni bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it does not grasp the nature of consciousness and the object‚Äù means that the nature of consciousness is itself.

original: ngo bo dang yul ni ngo bo dang yul te /
analyzed: ngo bo dang yul ni ngo bo dang yul te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature and the object‚Äù means the nature and the object.

original: de dag ma bzung ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ma bzung ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which does not grasp those is said to be that.

original: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not accept reflexive awareness.

original: ngo bo ma bzung ba ni yul ni rnam par shes pa'i dus na 'gags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo ma bzung ba ni yul ni rnam par shes pa'i dus na 'gags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The nature is not grasped because the object has already ceased at the time of consciousness.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di nyams su myong ba 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di'i bzung ba 'di nyams su myong ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di nyams su myong ba 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di'i bzung ba 'di nyams su myong ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis experience is definitely this‚Äù means that this consciousness grasps this experience.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni myong ba dang myong bar byed pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni myong ba dang myong bar byed pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn those‚Äù refers to the experience and the experiencer.

original: de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'di'i myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di'i rgyu'o//
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'di'i myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di'i rgyu'o//
translated: Thus, the cause of the designation ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is the cause of the expression ‚Äúthis is the experience of that.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'dra ba las kyang myong //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dra ba las kyang myong //
translated: ‚Äú It is like that, but not experienced‚Äù means that it is like the experience of something else.

original: zhes pa bdag nyid nyams su myong ba med pa'i rang bzhin can 'dra ba tsam las so //
analyzed: zhes pa bdag nyid nyams su myong ba med pa'i rang bzhin can 'dra ba tsam las so //
translated: ‚Äú It is like that‚Äù means that it is like the mere experience of something else.

original: sngar ni zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba'i dus na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba'i dus na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Previously‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúat the time of seeing white, etc.‚Äù

original: mthong ba rtogs pa'i dus la ltos nas dkar po la sogs pa mthong pa'i dus na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba rtogs pa'i dus la ltos nas dkar po la sogs pa mthong pa'i dus na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äú At the time of seeing white, etc.‚Äù refers to the time of the realization of seeing.

original: shes pa shes pa gzhan gyi mthong ba rtogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: shes pa shes pa gzhan gyi mthong ba rtogs pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of the realization of the seeing of consciousness is the time of the seeing of another consciousness.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äú It is not by another,‚Äù because that is impossible.

original: mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan rang nyid myong ba ma yin pas kyang shes pa snga ma 'dzin pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan rang nyid myong ba ma yin pas kyang shes pa snga ma 'dzin pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú It is not by another consciousness‚Äù because it is impossible for a prior consciousness to be apprehended by another consciousness.

original: de de ltar na nyams su myong ba gzhan gyi @238a * //
analyzed: de de ltar na nyams su myong ba gzhan gyi @238a * //
translated: Thus, the error called ‚Äúthe experience of another nature‚Äù is this:

original: ngo bo yin pa'i skyon zhes bya ba ni nang gi gsal ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ci dkar po la sogs pa'i gsal ba las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin nam /üîΩci bdag nyid du gyur pa yin zhes phyogs gnyis bshad pa gang yin pa de las re zhig gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyogs kyi skyon bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo yin pa'i skyon zhes bya ba ni nang gi gsal ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ci dkar po la sogs pa'i gsal ba las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin nam / ci bdag nyid du gyur pa yin zhes phyogs gnyis bshad pa gang yin pa de las re zhig gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyogs kyi skyon bshad pa yin no //
translated: Whatever experience of internal clarity there is, is it the experience of a nature that is different from the clarity of white, etc.?üîΩOr is it the experience of itself?üîΩThe error of the position that it is the experience of another nature is explained.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyogs ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyogs ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The position that it is the experience of itself is presented in ‚ÄúIf it is not . . .

original: tha dad par ni 'jug pa can //
analyzed: tha dad par ni 'jug pa can //
translated: . . . it would be engaged as different.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni yang dag par dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni yang dag par dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is ‚Äúby the modes of correct joy, etc.‚Äù

original: yang dag par dga' ba'i rnam pas bde ba la 'jug cing de las bzlog pas sdug bsngal dang don du gnyer ba'i rnam pas 'dod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' ba'i rnam pas bde ba la 'jug cing de las bzlog pas sdug bsngal dang don du gnyer ba'i rnam pas 'dod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is engaged in pleasure by the mode of correct joy, and in pain by the opposite of that. It is engaged in desire by the mode of seeking.

original: de yang gang las she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las she na /
translated: From what is it?

original: rten dmigs goms pa'i khyad par la //
analyzed: rten dmigs goms pa'i khyad par la //
translated: From the distinction of basis, objective support, and cultivation.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang goms pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang goms pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba yin no //
translated: Basis, objective support, and cultivation are a dyad.

original: goms pa ni yid la dbye ba nus pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa ni yid la dbye ba nus pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the ability to mentally engage.

original: dga' ba dang gdung ba'i bye brag 'dod pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la dga' ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang gdung ba'i bye brag 'dod pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la dga' ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni bde ba'o //
translated: The distinction of joy and distress is the nature of desire, etc. The characteristic of the distinction of joy is pleasure.

original: yongs su gdung ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The characteristic of the distinction of distress is pain.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of what is desired is desire.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩsngar dmigs pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o // sngar dmigs pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And those, i.e., pleasure, etc.,üîΩare previously established as the nature of the objective support.

original: rnam par shes pa tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du dang por blo'i rang bzhin nyid gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du dang por blo'i rang bzhin nyid gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: the nature of the intellect is first established as the cause of the distinction of consciousness.

original: de ltar snang bar gyur pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang bar gyur pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch an appearance‚Äù is the appearance as the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni blo dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni blo dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the cognitions.

original: bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the identity of that pleasure, etc.‚Äù means by the identity of the cognition.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'khrul pa med pa nges par byed pa can gyi rjes su dpog pa po'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'khrul pa med pa nges par byed pa can gyi rjes su dpog pa po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is perceived by another person‚Äù is the inferential cognition that ascertains without error the specific effect of pleasure, etc.

original: myong 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de ltar snang bar gyur pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsal bar nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: myong 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de ltar snang bar gyur pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsal bar nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúExperience‚Äù means the clear experience of the nature of pleasure, etc., which appears in that way. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa myong ba po bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa myong ba po bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that very reason, he says, ‚ÄúLike the experiencer of pleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi de'i longs spyod par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gal te yang rgyud la bde ba la @238b sogs pa skyes pa de bde ba la sogs pa'i longs
analyzed: de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi de'i longs spyod par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gal te yang rgyud la bde ba la @238b sogs pa skyes pa de bde ba la sogs pa'i longs
translated: Because it is the experiencer of that feeling, since it possesses consciousness that observes that feeling.

original: spyod pa po nyid nyams su myong ba las 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa phyis 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa rjes su dpog pa po'i rgyud la yang yod pa de ltar na
analyzed: spyod pa po nyid nyams su myong ba las 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa phyis 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa rjes su dpog pa po'i rgyud la yang yod pa de ltar na
translated: Thus, although the feeling of pleasure, etc. that arises in the mindstream is not asserted to be the experiencer of the pleasure, etc. because it is experienced, still, since the subsequent consciousness that observes that feeling exists, the mindstream that infers the consciousness that observes that feeling also exists.

original: bye brag cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is not the slightest difference.

original: gnyis 'di gdon mi za bar yod //
analyzed: gnyis 'di gdon mi za bar yod //
translated: The two are definitely existent.

original: bde ba la sogs pas bskyed pa dang der snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'dra ba dag gis dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pas bskyed pa dang der snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'dra ba dag gis dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is generated by pleasure, etc. and because it appears as that‚Äù means that the object is posited as similar to the feeling that generates it.

original: spyi gang yin pa ni dngos por gyur pa zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: spyi gang yin pa ni dngos por gyur pa zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The general is what is called the entity.

original: ci ltar sngar bshad pa de ltar dran par bya ba'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyi gzhung nyid ci ltar gsal ba la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar sngar bshad pa de ltar dran par bya ba'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyi gzhung nyid ci ltar gsal ba la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: In order to recall what was explained earlier, he cites the text itself, ‚ÄúIn that case, how could it be that . . . ?‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang bdag rig ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang bdag rig ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //

analyzed: mthong med ni chos dang chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot seen‚Äù refers to virtue and nonvirtue.

original: don gcig ni bdag nyid de /
analyzed: don gcig ni bdag nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe same object‚Äù means the self.

original: de la bde ba la sogs pa'i gzung ba dang shes pa 'dzin pa 'phrod pa 'du ba gang yin pa de ni don gcig la ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba la sogs pa'i gzung ba dang shes pa 'dzin pa 'phrod pa 'du ba gang yin pa de ni don gcig la ldan pa'o //
translated: The contact of the grasped, such as pleasure, and the grasper, consciousness, is the same object possession.

analyzed: mthong ba med pa dang don gcig dang ldan pa dang por sbyar ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The first application of ‚Äúnot seen‚Äù and ‚Äúthe same object possession‚Äù is to that.

original: dbang phyug dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang phyug dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe pleasure and displeasure of ƒ™≈õvara‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: dbang phyug dga' ba las bde ba gsal bar dmigs shing sdug bsngal mi gsal bar dmigs pa'o //

original: mi dga' ba las ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba las ni bzlog pa'o //

original: de lta na yang blo de ltar snang ba de zhes bya ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgrib g-yogs kyis gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i blo de ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang blo de ltar snang ba de zhes bya ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgrib g-yogs kyis gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i blo de ltar snang ba ste /
translated: Even so, the cognition that appears in that way, i.e., the cognition that does not apprehend the nature of another‚Äôs happiness, etc., because it is covered by the obscuration of not seeing, etc., appears in that way, i.e., it appears as if it were happiness, etc.

analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang cha 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang nang gi nye bar len pa'i stobs las byung ba de'o //
translated: It arises from the power of the internal appropriation, i.e., the cognition that is similar to happiness, etc., and is concomitant with it.

original: gal te bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba mtshungs par bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba mtshungs par bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the experience of one‚Äôs own happiness, etc., and the experience of another‚Äôs happiness, etc., are to be established as the same,

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt that contradicted by perception?

original: de skad du rgol bas gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa shes pa na mi gsal ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba yin na de yang khas mi len na de bas na 'di la khas len pa dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du rgol bas gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa shes pa na mi gsal ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba yin na de yang khas mi len na de bas na 'di la khas len pa dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If you argue that when one knows the pleasure of another, it is an unclear conception, and if you do not accept that, then you contradict your own position.

original: de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa mtshungs par myong ba gzhan la bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa mtshungs par myong ba gzhan la bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the experience of one‚Äôs own and another‚Äôs pleasure, etc., is not to be taught to others.

original: bde ba la sogs par 'dzin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'di skad du 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa @239a * //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs par 'dzin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'di skad du 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa @239a * //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf you assert that pleasure, etc., is apprehended by another cognition,‚Äù etc. This is a reductio argument.

original: yin te / gal te khyed kyi bde ba la sogs pa shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin par 'dod kyi rang rig pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag gi myong ba thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yin te / gal te khyed kyi bde ba la sogs pa shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin par 'dod kyi rang rig pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag gi myong ba thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that pleasure, etc., is apprehended by another cognition and not by autocognition, then the experience of one‚Äôs own and another‚Äôs continuum would not be obtained.

original: myong ba mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong ba mtshungs par 'gyur ro //

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyid ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi de rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis sam /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyid ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi de rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis sam /

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'am /

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pas 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pas 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di gnas pa yin no //

original: de'i tshe rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba ni rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba ni rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the experience of pleasure and so on that exists in one‚Äôs own continuum is reflexive awareness.üîΩThe assertion that the object of another‚Äôs consciousness is the pleasure and so on that exist in another‚Äôs continuum is untenable.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi shes pa gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i yul nyid du 'dod pa don dam par bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i yul med pa can ni mi gsal bar snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi shes pa gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i yul nyid du 'dod pa don dam par bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i yul med pa can ni mi gsal bar snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi
translated: Since it is unclear, it is not tenable that the experience of self and other

analyzed: myong ba'i khyad par 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: is apprehended by another‚Äôs consciousness.üîΩThis is explained by the following.

original: de ni gang gi tshe 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúIf there is no apprehender,‚Äù and so on,

original: skyes bu bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The consciousness of the pleasure of another person is not apprehended by the consciousness of pleasure of one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: 'on kyang de ni rang rig pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩ'dod pa nyid yin pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni rang rig pa nyid ma yin no // 'dod pa nyid yin pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: However, it is not reflexive awareness.üîΩThe desire to experience the pleasure of another is not reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa nyid las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is the experience of the pleasure of another.

original: gal te rgyud gzhan gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par mtshungs pa yin pa na gnyis po de dag gi ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyud gzhan gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par mtshungs pa yin pa na gnyis po de dag gi ste /
translated: If you assert that the pleasure of another is apprehended by some aspect of another continuum, then the apprehension of pleasure is the same.

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag gi myong ba'i tha dad dag kyang kho bo cag gis bsal ba yin no //

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa 'dod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na lan nyid ma yin te /

translated: If you assert that the pleasure of another is not apprehended by another, then you are asserting that the pleasure of another is not experienced. In that case, your response is not a response at all.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god pa'o //

original: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who hold this doctrine‚Äù are the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, etc.

original: gzhan dag gi zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa dag gi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù are the DƒÅr·π£·π≠ƒÅntikas.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal du skyes pa nyid sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rang rig par smra ba'i nang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa de rnal 'byor pa dag gis nyams su @239b myong ba
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal du skyes pa nyid sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rang rig par smra ba'i nang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa de rnal 'byor pa dag gis nyams su @239b myong ba
translated: When it is said that one born in the realm of suffering does not experience suffering, this means that the yogis do not experience the suffering, etc., which is internal and self-cognizant, according to those who maintain that consciousness is self-cognizant.

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa de rnal 'byor pa dag gis nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa de rnal 'byor pa dag gis nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
translated: This means that the yogis do not experience the suffering, etc., which exists in the mental continuum of another.

original: de ltar na rang rig pa nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin gyi shes pa der snang ba skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang rig pa nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin gyi shes pa der snang ba skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is self-consciousness that experiences suffering, etc., and not the arising of consciousness appearing as that.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnal 'byor ba dag gi rgyud la 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing 'byung ba ma yin pa yang ci ltar na rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyams su myong bas myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnal 'byor ba dag gi rgyud la 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing 'byung ba ma yin pa yang ci ltar na rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyams su myong bas myong bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the suffering of others and so on arise in the mindstream of yogins and yoginis, or, not arising, how could they be experienced through the experience of reflexive awareness?

original: gal te 'o na ci ltar na bde ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la ltos nas mngon sum du gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ci ltar na bde ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la ltos nas mngon sum du gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that pleasure and so on become manifest in dependence on the consciousness of yogins?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa der snang ba skyes pas dmigs pa'i phyir de mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa der snang ba skyes pas dmigs pa'i phyir de mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that suffering and so on become manifest because they are perceived as appearing to be that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa dmigs pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pas dmigs pa'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa dmigs pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pas dmigs pa'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is asserted that the observation of pleasure and so on that exist in the mindstreams of others becomes manifest because it is observed by the consciousness of yogins.

original: der snang bar skyes bas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal du snang bar skyes pas so //
analyzed: der snang bar skyes bas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal du snang bar skyes pas so //
translated: Because they arise as appearing to be that means because they arise as appearing to be suffering.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor ba'i shes pas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba med na yang rnal 'byor gyi stobs las der snang bar skyes pa de tsam gyi bde ba la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor ba'i shes pas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba med na yang rnal 'byor gyi stobs las der snang bar skyes pa de tsam gyi bde ba la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, although the yogin‚Äôs consciousness does not experience the suffering of another, it is posited as direct perception of the mere pleasure, etc. that arises in the appearance of that other through the power of the yogin.

original: sdug bsngal du snang ba nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa ma yin na gang gis de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal du snang ba nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa ma yin na gang gis de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the appearance of suffering is not suffering, etc., then by what is it experienced?

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du skyes pa nyid nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du skyes pa nyid nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: It is experienced as the very arising of the nature of suffering, etc.

original: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba ni ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba ni ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not that very experience,‚Äù

original: der snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because the mental consciousness that appears as that is not experienced as the very nature of suffering, etc.

original: bdag ni rang bzhin gyi bye brag nyid de sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bdag ni rang bzhin gyi bye brag nyid de sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The self is the particular nature of suffering.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rang gi rgyud nyid las rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩchos gzhan gyi khyad par dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di'i gzung ba ni 'di yin zhing 'di'i 'dzin pa ni 'di 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rang gi rgyud nyid las rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to // chos gzhan gyi khyad par dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di'i gzung ba ni 'di yin zhing 'di'i 'dzin pa ni 'di 'dzin pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù means that it is produced as the nature of cognition from its own continuum.üîΩ‚ÄúFree from the nature of other phenomena‚Äù means that it is not apprehended by that, nor is it apprehended by any other cognition.

original: shes pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gis 'dzin pa de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos chos gzhan gyi khyad par dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gis 'dzin pa de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos chos gzhan gyi khyad par dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from the nature of apprehended and apprehender, or the nature of being an object of knowledge.

original: blo rang nyid dam zhes bya ba ni dpag par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid rtags nyid du 'ga' @240a * //
analyzed: blo rang nyid dam zhes bya ba ni dpag par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid rtags nyid du 'ga' @240a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind itself‚Äù means that the object to be inferred is the very reason.

original: zhig gi tsho rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhig gi tsho rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is what causes the cognition of some.

original: de'i bye brag ces bya ba ni dbang po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag ces bya ba ni dbang po'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIts particular‚Äù means the particular of the sense faculty.

original: sgrib g-yogs med pa zhes bya ba la sgrib g-yogs ni rtsig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs med pa zhes bya ba la sgrib g-yogs ni rtsig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout obstruction‚Äù means without walls, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni ling tog dang mig sprin la sogs pas rjes su gnod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni ling tog dang mig sprin la sogs pas rjes su gnod pa gzung ngo //

original: shes par mi nus pa can nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni da la yod pa'i khyad par dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par mi nus pa can nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni da la yod pa'i khyad par dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not perceptible‚Äù means that the special qualities of the object are beyond the senses.

analyzed: de la blo las gzhan pa de gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni yul la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhat is it that is other than cognition?‚Äù refers to the object that is engaged by cognition.

original: de yang ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni blo'o //
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni blo'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat also is not established‚Äù refers to cognition.

original: nye ba dang bskal ba dag mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin par dmigs pa can gyi thams cad du khyad par med pa'i don 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig nye ba dang bskal ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba dang bskal ba dag mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin par dmigs pa can gyi thams cad du khyad par med pa'i don 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig nye ba dang bskal ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause proximity and distance are not possible‚Äù means that there is no proximity or distance between cognition and any object that is not perceptible.

original: blo'i khyad par can gyi don gang la zhes pa ni don gang la blo'i khyad par yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: blo'i khyad par can gyi don gang la zhes pa ni don gang la blo'i khyad par yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith regard to an object that has a special quality‚Äù means that cognition is said to have a special quality with regard to an object that has a special quality.

original: de'i phyir don gsal ba zhes bya ba ni don gsal ba ste blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gsal ba zhes bya ba ni don gsal ba ste blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe manifestation of the object‚Äù is the manifestation of the object, that is, the cognition.üîΩIf you do not accept that the object is manifested,üîΩif you do not accept that the object is manifested, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.

original: don rtogs pa gsal bar mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod na zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //üîΩdon gyi bye brag 'ga' zhig de nyid bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni blo'i khyad par la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis zhes bya bar sems so //
analyzed: don rtogs pa gsal bar mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod na zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no // don gyi bye brag 'ga' zhig de nyid bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni blo'i khyad par la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis zhes bya bar sems so //
translated: If the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.

original: de shes pa shes pa med na 'di shes pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don bye brag de shes pa gang yin pa de'i shes pa med na /üîΩde 'dzin pa'i dngos po med na don gyi bye brag 'di shes pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de shes pa shes pa med na 'di shes pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don bye brag de shes pa gang yin pa de'i shes pa med na / de 'dzin pa'i dngos po med na don gyi bye brag 'di shes pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
