original: yul dmigs pa la dmigs par byed na zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba'o //üîΩde dang de yang zhes bya ba ni yul la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yul dmigs pa la dmigs par byed na zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba'o //üîΩde dang de yang zhes bya ba ni yul la dmigs pa'o //
translated: If the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would not be manifested by the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not manifested by the cognition, then the object would

original: de lta na yang de la de shes pa nyid don dam par yod pa nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni don de las shes pa des shes pa nyid don dam par yod pa yin te shes par bya ba nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid
analyzed: de lta na yang de la de shes pa nyid don dam par yod pa nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni don de las shes pa des shes pa nyid don dam par yod pa yin te shes par bya ba nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid
translated: Still, it is said that consciousness exists ultimately because of that.üîΩThe meaning of that is that consciousness exists ultimately because of that object, since it is the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Still, it is said that ‚Äúconsciousness itself exists ultimately,‚Äù because the object is known by that consciousness, and consciousness itself exists ultimately, because it is the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: ci ste shes pa ma yin pa rtags yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa ma yin pa rtags yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: The second position is presented in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf the object is not consciousness, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ste shes pa ma yin pa'i don gyi bye brag shes pa la rtags yin na'o //
analyzed: ci ste shes pa ma yin pa'i don gyi bye brag shes pa la rtags yin na'o //
translated: If the object is not consciousness, but a particular of the object is the representation in consciousness.

original: bdag nyid mngon sum nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon sum nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'o //
translated: It is not seen, because it is not manifest.

original: mthong ba ste dmigs pa gang dag la yod pa de dag ni ma mthong mthong can dag gi don yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ste dmigs pa gang dag la yod pa de dag ni ma mthong mthong can dag gi don yin te /
translated: Those who see, or observe, the object, are those who see what is not seen.

original: @240b mngon sum ma yin pa dmigs pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @240b mngon sum ma yin pa dmigs pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who observe the nonmanifest.‚Äù

original: lta ba por mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan gyi ni zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de'i yul can gyis mngon sum 'jug par 'dod pa gnag yin pa mngon par 'dod pa de'o //
analyzed: lta ba por mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan gyi ni zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de'i yul can gyis mngon sum 'jug par 'dod pa gnag yin pa mngon par 'dod pa de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than the one who is acknowledged as the seer‚Äù is the one who is acknowledged as the one who has the object of that eye consciousness.

original: lta ba po de dag las gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: lta ba po de dag las gzhan gyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúOther than those seers‚Äù is

original: gang zhig de'i don de dag la shes pa mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i don de dag la shes pa mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: the one who does not have the object of that eye consciousness.

original: mthong ba la lar mthong ba med //
analyzed: mthong ba la lar mthong ba med //
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes seeing is not seeing‚Äù means that sometimes the object is not seen.

original: ces bya ba la mthong ba ni dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la mthong ba ni dmigs pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù means the object.

original: de ltar mthong ba med pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba med pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: ‚ÄúNot seeing‚Äù means not seeing the object.

original: ci ltar de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa dag shes pa ma skyes pas don ma mthong bar 'dod pa de ltar gang zhig de la shes pa 'jug pa des kyang yul la dmigs pa skyes su zin kyang mngon sum du khas mi len pas myong ba nyid ma
analyzed: ci ltar de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa dag shes pa ma skyes pas don ma mthong bar 'dod pa de ltar gang zhig de la shes pa 'jug pa des kyang yul la dmigs pa skyes su zin kyang mngon sum du khas mi len pas myong ba nyid ma
translated: Just as at that time form and so on is not seen because the consciousness is not generated, and thus the object is not seen, in the same way, even though the object is seen by the one who has the consciousness, since direct perception is not accepted, the object is not seen.

original: yin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i dmigs pa can gyi don de dag ni ma mthong ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i dmigs pa can gyi don de dag ni ma mthong ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it follows that those objects that are not directly perceived are not seen,

original: rang nyid kyis kyang bdag nyid nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes pa ni med par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis kyang bdag nyid nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes pa ni med par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no consciousness that has a nature of not experiencing itself, because there is no difference.

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i don nyams su myong bar dmigs pa can dag kyang skyes bu lta ba por mngon par 'dod pa gcig gis 'dzin par 'dod pa de ltar lta ba bor mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan pa'i skyes bus kyang mthong bar 'gyur te
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i don nyams su myong bar dmigs pa can dag kyang skyes bu lta ba por mngon par 'dod pa gcig gis 'dzin par 'dod pa de ltar lta ba bor mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan pa'i skyes bus kyang mthong bar 'gyur te
translated: If one person who is said to be a seer is said to apprehend objects that are experienced in that way, then another person who is not said to be a seer would also see them,

original: / skyes bu gnyi ga yang yul la dmigs pa don myong ba med par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / skyes bu gnyi ga yang yul la dmigs pa don myong ba med par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both people are the same in not experiencing objects.

original: de nyid ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúThose that have such aspects . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: de bas na thal ches par ma gyur cig snyam pas skyes bu lta ba por mngon par 'dod pas kyang skyes bu mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul dmigs pa can gyis don de mthong ba ma yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩde bas na gal te skyes bu lta ba po'i don gyi blo skye ba de lta na yang de mngon sum nyid ma yin pa de ltar na des don gyi khyad par de dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thal ches par ma gyur cig snyam pas skyes bu lta ba por mngon par 'dod pas kyang skyes bu mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul dmigs pa can gyis don de mthong ba ma yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o // de bas na gal te skyes bu lta ba po'i don gyi blo skye ba de lta na yang de mngon sum nyid ma yin pa de ltar na des don gyi khyad par de dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the person is accepted as the seer because of the thought that it is too much to say that the eye sees, still, the person who is not a direct perceiver does not see the object that is perceived.üîΩTherefore, even though the idea of the person as the seer of the object arises, it is not a direct perception, and so it does not perceive the object.

original: de ltar na yang don gyi khyad par ma shes na yang gal te blo la rtags nyid yin par skyes bu lta ba po mngon par 'dod pa la ltos pa de lta na yang don ma mthong ba can gyi skyes bu gzhan de dag la yang phyi rolüîΩgyi don gyi bye brag yod pa yin pas na de la blo rjes su dpog pa'i rtags su yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang don gyi khyad par ma shes na yang gal te blo la rtags nyid yin par skyes bu lta ba po mngon par 'dod pa la ltos pa de lta na yang don ma mthong ba can gyi skyes bu gzhan de dag la yang phyi rolüîΩgyi don gyi bye brag yod pa yin pas na de la blo rjes su dpog pa'i rtags su yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the object is not cognized, if the idea of the person as the seer is based on the sign of the cognition, then even in the case of other persons who do not see the object, the external object would exist, and so the cognition would be an inference of the object.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir don de mi shes pa'i bye brag ces bya ba smos te /üîΩskyes bu gzhan mthong ba la @241a * //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir don de mi shes pa'i bye brag ces bya ba smos te / skyes bu gzhan mthong ba la @241a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äúbecause of not knowing the particular of the object.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bu lta ba por mngon par 'dod pa'i de'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba na yang don gyi bye brag mi shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bu lta ba por mngon par 'dod pa'i de'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba na yang don gyi bye brag mi shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means that when the consciousness of the other person who is the object of the view of the person arises, it is also the case that there is no knowledge of the particular of the object.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is observed to be non-perception.

original: gzhan gyi yod de zhes bya ba ni lta ba po ma yin pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyi yang mi shes pa'i don gyi bye brag blo'i rtags su gyur pa yod pa yin no //üîΩrang gi chos la ltos med can //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yod de zhes bya ba ni lta ba po ma yin pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyi yang mi shes pa'i don gyi bye brag blo'i rtags su gyur pa yod pa yin no // rang gi chos la ltos med can //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äôs‚Äù means that there is the cognition of the other person who is not the viewer, and the sign of the cognition is the existence of the particular of the object that is not known.

original: zhes bya ba la skyes bu rjes su dpog pa po'i rang gi chos te shes pa gzhan la ltos pa med pa can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la skyes bu rjes su dpog pa po'i rang gi chos te shes pa gzhan la ltos pa med pa can no //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout regard to his own property‚Äù means that the other cognition that is the property of the person who infers the other person is without regard to another cognition.

original: skyes bu rjes su dpog pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu rjes su dpog pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe person who infers the other person‚Äù and so on explains that.

original: skyes bu rjes su dpog pa po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu rjes su dpog pa po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout depending on the object‚Äù is that it is not dependent on a thing called ‚Äúcognition‚Äù that is the nature of an inferring person.

original: rang chos rang gi yul zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos kyang yul gzhan la dmigs pa can du 'gyur ba khyad par du bya ba'i phyir yul smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rang chos rang gi yul zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos kyang yul gzhan la dmigs pa can du 'gyur ba khyad par du bya ba'i phyir yul smos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object of its own property‚Äù is stated in order to distinguish it from that which has another object, namely, its own property.

original: blo rgyu ste rtags ni rang gi blo'i rtags so //
analyzed: blo rgyu ste rtags ni rang gi blo'i rtags so //
translated: The ‚Äúreason‚Äù is the cause of the cognition.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa tha dad pa la skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa tha dad pa la skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the absence of a relation‚Äù means that the relation does not exist because the two are produced separately.

original: 'bras bu blo ldog pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu blo zhes bya ba ldog pa las te /
analyzed: 'bras bu blo ldog pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu blo zhes bya ba ldog pa las te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the cessation of the effect, the cognition‚Äù means that the effect, the cognition, ceases.

original: rgyu gzhan yod na yang dbang po med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yod na yang dbang po med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even if the other causes exist, if the sense organ does not exist, it does not exist.

original: de mi 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de mi 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not established‚Äù means that the sense organ is not established.

original: de'i rtags ma yin zhing blo yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni blo de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi rtags su grub pa ma yin zhing blo rgyu'i bdag nyid du yang grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rtags ma yin zhing blo yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni blo de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi rtags su grub pa ma yin zhing blo rgyu'i bdag nyid du yang grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat is not a sign and also is not mind‚Äù is that mind is not established as a sign that has the nature of an effect, nor is it established as having the nature of a cause.

original: gal te 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi /üîΩci ltar gzugs dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yod na yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ldog pa 'ga' zhig las rgyu 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhes spyir dbang po sgrub par byed pa de ltar lus kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu
analyzed: gal te 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi / ci ltar gzugs dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yod na yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ldog pa 'ga' zhig las rgyu 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhes spyir dbang po sgrub par byed pa de ltar lus kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu
translated: If you assert that,üîΩthen just as form, attention, and so on exist, but the cessation of some effect, consciousness, is due to some cause, in general, the sense faculty is established.

original: gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ldog pa las rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa yin pa de ltar na spyir blo grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ldog pa las rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa yin pa de ltar na spyir blo grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the cessation of some effect, such as the movement of the body, is due to some cause, and in that case, in general, mind is established.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúSome effect,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ltar gzugs dang yid la byed pa ma gtogs par rgyu 'ga' zhig yod pa de ltar spyir dbang po grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar gzugs dang yid la byed pa ma gtogs par rgyu 'ga' zhig yod pa de ltar spyir dbang po grub pa yin te /
translated: Just as a cause exists apart from form and mental activity, so too the sense faculty is established in general.

original: blo'i rgyu nyid dbang po yin par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo'i rgyu nyid dbang po yin par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The cause of cognition itself is established as the sense faculty.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu nyid dbang po'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu nyid dbang po'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that kind of cause is expressed by the word ‚Äúsense faculty.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu 'ga' zhig ldog pa las spyir rgyu tsam 'grub pa na blo rgyu nyid yin par shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes @241b bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu 'ga' zhig ldog pa las spyir rgyu tsam 'grub pa na blo rgyu nyid yin par shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes @241b bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when a cause is established in general from the cessation of some effect, cognition is not to be known as the cause itself.

original: blo ni rgyu tsam du 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo ni rgyu tsam du 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Cognition is not asserted to be merely the cause.

original: de nyid ni 'on kyang blo'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'on kyang blo'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that case, he says ‚Äúbut cognition is established by its own nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa na //
analyzed: blo'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa na //
translated: When cognition is established by its own nature,

original: blo 'di'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo 'di'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it should be known that this is the effect of this cognition. This is the meaning.

original: de de ltar na tshogs pa tha dad pa skye ba can yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de de ltar na tshogs pa tha dad pa skye ba can yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In that case, even when the collection is different, it arises, and so on.

original: blo'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de las tshogs pa tha dad pa skye ba can de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yod pa yin la /
analyzed: blo'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de las tshogs pa tha dad pa skye ba can de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yod pa yin la /
translated: And that which is the collection of cognitions, which is the cause of the arising of a different collection, exists as the entity of cause and effect.

original: blo'i rtags nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo'i rtags nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the mark of cognition.üîΩBecause another mode is impossible.

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa dang / tshogs pa tha dad pa la rag las pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas blo'i rtags nyid yin pa bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa dang / tshogs pa tha dad pa la rag las pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas blo'i rtags nyid yin pa bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is the refutation of the assertion that the mark of cognition is dependent on a single collection or on a different collection, in the manner that has been explained.

original: rnam pa gsum pa ni yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi rtags gang gis bdag nyid la blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtags gang gis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa ni yod pa ma yin no // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi rtags gang gis bdag nyid la blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtags gang gis te /
translated: A third mode does not exist.üîΩThis is the case, but by what mark?

original: lus kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pas rjes su dpog pa po bdag la blo bsgrub par 'dod pa'i'o //
analyzed: lus kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pas rjes su dpog pa po bdag la blo bsgrub par 'dod pa'i'o //
translated: By what mark does the self, which is the one who desires to establish cognition in the self, who infers by the movements of the body, etc.?üîΩFrom that very mark, in another.

original: rtags de nyid las gzhan la zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la blo 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags de nyid las gzhan la zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la blo 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The establishment of cognition in the similar class will occur.

original: dpe med par zhes bya bar sems so //
analyzed: dpe med par zhes bya bar sems so //
translated: Without an example, so it is thought.

original: de grub pas gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa ste phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de grub pas gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa ste phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe establishment of that‚Äù means the establishment of the pervasion. ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means other than the similar class; the term ‚Äúclass‚Äù is synonymous with ‚Äúproperty.‚Äù

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba grub pa yin zhing rjes su 'gro ba de las bdag la yang rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba grub pa yin zhing rjes su 'gro ba de las bdag la yang rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion is established, and from that pervasion, the existence of the property in the subject is inferred.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du mthun pa'i phyogs la dpe med par blo rjes su dpog par byed cing phyogs kyi chos bdag la ni dpe'i stobs kyis yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du mthun pa'i phyogs la dpe med par blo rjes su dpog par byed cing phyogs kyi chos bdag la ni dpe'i stobs kyis yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that the existence of the property in the subject is inferred from the power of the example, but the existence of the property in the similar class is inferred from the pervasion.

original: de de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
translated: He refutes this by saying, ‚ÄúIf that were so . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rtags gang gis bdag la blo rjes su dpog par 'dod pa'i rtags de nyid las sngar 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba bdag la rjes su dpag pa de las grub pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la blo rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las sngar
analyzed: rtags gang gis bdag la blo rjes su dpog par 'dod pa'i rtags de nyid las sngar 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba bdag la rjes su dpag pa de las grub pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la blo rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las sngar
translated: The reason that is accepted as inferring the existence of the mind in the self is the same reason that previously established the pervasion. That which is established from that inference of the pervasion is the existence of the property in the subject.

original: grub pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa yin no //
translated: That is established first.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa grub pa'i dus phyis bdag la blo rjes su dpog pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa grub pa'i dus phyis bdag la blo rjes su dpog pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the inference is subsequent to the establishment of the cognition in regard to the self.

original: re zhig / bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la yang//
analyzed: re zhig / bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la yang//
translated: Now, in regard to the probandum, which is other,

original: zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: the cognition is the example.

original: de ltar na de la yang blo dpe nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de la yang blo dpe nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in that case, the cognition is stated to be the example.

original: dpe med par ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yang blo'i mthun pa'i phyogs grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe med par ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yang blo'i mthun pa'i phyogs grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Without an example, the establishment of the cognition in regard to the similar instance is not possible.

original: rjes su 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rtags nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de'i yang dpe gzhan bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa 'dis ni @242a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rtags nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de'i yang dpe gzhan bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa 'dis ni @242a * //
translated: That which is stated as the reason for the proof of the pervasion, its example is also to be established.

original: thug pa med pa ring du song ba bstan to //
analyzed: thug pa med pa ring du song ba bstan to //
translated: This shows that the regress is infinite.üîΩOtherwise, if it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na gal te der zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te der zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: in that case, in regard to the similar instance,

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //
translated: here, in regard to the self,

original: dpe med pa can zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ngo //
analyzed: dpe med pa can zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ngo //
translated: without an example, in regard to the similar instance,

original: de'i tshe 'brel pa bzung ba can de las zhes bya ba ni g-yo 'gul la sogs pa blo'i 'bras bu nyid du bdag la bzung ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'brel pa bzung ba can de las zhes bya ba ni g-yo 'gul la sogs pa blo'i 'bras bu nyid du bdag la bzung ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, from that means from the grasping of the connection, which is the result of the mind such as movement, etc.

original: gal te de la gcig bdag nyid gsal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni blo snga ma 'dzin par byed pa phyis 'byung ba'i blo gzhan mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni blo snga ma'o //
analyzed: gal te de la gcig bdag nyid gsal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni blo snga ma 'dzin par byed pa phyis 'byung ba'i blo gzhan mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni blo snga ma'o //
translated: If it is said one part becomes manifest, the previous mind that is the agent of grasping is the other mind that arises later.

original: sgron ma ni gsal bar byed pa yin zhing bum pa ni gsal bar bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: sgron ma ni gsal bar byed pa yin zhing bum pa ni gsal bar bya ba yin no ;
translated: The lamp is the illuminator, and the pot is the illuminated.

original: / tha snyad du yang mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: / tha snyad du yang mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du'o //
translated: If it is said it would not be conventional, but it is, it is conventional.

original: de ltar na don 'di nyid gsal ba yin na 'di la the tshom gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas don gsal ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don 'di nyid gsal ba yin na 'di la the tshom gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas don gsal ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this very meaning is the conventional expression of the manifestation of the object, as in If it is manifest in this way, what does doubt do here? and so on.

original: yul ni ci ltar gsal ba yin //
analyzed: yul ni ci ltar gsal ba yin //
translated: How is the object manifest?

original: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: This statement it is not belongs to the opponent.

original: 'dis ni bdag nyid gsal ba nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /üîΩ'on kyang de bdag nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa de ltar na blo phyi ma bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid gsal ba nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te / 'on kyang de bdag nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa de ltar na blo phyi ma bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the opinion of the proponent of tenets.üîΩHowever, if it has the nature of clarity, then the later cognition is said to be that which clarifies itself.

original: blo bzhin du blo dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir blo gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar blo dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can yin na yang phyis 'byung ba'i blo snga ma gsal
analyzed: blo bzhin du blo dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir blo gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar blo dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can yin na yang phyis 'byung ba'i blo snga ma gsal
translated: It is like cognition, because it is similar to cognition. Therefore, it is that which clarifies cognition. This means that just as cognition, although having a nature that is not that which clarifies, clarifies the earlier cognition that arises later,

original: bar byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: bar byed pa de ltar na /
translated: in the same way,

original: don yang gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis blo de lta bur gyur pa dang 'dra ba yin pa de ltar na blo gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don yang gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis blo de lta bur gyur pa dang 'dra ba yin pa de ltar na blo gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the object, although having a nature that is not that which clarifies, is similar to that cognition, and therefore it is that which clarifies cognition.

original: gsal ba dang gsal ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i rten can /
analyzed: gsal ba dang gsal ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i rten can /
translated: It is the basis of the clear and the unclear.

original: gsal bya dang gsal byed khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo'i rten can ni gsal byed kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gsal bya dang gsal byed khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo'i rten can ni gsal byed kyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the distinction of the manifest and the manifesting‚Äù means that the basis of the nature of manifestation is the distinction of the manifesting.

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i khyad par ni gsal bya'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i khyad par ni gsal bya'i khyad par yin no //
translated: The distinction that is not the nature of manifestation is the distinction of the manifest.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gsal bya dang gsal byed kyi ngo bor 'jig rten tha snyad du yod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gsal bya dang gsal byed kyi ngo bor 'jig rten tha snyad du yod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to what exists in the conventions of the world as the nature of the manifest and the manifesting.

original: mthong zhes bya bar nges pa med //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya bar nges pa med //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù is not ascertained.

original: ces bya ba ni don 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par nges pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni don 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par nges pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAscertained‚Äù means that there is a determination such as ‚ÄúI see this object.‚Äù

original: de yang don mthong bar byed par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang don mthong bar byed par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that seeing causes the seeing of an object.

original: de'i phyir gang las te don mthong ba las mthong ba nges par 'gyur ba 'di'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las te don mthong ba las mthong ba nges par 'gyur ba 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúfrom that,‚Äù that is, from seeing an object, ‚Äúseeing‚Äù would be ascertained.

original: de'i'am @242b zhes bya ba ni don gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i'am @242b zhes bya ba ni don gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object.

original: don de las kyang don gyi yul can gyi shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don de las kyang don gyi yul can gyi shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means that from that object, ‚Äúanother,‚Äù that is, an object-possessor, ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is what is meant.

original: don mthong ba'i dus nyid ni don nyams su myong ba'i dus nyid mthong bas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: don mthong ba'i dus nyid ni don nyams su myong ba'i dus nyid mthong bas brjod par bya ste /
translated: The time when the object is seen is the time when the experience of the object is seen.

original: don gyi yul can gyi shes pa'i nyams su myong ba med par don mthong ba grub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: don gyi yul can gyi shes pa'i nyams su myong ba med par don mthong ba grub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: The meaning is that it is not established that the object is seen without the experience of the consciousness that has the object.

original: / de yang zhes bya ba ni don mthong ba dang dus mtshungs pa don mthong ba'i yul can gyi shes pa'i mthong ba'o //
analyzed: / de yang zhes bya ba ni don mthong ba dang dus mtshungs pa don mthong ba'i yul can gyi shes pa'i mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the seeing of the object, which is the seeing of the consciousness that has the object of the seen object.

original: slob dpon gyis des smras pa'i grub pa la sgrub pa'i lan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis des smras pa'i grub pa la sgrub pa'i lan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] says, ‚ÄúThe response to the proof that he states,‚Äù

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gzhan gyis smras pa'i grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon bsal ba shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gzhan gyis smras pa'i grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon bsal ba shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par bshad do //
translated: because the master DignƒÅga explains that the fault in the proof that others state is that if consciousness is experienced by another consciousness, there is an infinite regress.

original: 'di la lan sngar bshad zin mod kyi skyon lhag pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir yang nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la lan sngar bshad zin mod kyi skyon lhag pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir yang nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Although the response to this has already been explained, it is presented again in order to state an additional fault.

original: yun ring gnas pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring gnas pa med phyir ro //
translated: because it does not endure for a long time.

original: zhes bya ba ni dus ring por gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus ring por gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not endure for a long time.

original: rdul phra rab gcig mngon par bsgres pa'i dus ni skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid du rdul phra rab gzhan las 'das pa'i dus de srid ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig mngon par bsgres pa'i dus ni skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid du rdul phra rab gzhan las 'das pa'i dus de srid ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The time it takes for one atom to be traversed is a moment. The time it takes for one atom to be traversed is a moment. The meaning is: the time it takes to traverse one atom is a moment.

original: dus de srid ni skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus de srid ni skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: that time is a moment.

original: skad cig ma du ma 'das pa'i dus kyi mtha' can ni mig 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa zhes bya ba la skad cig ma du ma 'das pa ni bsgres pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma du ma 'das pa'i dus kyi mtha' can ni mig 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa zhes bya ba la skad cig ma du ma 'das pa ni bsgres pa'o //
translated: The time it takes for many moments to pass is the time of opening and closing the eyes. Many moments have passed.

original: gang la de nyid kyi dus kyi mtha' yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de nyid kyi dus kyi mtha' yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has that time as its limit is so described.

original: skad cig ma du ma 'das pa'i dus kyi mtha' can te /
analyzed: skad cig ma du ma 'das pa'i dus kyi mtha' can te /
translated: The time it takes for many moments to pass is the time of opening and closing the eyes.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has that as its limit is so described.

original: mig 'byed pa gcig dang mig 'dzums pa gcig ces bya ba so sor sbyar ro //
analyzed: mig 'byed pa gcig dang mig 'dzums pa gcig ces bya ba so sor sbyar ro //
translated: One opening of the eye and one closing of the eye are to be supplied in each case.

original: dus de tsam gyis zhes pa ni mig 'dzums pa gcig gi dus dang mig 'byed pa gcig gi dus kyis so //
analyzed: dus de tsam gyis zhes pa ni mig 'dzums pa gcig gi dus dang mig 'byed pa gcig gi dus kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that time‚Äù means in the time of one closing of the eye and in the time of one opening of the eye.

original: ches shin tu chung ba yang zhes bya ba gcig tsam la yang ngo //
analyzed: ches shin tu chung ba yang zhes bya ba gcig tsam la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven the smallest‚Äù means even the smallest moment.

original: yi ge grub pa'i dus na gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa'i nyan pa po'i blo ni skad cig du ma'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge grub pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge grub pa'i dus na gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa'i nyan pa po'i blo ni skad cig du ma'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge grub pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAt the time of the production of the letter, there is no existence‚Äù means that the cognition of the hearer, included in one moment, does not exist at the time of the production of the letter, which has the nature of many moments.

original: de bas na yi ge gcig gi dus na mi gnas pa'i blo gcig gi yi ge gcig 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge gcig gi dus na mi gnas pa'i blo gcig gi yi ge gcig 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention that at the time of one letter, the cognition, which does not endure, does not apprehend the one letter.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi nyan pa po'i blo'i skad cig ma mang po rim gyis skye bar gyur pa @243a * //
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi nyan pa po'i blo'i skad cig ma mang po rim gyis skye bar gyur pa @243a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is admitted that it does occur, but the many moments of the cognition of the hearer arise in sequence.

original: dag gis rim gyis yi ge'i cha thams cad yongs su gcod par byed cing blo'i skad cig ma de dag gis kyang phyis yi ge gcig tu zhen par byed pa can gyi dran pa skyed par byed pa de bas na de las ring po la sogs pa'i yiüîΩge 'dzin pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dag gis rim gyis yi ge'i cha thams cad yongs su gcod par byed cing blo'i skad cig ma de dag gis kyang phyis yi ge gcig tu zhen par byed pa can gyi dran pa skyed par byed pa de bas na de las ring po la sogs pa'i yi ge 'dzin pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the convention of apprehending a long letter and so on arises.

original: de'i phyir yi ge'i cha thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge'i cha thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: Therefore, all the parts of a letter are not the same.

original: gal te blo de dag rang rig pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te blo de dag rang rig pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If those moments of consciousness were the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: myong bar 'gyur zhing phyis yi ge gcig 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dran par byed par 'gyur na de dag la myong ba nyid yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur zhing phyis yi ge gcig 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dran par byed par 'gyur na de dag la myong ba nyid yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then they would be experienced and later generate memory that has the nature of apprehending a single letter. But they do not have experience,

original: rang rig pa nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we do not accept reflexive awareness.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi rang rig phar mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang yi ge'i cha so so la skyes pa'i blo de dag rnams dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid kyi blo rnam par rtog pa 'dzin par byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bas na
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi rang rig phar mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang yi ge'i cha so so la skyes pa'i blo de dag rnams dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid kyi blo rnam par rtog pa 'dzin par byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bas na
translated: However, a thought that simultaneously arises with the mind that is generated from the individual parts of the syllables apprehends the thought.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba'i blo dag 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba'i blo dag 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it apprehends the mind that experiences other consciousnesses,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na / de'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the fault explained earlier does not exist.üîΩTo respond: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúit is not that conceptual and nonconceptual minds and so on do not simultaneously engage their objects.‚Äù

original: sgra'i cha la dmigs pa can gyi rtog pa med pa'i blo dang / de la dmigs pa can gyi yid kyi blo dag gcig car 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra'i cha la dmigs pa can gyi rtog pa med pa'i blo dang / de la dmigs pa can gyi yid kyi blo dag gcig car 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is that a nonconceptual mind that focuses on a part of a word and a mental mind that focuses on that do not simultaneously engage their objects.

original: de bas na rang rig pa med par shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar 'dod pa khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir yi ge'i cha gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na rang rig pa med par shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar 'dod pa khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir yi ge'i cha gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIn the case of a single phoneme . . . ‚Äù

original: ches shin tu chung ba zhes bya ba ni gang las gzhan du cha gzhan du rtog pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde nyid la skad cig mas bsdus pa 'dzin par byed pa'i blo gang yin pa de'i skad cig ma tsam gyis 'jig pa yin na'o //
analyzed: ches shin tu chung ba zhes bya ba ni gang las gzhan du cha gzhan du rtog pa yod pa ma yin te / de nyid la skad cig mas bsdus pa 'dzin par byed pa'i blo gang yin pa de'i skad cig ma tsam gyis 'jig pa yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExtremely small‚Äù means that it is not conceived of as having other parts.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends it is momentary.

original: de ma thag tu de myong ba'i blo zhes bya ba ni ches chung ba'i yi ge'i cha de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo ni nyams su myong ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu de myong ba'i blo zhes bya ba ni ches chung ba'i yi ge'i cha de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo ni nyams su myong ba'i blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that immediately experiences it‚Äù is the cognition that apprehends that extremely small part of the phoneme. It is the experiencing cognition.

original: de ltar na shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar grub par 'gyur na blo'i yul can nyams su myong ba'i blo skye ba'i dus na gzhan yi ge'i cha gang yin pa de la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar grub par 'gyur na blo'i yul can nyams su myong ba'i blo skye ba'i dus na gzhan yi ge'i cha gang yin pa de la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is established that consciousness is experienced by another consciousness. But when the mind that experiences the object of the mind arises, there is no mind that apprehends the other, the part of the syllable.

original: blo gnyis cig car 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gnyis cig car 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two minds do not operate simultaneously.

original: de bas na blo la dmigs pa des de las gzhan pa'i yi ge'i cha'i shes pa chod pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul gyi yi ge 'dzin pa'i dus na shes pa mi skye ba nyid chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na blo la dmigs pa des de las gzhan pa'i yi ge'i cha'i shes pa chod pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul gyi yi ge 'dzin pa'i dus na shes pa mi skye ba nyid chod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind that observes the mind does not experience the consciousness of the other, the part of the syllable.

original: rim bzhin du sgra'i snang ba gnas par @243b mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni go rims med pa can la rim bzhin du snang ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rim bzhin du sgra'i snang ba gnas par @243b mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni go rims med pa can la rim bzhin du snang ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The appearance of sound does not remain in a nonsequential order, because it is contradictory for the appearance to be nonsequential.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po drug cu pa /
analyzed: bam po drug cu pa /
translated: BOOK SIXTY

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir der snang ba de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir der snang ba de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThat appearance there is not the appearance of the parts of the letters in sequence.‚Äù

original: yi ge'i cha rim bzhin du gzung ba ma yin par snang ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha rim bzhin du gzung ba ma yin par snang ba'o //
translated: It is not the appearance of the parts of the letters in sequence.

original: gal te blo rim bzhin du snang ba can du ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo rim bzhin du snang ba can du ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not the case that the cognition appears in sequence,

original: blo go rims med pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: blo go rims med pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf the cognition were not sequential,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo ni cig car snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: blo ni cig car snang ba'i phyir //
translated: ‚Äú Because the cognition appears instantaneously‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha cig car snang ba'i phyir de la tha dad pa med pa'i yi ge rim med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha cig car snang ba'i phyir de la tha dad pa med pa'i yi ge rim med par 'gyur ro //
translated: means that because the parts of the letters appear instantaneously, the letters would not be different and would not be sequential.

original: yi ge ring mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rim ma yin par snang ba nyid kyis thung ba dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge ring mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rim ma yin par snang ba nyid kyis thung ba dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú The letters would not be long‚Äù means that because they appear in a nonsequential manner, they would be the same as short sounds.

original: gal te dus shin tu chung bar gcig 'dzin cing gzhan ni rgyun gyis 'dzin pa de'i tshe ring po dang thung du dag tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dus shin tu chung bar gcig 'dzin cing gzhan ni rgyun gyis 'dzin pa de'i tshe ring po dang thung du dag tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one grasps a very short sound as one and another as a continuum, then long and short sounds would be different.

original: de nyid ni de ltar na skad gsang mthon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la cha du ma'i rim gyis rgyun du snang ba las yin no zhes bya ba ni cha du ma'i gang yin pa de nyid rgyun yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar na skad gsang mthon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la cha du ma'i rim gyis rgyun du snang ba las yin no zhes bya ba ni cha du ma'i gang yin pa de nyid rgyun yin no //
translated: That is so, because in the case of the statement ‚Äúwith a loud voice,‚Äù etc., the continuum appears gradually through many parts.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod na yi ge'i cha snga ma rang nyid yod pa'i dus na blo skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod na yi ge'i cha snga ma rang nyid yod pa'i dus na blo skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If you assert that the continuum is the many parts, then the earlier part of the syllable does not generate cognition when it exists by itself.

original: 'on kyang yi ge'i cha gnyis pa grub pa la ltos nas grub pa yod na de dang lhan cig skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang yi ge'i cha gnyis pa grub pa la ltos nas grub pa yod na de dang lhan cig skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: However, if it exists in dependence on the establishment of the second part of the syllable, then it generates cognition in dependence on the second part.

original: de'i phyir skyed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skyed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Therefore, if it generates cognition, etc.

original: yi ge snga ma rang yod pa'i dus na gal te skyed par mi byed pa de las phyis kyi yan lag gi dus na cha snga ma skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i rgyus na rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge snga ma rang yod pa'i dus na gal te skyed par mi byed pa de las phyis kyi yan lag gi dus na cha snga ma skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i rgyus na rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the earlier syllable does not generate cognition when it exists by itself, then later, at the time of the second part, the earlier part does not exist because it is momentary. Therefore it is not a cause because it is nonexistent.

original: yi ge'i cha snga ma tha ma'i bar gnas na zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha snga ma tha ma'i bar gnas na zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha'o //
translated: The first part of the syllable up to the last is the part of the verse.

original: yi ge'i cha tha ma'i bar du gnas pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha tha ma'i bar du gnas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha tha ma'i bar du gnas pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha tha ma'i bar du gnas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The last part of the syllable is that which exists up to the last part of the syllable.

original: dus mtshungs du ma yang thos pa'i phyir ring po'i blo ma yin no //
analyzed: dus mtshungs du ma yang thos pa'i phyir ring po'i blo ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of length does not occur because many [syllables] are heard simultaneously.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pa 'dzin pas yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pa 'dzin pas yin no //
translated: It is the apprehension of the stream's engagement.

original: rgyun mthong ba med par bstan pa'i phyir de phyis zhes pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyun mthong ba med par bstan pa'i phyir de phyis zhes pa smos so //
translated: In order to show that the stream is not seen, he says after that.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni yi ge'i cha tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni yi ge'i cha tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The commentary on this part of the verse begins with the last part of the syllable.

original: gnas pa med ces bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni gnas pa yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa med ces bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni gnas pa yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on there is no abiding is if there is no abiding.

original: dus mtshungs pa can gyi yul dang yul can gyi dngos po khas len pa la de skad ces bya ba'i /üîΩyul gnas @244a * //üîΩpa med pa'i phyir de'i blo gnas pa med par brjod pa gang yin pa de dus mtshungs pa can gyi yul dang yul can gyi dngos po khas len pa yod na rnam par shes pa la rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid yul nyid yin pa gang
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa can gyi yul dang yul can gyi dngos po khas len pa la de skad ces bya ba'i / yul gnas @244a * // pa med pa'i phyir de'i blo gnas pa med par brjod pa gang yin pa de dus mtshungs pa can gyi yul dang yul can gyi dngos po khas len pa yod na rnam par shes pa la rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid yul nyid yin pa gang
translated: This is said in regard to the acceptance of the objective domain and subject as simultaneous.üîΩSince the objective domain does not endure, the statement that the cognition does not endure is made in regard to the acceptance of the objective domain and subject as simultaneous.

original: yin pa de'i yul la 'gags pa na shes pa'i gnas pa yang 'gal ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: yin pa de'i yul la 'gags pa na shes pa'i gnas pa yang 'gal ba med pa yin te /
translated: That which is the cause of the ability to posit consciousness as the objective domain, when the objective domain is the cause of the ability to posit consciousness as the objective domain, then there is no contradiction in the endurance of the cognition when the objective domain ceases.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dus tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dus tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cause and effect endure at different times.üîΩThe long vowel and the three measures.

original: yi ge'i ring po dang tshad gsum pa'i zhes bya ba la rgyu zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i ring po dang tshad gsum pa'i zhes bya ba la rgyu zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcause‚Äù should be supplied.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù refers to investigation, etc.

original: sgra tsam dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgra dag gis so //
analyzed: sgra tsam dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgra dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy mere words‚Äù means by words.

original: rang gi shes pas chod pa blo du mas 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du ches shin tu chung ba'i yi ge'i cha re re la 'dzin par byed pa skad cig ma tsam gyis 'jig pa yod pa de ma thag pa de nyams su
analyzed: rang gi shes pas chod pa blo du mas 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du ches shin tu chung ba'i yi ge'i cha re re la 'dzin par byed pa skad cig ma tsam gyis 'jig pa yod pa de ma thag pa de nyams su
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind that apprehends a long vowel sound is not interrupted by the mind that apprehends a different vowel sound‚Äù indicates that the mind that apprehends each part of a very small letter is momentary and disintegrates.

original: myong ba'i blos de las gzhan pa'i yi ge'i cha'i shes pa chod pa ma yin te de ltar na ring po 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de bsal ba yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong ba'i blos de las gzhan pa'i yi ge'i cha'i shes pa chod pa ma yin te de ltar na ring po 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de bsal ba yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that experiences that [mind] does not apprehend a different vowel sound.

original: gal te yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa'i blo rgyun mi 'chad pa skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa'i blo rgyun mi 'chad pa skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind that apprehends the part of a letter arises in an uninterrupted continuum,

original: 'o na gang blo gzhan gyis kyang gang nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang blo gzhan gyis kyang gang nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
translated: then what is experienced by another mind?

original: de'i phyir yi ge'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚Äúthe mind that apprehends the parts of a letter,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyams su myong ba des blo ring po la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba des blo ring po la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind that experiences that [mind] becomes the mind that apprehends a long vowel sound, and so on.

original: 'di snyam du gang gi tshe yi ge'i cha tha ma 'dzin pa'i blo nyams su myong ba de bas na de nyams su myong ba'i shugs las yi ge'i cha go rims bzhin du nyams su myong ba bsdus nas /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gi tshe yi ge'i cha tha ma 'dzin pa'i blo nyams su myong ba de bas na de nyams su myong ba'i shugs las yi ge'i cha go rims bzhin du nyams su myong ba bsdus nas /
translated: In this regard, you should contemplate as follows: Since the cognition that apprehends the final part of a syllable is experienced, the cognition that experiences it gathers the experience of the parts of the syllable in order.üîΩ

original: yi ge gcig tu 'dzin par byed pa'i dran pa gang yin pa sgrub par byed do zhes bsams pa'o//
analyzed: yi ge gcig tu 'dzin par byed pa'i dran pa gang yin pa sgrub par byed do zhes bsams pa'o//
translated: He thinks: ‚ÄúSince the awareness that apprehends the last part of the syllable is experienced, the memory that apprehends the syllable as a single unit is established by the force of the experience of the parts of the syllable in the right order.üîΩ‚Äù

original: rang nyid dam gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa gzhan rang rig pa de'i tshe khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid dam gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa gzhan rang rig pa de'i tshe khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of which is not experienced by itself or by another‚Äù means that the other consciousness that apprehends it, namely, autocognition, is not accepted at that time.

original: de bas na re zhig blo snga ma nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir yi ge ring po 'dzin pa'i dran pa skyed par mi nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig blo snga ma nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir yi ge ring po 'dzin pa'i dran pa skyed par mi nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, he thinks that the prior awareness is not unable to generate the memory that apprehends the long syllable because it does not experience itself.

original: yi ge'i cha tha ma 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba de yang zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha tha ma ches shin tu chung ba 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha tha ma 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba de yang zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha tha ma ches shin tu chung ba 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The last part of the syllable is called the ‚Äúholder,‚Äù and that also is the very smallest part of the syllable that is held.

original: yi ge'i yul can ring blo dran mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni kho bos yi ge ring po nyams su myong ngo zhes de ltar dran par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge'i yul can ring blo dran mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni kho bos yi ge ring po nyams su myong ngo zhes de ltar dran par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The memory of the cognition of the long syllable does not occur, meaning that the memory does not occur, ‚ÄúI have experienced the long syllable.‚Äù

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid ston par @244b byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid ston par @244b byed do //
translated: Thus, etc. shows just that.

original: yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa'i shes pa dag gis chod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa'i shes pa dag gis chod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is interrupted by the cognitions that apprehend the parts of the syllable.

original: yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa ni snang ba'i shes pa yin la de la 'dzin pa'i shes pa dag gis so //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa ni snang ba'i shes pa yin la de la 'dzin pa'i shes pa dag gis so //
translated: The apprehension of the parts of the syllable is the cognition of the appearance, and it is interrupted by the cognitions that apprehend that.

original: de gzhan la yang mtshungs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gzhan la yang mtshungs pa yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is the same for others as well.

original: de gzhan la yang mtshungs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de gzhan la yang mtshungs pa yin zhing /
translated: That is the same for others as well,

original: yi ge cig car thos pa yin //
analyzed: yi ge cig car thos pa yin //
translated: and the syllable is heard all at once.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been explained by such passages as ‚ÄúThe letter a is the supreme of all letters, because it is the first of all, and because it is the best of all.‚Äù

original: chod ces bya ba ni yi ge'i chos so //
analyzed: chod ces bya ba ni yi ge'i chos so //
translated: ‚ÄúInterruption‚Äù is a property of letters.

original: yi ge thung gnyis dag ni brjod pa na //
analyzed: yi ge thung gnyis dag ni brjod pa na //
translated: When two short letters are pronounced,

original: chod pa med par 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: chod pa med par 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: there is confusion without interruption.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge aa gnyis dang / yi ge ai gnyis so sor brjod pa na rnam par chod pa med par yi ge gcig tu zhen pa'i 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge aa gnyis dang / yi ge ai gnyis so sor brjod pa na rnam par chod pa med par yi ge gcig tu zhen pa'i 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: When two a letters or two i letters are pronounced individually, there is confusion, the conception of a single letter without interruption.

original: de la yang blo 'jug pa mgyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de la yang blo 'jug pa mgyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that this is because the operation of the mind is very rapid.

original: dbang po las chod mthong na yang //
analyzed: dbang po las chod mthong na yang //
translated: Even when there is an interruption of the sense faculty,

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgras ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid bshad pa de nyid kyi phyir rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgras ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid bshad pa de nyid kyi phyir rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
translated: the sense faculty is explained by the word ‚Äúear‚Äù because it is the ear consciousness. Therefore, it is explained by ‚Äúfrom the ear consciousness.‚Äù

original: dbang po las ni mi rung zhes bya ba ni rnam par chod pa dag la chod pa med par 'khrul pa dbang po'i shes pa las ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po las ni mi rung zhes bya ba ni rnam par chod pa dag la chod pa med par 'khrul pa dbang po'i shes pa las ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot from the sense faculty‚Äù means not from the sense consciousness, which is mistaken in regard to what is hidden.

original: 'di ni yid 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni yid 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a mistake of the mental faculty.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i shes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i shes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOf the consciousnesses that experience‚Äù means of the consciousnesses that are accepted as the apprehender of consciousness.

original: de dag kyang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba de la gzugs dang / ro dang dri la sogs pa'i blo re re las nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de ma thag tu 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba de la gzugs dang / ro dang dri la sogs pa'i blo re re las nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de ma thag tu 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod par bya'o //
translated: And those are to be accepted as the immediately preceding condition of the consciousness that experiences that, which is a consciousness that is different from the consciousness that experiences it.

original: des na gal te nyams su myong ba'i shes pa chod par byed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnam par chod pa dag chod pa la chod pa med par 'khrul par dbang po'i blo 'gyur na dbang po'i shes pa thams cad 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te nyams su myong ba'i shes pa chod par byed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnam par chod pa dag chod pa la chod pa med par 'khrul par dbang po'i blo 'gyur na dbang po'i shes pa thams cad 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that all sense cognitions would be mistaken.

original: dus kyi mtha' mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus kyi mtha' mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus kyi mtha' mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the end of time is not tenable.

original: dus kyi mtha' ni skad cig ma yin te /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' ni skad cig ma yin te /
translated: The end of time is a moment.

original: gang / gzugs ming dus mtha' rdul yig dang // skad cig ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang / gzugs ming dus mtha' rdul yig dang // skad cig ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that form, name, end of time, atom, letter, and moment are the same.

original: rang 'dzin pa can gyi bar du chod pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha gcig la 'dzin pa'i blo'i de ma thag pa'i blo 'dzin par byed pa'i blo skye ba des /
analyzed: rang 'dzin pa can gyi bar du chod pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha gcig la 'dzin pa'i blo'i de ma thag pa'i blo 'dzin par byed pa'i blo skye ba des /
translated: Up to the cognition apprehending itself is obstructed means that the cognition that arises immediately after the cognition apprehending one part of a letter obstructs the cognition apprehending the second part of the letter.

original: yi ge'i cha gnyis pa 'dzin par byed pa'i blo chod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha gnyis pa 'dzin par byed pa'i blo chod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The cognition apprehending the second part of the letter is obstructed.

original: de bzhin du yi ge'i cha so so la 'dzin pa chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge'i cha so so la 'dzin pa chod pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the apprehension of the individual parts of the syllables is interrupted.

original: yi ge rnams chod pa thos pa na yang zhes bya ba ni @245a * //
analyzed: yi ge rnams chod pa thos pa na yang zhes bya ba ni @245a * //
translated: When the syllables are heard without interruption,

original: yi ge'i cha rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge'i cha rnams so //
translated: the parts of the syllables.üîΩIf the cognitions of the sense faculties are confused and without interruption,

original: chod pa med par 'khrul pa dbang po'i blo rnams yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gal te dbang po'i blo 'khrul par 'dod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrim gyis yi ge mang po dag la par dang bcas par 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yi ge'i cha la 'dzin pa bar dang bcas pa de ltar lha sbyin la sogs pa'i tshig 'god pa can gyi yi ge mang po dag la 'dzin pa yang
analyzed: chod pa med par 'khrul pa dbang po'i blo rnams yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gal te dbang po'i blo 'khrul par 'dod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rim gyis yi ge mang po dag la par dang bcas par 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yi ge'i cha la 'dzin pa bar dang bcas pa de ltar lha sbyin la sogs pa'i tshig 'god pa can gyi yi ge mang po dag la 'dzin pa yang
translated: then, if you accept that the cognitions of the sense faculties are confused,üîΩthen the apprehension of many syllables with their individual parts is also interrupted,üîΩjust as the apprehension of the parts of the syllables is interrupted.

original: bar dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bar dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The apprehension of many syllables with their individual parts is also interrupted,

original: blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blos bar du chod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blos bar du chod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition that apprehends them is interrupted.

original: de bas na 'dzin pa bar dang bcas pa snang ba na nyams su myong ba'i blos yi ge 'dzin pa'i blo chod pa yin na log pa'i don can du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dzin pa bar dang bcas pa snang ba na nyams su myong ba'i blos yi ge 'dzin pa'i blo chod pa yin na log pa'i don can du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, when the appearance is interrupted by another cognition, if the cognition that experiences the letter interrupts the cognition that apprehends the letter, then it would have a different object.

original: yi ge rnams yongs su gcod par byed pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yi ge rnams yongs su gcod par byed pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not only the cognition of the letter that is interrupted,

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: but also the cognition of form, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dri dang ro la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dri dang ro la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes smell, taste, etc.

original: skad cig ma'i blos 'dzin pa na gzhan gyis rnam par chod pa na yang zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i blos 'dzin pa na gzhan gyis rnam par chod pa na yang zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: When the cognition of the letter is interrupted by another cognition, the commentary explains that ‚Äúif the cognition that experiences that interrupts the cognition of the letter, then it would have a different object.‚Äù

original: de nyams su myong ba'i blos zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i blos zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The cognition that experiences that is the cognition that apprehends the form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo 'dzin par byed pa'i blo gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo 'dzin par byed pa'i blo gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition that apprehends the letter is interrupted by another cognition.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo yang bar du chod pa nyid yin par mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo yang bar du chod pa nyid yin par mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The cognition of form, etc. is also similar in being interrupted,

original: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is experienced by another cognition.

original: yi ge 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig yongs su gcod par byed pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: yi ge 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig yongs su gcod par byed pa bzhin du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLike the apprehension of a letter‚Äù means like the apprehension of a single letter.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni dpe nyid kyi skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni dpe nyid kyi skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the example, because it is the occasion of the example.

original: rgyun gyis yi ge du ma 'dzin pa'i ngang tshun can ni don nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis yi ge du ma 'dzin pa'i ngang tshun can ni don nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning should be understood as the state of apprehending many letters in a continuum.

original: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa thams cad log pa'i don can nyid du mi 'gyur ba de ltar na dbang po'i shes pa dag chod pa med par 'khrul pa med par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa thams cad log pa'i don can nyid du mi 'gyur ba de ltar na dbang po'i shes pa dag chod pa med par 'khrul pa med par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is not the case that all sense consciousnesses have a nonexistent object, one should not accept that sense consciousnesses are nonerroneous and unimpeded.

original: de ltar na rgyun chad pa med par snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyun chad pa med par snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were the case that there was an appearance without interruption,

original: 'gyur ba yang yin pa de bas na shes pa dag rang rig pa yin par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang yin pa de bas na shes pa dag rang rig pa yin par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: then consciousnesses would be reflexive awareness. This is the thought.

original: skad cig ma dag la de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa gang yin pa de yang yid 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir dbang po 'khrul pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdbang po'i 'khrul pa las gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbang po nus pa med pa la sre bar byed pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma dag la de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa gang yin pa de yang yid 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir dbang po 'khrul pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dbang po'i 'khrul pa las gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbang po nus pa med pa la sre bar byed pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the recognition of the identity of the moments is also a deluded mind, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not a separate sense experience,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on kyang don med par snang ba can gsal ba'i shes pa cig car skye bar @245b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang don med par snang ba can gsal ba'i shes pa cig car skye bar @245b 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äú It is not a separate sense experience‚Äù means that the appearance of a nonexistent object is not a clear consciousness arising simultaneously.

original: de nyid ni dbang po'i 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni dbang po'i 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that this is the case with ‚ÄúThe sense experience,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i khyad par mtshon pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i khyad par mtshon pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Because it is not a representation of that,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po 'khrul pa las skyes pa mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i khyad par mtshon pa med pas don sre bar 'khrul pa me yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po 'khrul pa las skyes pa mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i khyad par mtshon pa med pas don sre bar 'khrul pa me yin gyi /
translated: The consciousness that arises from a sense experience that is deluded is a consciousness of a firebrand wheel, and so on. Because it is not a representation of that, it is deluded in apprehending a nonexistent object as an object.

original: 'on kyang cig car don med par snang ba can sre ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang cig car don med par snang ba can sre ba med pa yin no //
translated: But the simultaneous appearance of the object is not a superimposition.

original: de nyid sdud par byed pa'i dag ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid sdud par byed pa'i dag ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: The same point is clarified by the words ‚Äúhow‚Äù and so on in the Abhidharma-samuccaya.

original: skad cig ma dang po skad cig ma gnyis pa'i dus na mi gnas pa'i chad pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po skad cig ma gnyis pa'i dus na mi gnas pa'i chad pa'o //
translated: The first moment is cut off, since it does not endure in the time of the second moment.

original: skad cig ma re re la gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan no //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan no //
translated: It is different from the other, since it is different in each moment.

original: chad pa yang de yin la gzhan dang gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa yang de yin la gzhan dang gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: The compound ‚Äúcut off and different‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i don mthong ba yod na sre ba gang yin pa de nyid do shes pa'i ngo bo'i dran pa de bzhin du don gcig tu snang ba dang dbang po la brten pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i don mthong ba yod na sre ba gang yin pa de nyid do shes pa'i ngo bo'i dran pa de bzhin du don gcig tu snang ba dang dbang po la brten pa ste /
translated: When there is the perception of an object that is like that, the superimposition is just that. Memory is the nature of knowledge. In the same way, there is the appearance of a single object and the dependence on a sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i 'bras bu dbang po'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'bras bu dbang po'i shes pa'o //
translated: The result of the sense faculty is the sense consciousness.

original: don gcig tu snang ba ste sre ba med par snang ba'o //
analyzed: don gcig tu snang ba ste sre ba med par snang ba'o //
translated: There is the appearance of a single object, the appearance without superimposition.

original: de ltar na de la cig car gsal ba'i rnam pa gcig snang ba yin gyi dpyod pa ni /üîΩde'i de ma thag tu skyes pa nyid kyi phyir shes rang gi shes pas bsgribs pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na de la cig car gsal ba'i rnam pa gcig snang ba yin gyi dpyod pa ni / de'i de ma thag tu skyes pa nyid kyi phyir shes rang gi shes pas bsgribs pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, the aspect that appears to it is a single, simultaneous appearance.üîΩIf it is obscured by the cognition of itself,üîΩthen this cognition of the cognition of the object is not a cognition that is free from conceptual thought.üîΩThe cognition that analyzes the cognition is the third cognition.üîΩThe cognition that analyzes the cognition is the third cognition.

original: shes pa 'dzin pa'i shes pas bsgribs pa yin na yang rtogs pa dang bral ba 'di sre bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'dzin pa'i shes pas bsgribs pa yin na yang rtogs pa dang bral ba 'di sre bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that analyzes the cognition is the third cognition.üîΩThe cognition that analyzes the cognition is the third cognition.
