analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu skyes pa nyid kyi phyir shes pa la shes pa'i rjes su dpyod pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The cognition that analyzes the cognition is the third cognition.

original: de nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni /
translated: The cognition that analyzes the cognition is the

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bgrang ba'i don myong ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bgrang ba'i don myong ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is the aspect of apprehension.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba de lta bur rab tu grags pa ni'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba de lta bur rab tu grags pa ni'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúaspect‚Äù is well known in that sense.

original: de dag ni de'i nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba ni don dang don myong ba'o ;
analyzed: de dag ni de'i nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba ni don dang don myong ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Those are its experiences‚Äù means the object and the experience of the object.

original: / shes pa'i shes pas chod pa med pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa der snang bar gyur ba dag go //
analyzed: / shes pa'i shes pas chod pa med pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa der snang bar gyur ba dag go //
translated: The aspect of the cognition that is not interrupted by another cognition is the appearance of those.

original: de ltar na rgyun gyis 'jug pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa la rgyun mi 'chad par don dang dbang po'i shes pa rnang ba de yang mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyun gyis 'jug pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa la rgyun mi 'chad par don dang dbang po'i shes pa rnang ba de yang mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the uninterrupted appearance of the object and the cognition of the sense faculty in the sense cognition that operates in a continuum is also perception.

original: rigs pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: Reason is valid cognition.

original: dam pa yang yin la rigs pa yang yi @246a * //üîΩpa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam pa yang yin la rigs pa yang yi @246a * // pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is supreme and it is reason.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is that which engages by the power of the thing.

original: de nyid ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: That is what is being taught by ‚Äúit has the characteristic that was just explained‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig ji ltar snang ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang dang gang gis snang ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ji ltar snang ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang dang gang gis snang ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever appears in whatever way‚Äù refers to the cognition that appears in whatever aspect.

original: de ni de ltar tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs te zhes bya ba ni gnod pa can med pa can zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni de ltar tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs te zhes bya ba ni gnod pa can med pa can zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that ‚Äúit is valid knowledge in that way,‚Äù meaning that it is not undermined.

original: gal te de gang las she na shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te de gang las she na shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù it is said, ‚Äúbecause objects of knowledge are posited by the power of cognition.‚Äù

original: de la yang shes pa tsam tshad ma ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang shes pa tsam tshad ma ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, mere cognition is not valid knowledge.

original: de ltar na shes pas shes bya rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pas shes bya rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, valid knowledge is that which is nondeceptive with regard to the object that is to be known in reality.‚Äù

original: de ni de la tshad mas gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni de la tshad mas gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not undermined by valid knowledge with regard to that‚Äù means

original: shes pa de shes bya gang la skyes pa de la tshad mas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa de shes bya gang la skyes pa de la tshad mas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that valid knowledge does not undermine the object of knowledge in relation to which that cognition arises.

original: ci ste chod pa ma mthong na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don dang de myong ba rnam par chod pa dag ma mthong na yang ngo//
analyzed: ci ste chod pa ma mthong na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don dang de myong ba rnam par chod pa dag ma mthong na yang ngo//
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúEven though the object and its experience are not seen as separate,‚Äù etc.

analyzed: dpyod pa las zhes bya ba la re zhig don mthong ba des bdag nyid myong ba ma yin pas na shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin no zhes de ma thag tu bstan pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the analysis‚Äù means that since the object is not seen by itself, it is not experienced by another cognition, as was just explained.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par chod pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par chod pa mthong ba'o //

analyzed: de'i tshe 'o na cig car blo ma mthong ba yang rgyu ma yin te / cig car blo nyid mi skye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ni mdo sde dang mngon pa las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the sutras and the Abhidharma.üîΩJust as that is so, so too for the sense consciousnesses.

original: ci ltar 'di la yin pa de ltar dbang po'i shes pa dag la yang zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi skye ba de ltar dbang po'i shes pa rigs mthun pa dag kyang skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar 'di la yin pa de ltar dbang po'i shes pa dag la yang zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi skye ba de ltar dbang po'i shes pa rigs mthun pa dag kyang skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the two conceptual consciousnesses do not arise simultaneously, so too the sense consciousnesses of the same type do not arise simultaneously.

original: rtog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ngo shes pa cig kyang gzhan gyis ci ltar na gsal bar snang ba can nyid dang mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ngo shes pa cig kyang gzhan gyis ci ltar na gsal bar snang ba can nyid dang mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even if one follows conceptual consciousness, how can it be accepted as clear and direct perception?

original: de ltar na rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car mi 'byung zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car mi 'byung zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, consciousnesses of the same type do not occur simultaneously.

original: gal te yul gcig la rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa gnyis 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yul gcig la rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa gnyis 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If two consciousnesses of the same type were to occur with regard to a single object,

original: de la rnam pa gsal ba can mngon sum du 'gyur zhing cig shos sbyor bar byed pa'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur na de @246b yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩgzhan ni rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dag cig car skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsal ba can mngon sum du 'gyur zhing cig shos sbyor bar byed pa'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur na de @246b yang yod pa ma yin no // gzhan ni rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dag cig car skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: But this is not the case.üîΩOthers do not accept that non-conceptual and conceptual cognitions arise simultaneously.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yang cig car 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yang cig car 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand non-conceptual cognitions‚Äù is supplied from the commentary.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig ste /
translated: The reason is this:

original: ngo shes pa'i rnam par rtog pas de nyid 'di yin no zhes gsal bar snang ba can gyi dngos po de sre bar byed cing gcig tu byed pa'i rnam pa des ngo shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa de nyid gsal bar snang ba yin no snyam du gzhanüîΩdu sems na'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i rnam par rtog pas de nyid 'di yin no zhes gsal bar snang ba can gyi dngos po de sre bar byed cing gcig tu byed pa'i rnam pa des ngo shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa de nyid gsal bar snang ba yin no snyam du gzhanüîΩdu sems na'o //
translated: Others think that the conceptual cognition that recognizes an object is the same as the cognition that clearly perceives the object.

original: ngo shes pa gsal bar snang ba nyid dang gcig tu nges par bya ba mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo shes pa gsal bar snang ba nyid dang gcig tu nges par bya ba mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that which is asserted to be the valid cognition of direct perception, which is the ascertainment of the identity of the object that is clearly manifest to the cognition that recognizes it, he says:

original: ngo shes pa gsal bar snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ngo shes pa gsal bar snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that recognizes it is clearly manifest.‚Äù

original: gcig nyid la 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gcig la yang 'dra ba'i 'khrul pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis ngo shes pa dag snang ngo //
analyzed: gcig nyid la 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gcig la yang 'dra ba'i 'khrul pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis ngo shes pa dag snang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of error with respect to identity‚Äù means that, in this way, the cognition that recognizes it appears in the form of other and other errors with respect to identity.

original: de bas na gcig la 'khrul pa de ni gcig nyid du nges pa la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gcig la 'khrul pa de ni gcig nyid du nges pa la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that error with respect to identity is not a valid cognition with regard to the ascertainment of identity.

original: de de ltar na skra shad dang sgong la sogs pa shes pa tha dad pa can la yang de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa'i blo gsal bar snang ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na skra shad dang sgong la sogs pa shes pa tha dad pa can la yang de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa'i blo gsal bar snang ba yod pa yin no //
translated: In that case, even with respect to the different cognitions of floaters, hairs, and so on, there is the clear appearance of the cognition that recognizes them, thinking ‚ÄúThat is this.‚Äù

original: de la yang blo gzhan rtog pa med pa gzhan mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de la yang blo gzhan rtog pa med pa gzhan mi 'dod de /
translated: In that case, too, we do not assert that there is another nonconceptual cognition.

original: cig car blo gnyis mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car blo gnyis mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because two cognitions do not arise simultaneously.

original: de bas na mar me la sogs pa dag la yang ngo shes pa gsal bar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mar me la sogs pa dag la yang ngo shes pa gsal bar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that the light of a butterlamp and so on are also clearly manifest.

original: gal te gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa'i blo mngon sum nyid thob par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mar me la sogs pa'i ngo shes pa yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa'i blo mngon sum nyid thob par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mar me la sogs pa'i ngo shes pa yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the case that the cognition that recognizes ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù obtains the status of direct perception because it is the cause of clear manifestation, then the recognition of a butterlamp and so on would also be direct perception.

original: skra bregs pa yang skye ba la sogs pa 'dir yang don dam par tha dad par gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir mngon sum yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skra bregs pa yang skye ba la sogs pa 'dir yang don dam par tha dad par gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir mngon sum yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition that recognizes ‚ÄúThis is the same person whose head was shaved in a previous birth‚Äù would not be direct perception because it is the cause of the clear manifestation of the ultimate difference of this person from the one in the previous birth.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be a valid form of direct perception.

original: du ma la rnam pa gcig tu 'jug pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: du ma la rnam pa gcig tu 'jug pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that it is mistaken because it engages many objects as one.

original: de 'drar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khrul par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'drar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khrul par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú It would be like that‚Äù means ‚Äúit would be mistaken.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa'i ngo shes pa ni du ma la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa'i ngo shes pa ni du ma la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is shown to be a delusion‚Äù is because the recognition that is sought to be established as being the same is also seen in many things.

original: de ltar re zhig gzhan gyi bsam pas ngo shes pa dbang po la brten pa nyid yin par khas blangs nas 'khrul pa nyid yin par bstan cing /üîΩda ni dbang po la brten pa nyid ma yin no @247a * //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gzhan gyi bsam pas ngo shes pa dbang po la brten pa nyid yin par khas blangs nas 'khrul pa nyid yin par bstan cing / da ni dbang po la brten pa nyid ma yin no @247a * //
translated: Thus, first, having accepted that recognition is based on the sense faculties according to the opponent‚Äôs opinion, it is shown to be a delusion.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ngo shes pa de yang dbang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ngo shes pa de yang dbang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to show that it is not based on the sense faculties, it is said, ‚ÄúThat recognition is not of the sense faculties, etc.‚Äù

original: de chos sgro 'dogs zhes bya ba ni nga ltar la 'das pa'i chos de nyid 'di yin no zhes sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de chos sgro 'dogs zhes bya ba ni nga ltar la 'das pa'i chos de nyid 'di yin no zhes sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt superimposes a property‚Äù means that it superimposes the property of the past on the present.

original: gang las dbang skyes kyi shes pa yin te zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa ni snga phyi rtogs pas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang las dbang skyes kyi shes pa yin te zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa ni snga phyi rtogs pas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what is it a consciousness arisen from the sense faculties?‚Äù is intended to mean that a sense-faculty consciousness is empty of the realization of what is prior and what is subsequent.

original: 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba dran pa chos der sgro 'dogs pa dbang po'i shes pa la 'gyur na yang ste /üîΩkhas len na yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du don rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba dran pa chos der sgro 'dogs pa dbang po'i shes pa la 'gyur na yang ste / khas len na yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du don rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: If it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.

original: ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa snga phyi rtogs pas 'jug pa bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa snga phyi rtogs pas 'jug pa bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.

original: de las tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa med par ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa med par ro //
translated: If it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.

original: de'i shes pa la zhes bya ba ni don shes pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa don shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa gang yin pa de la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i shes pa la zhes bya ba ni don shes pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa don shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa gang yin pa de la yang ngo //
translated: If it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.

original: don gyi rnam pa snang ba gzhan cig car rtogs par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni don shes pa gzung ba nyid kyis de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa snang ba gzhan cig car rtogs par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni don shes pa gzung ba nyid kyis de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.üîΩIf it did, then, like the mental consciousness, it would understand objects.

original: de la gzung ba nyid du don gyi rnam pa gzhan bshad pa gang yin pa de la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzung ba nyid du don gyi rnam pa gzhan bshad pa gang yin pa de la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that regard, whatever is explained as an aspect of an object that appears as the object itself, that appears in the cognition of the object.

original: de skad du ji ltar don gyi rnam pa snang ba de ltar shes pa'i shes pa la yang don gyi shes pa'i rnam pa dus gcig tu snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du ji ltar don gyi rnam pa snang ba de ltar shes pa'i shes pa la yang don gyi shes pa'i rnam pa dus gcig tu snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that just as the aspect of the object appears, the aspect of the cognition of the object also appears simultaneously in the cognition.

original: don du snang ba gnyis su zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i shes pa la yang don du snang ba can gyi shes pa nyid don du snang ba yin zhing don gyi shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don 'ba' zhig yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: don du snang ba gnyis su zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i shes pa la yang don du snang ba can gyi shes pa nyid don du snang ba yin zhing don gyi shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don 'ba' zhig yin pa de bas na /
translated: The two appearances as objects means that in the cognition of the object, the cognition itself that appears as the object is the appearance as the object, and the cognition of the object is only the external object.

original: don du snang ba gnyis su cig car 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don du snang ba gnyis su cig car 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the two appearances as objects occur simultaneously.

original: shes pa de dag gi zhes bya ba ni don gyi shes pa dang de nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de dag gi zhes bya ba ni don gyi shes pa dang de nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Those cognitions means the cognition of the object and the cognition that experiences it.

original: don du snang ba gnyis tha dad pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni don gyi shes pa phyi rol gyi don du snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don du snang ba gnyis tha dad pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni don gyi shes pa phyi rol gyi don du snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In fact, the two appearances are different, because the cognition of the object appears as the external object.

original: gzhan yang don dang don shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te don shes pa dang shes pa'i snang ba nyams su myong ba'i dus na tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe don gyi shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de don dang
analyzed: gzhan yang don dang don shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te don shes pa dang shes pa'i snang ba nyams su myong ba'i dus na tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe don gyi shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de don dang
translated: Moreover, if the object and the cognition of the object are different, as in the case of the cognition of the object and the cognition of the cognition, then the object and the cognition of the object would be different.

original: don shes pa'i shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: don shes pa'i shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de /
translated: The appearance in the cognition of the object is the object,üîΩand the appearance in the cognition of the cognition of the object is the cognition of the object.

original: don shes pa yin pa de ltar na tha dad par rnam par gzhag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: don shes pa yin pa de ltar na tha dad par rnam par gzhag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In that case, they would be established as different,

original: phyis yul gyi khyad par las dran pa yang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis yul gyi khyad par las dran pa yang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and later memory would also be different due to the difference in the object.

original: ci skad du bshad pa'i snang ba tha dad pas don dang don shes pa @247b 'di nyams su myong ba'i gnas skabs su rtag tu 'dres par gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ci skad du bshad pa'i snang ba tha dad pas don dang don shes pa @247b 'di nyams su myong ba'i gnas skabs su rtag tu 'dres par gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: As explained, the object and the cognition of the object are always mixed together in the experience of their appearance.

original: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba'i dus na zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba'i dus na zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúwhen there is experience.‚Äù

original: don dang don gyi yid dag gi / myong ba'i rim bzhin skye na yang //
analyzed: don dang don gyi yid dag gi / myong ba'i rim bzhin skye na yang //
translated: Although it arises in the order of the experience of object and mental object,

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar dbang po'i shes pas don nyams su myong zhing phyis don gyi yid de don gyi shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar dbang po'i shes pas don nyams su myong zhing phyis don gyi yid de don gyi shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is said that the object is experienced by the sense consciousness first, and later the mental object, the object consciousness, is experienced by the mental consciousness.

original: don shes pa dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni don shes pa bzung bar gyur pa dang ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: don shes pa dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni don shes pa bzung bar gyur pa dang ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: Unmixed with the consciousness of the object means unmixed with the apprehension of the consciousness of the object.

original: gzugs brnyan med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan med pa'o //
translated: It is without an image.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is solitary.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par grags pa /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par grags pa /
translated: It is renowned as the apprehender.

original: myong ba gcig sngon po la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin rtogs 'gyur gyi'o //
analyzed: myong ba gcig sngon po la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin rtogs 'gyur gyi'o //
translated: It is the realization of the nature of the experience of blue and so on.

original: de'i yul can zhes bya ba ni sngon po myong ba'i yul can no //
analyzed: de'i yul can zhes bya ba ni sngon po myong ba'i yul can no //
translated: Its object is the object of the experience of blue.

original: de ltar dran pa'i sgo nas kyang yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa'i sgo nas kyang yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, the fault that the master has explained, that there is no transference to another object through memory, is as follows.

original: shes pa gang gis shes pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba de la yang dran pa mthong /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis shes pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba de la yang dran pa mthong /
translated: When a consciousness experiences the consciousness that is the knower, it sees memory.

original: de bas na de yang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bas thug pa med pa dang de ltar yul gzhan la 'pho ba med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na de yang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bas thug pa med pa dang de ltar yul gzhan la 'pho ba med par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, since that is also experienced by another consciousness, there is an infinite regress, and thus there is no transference to another object.

original: de yang mthong ba de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos dran pa'i sgo nas yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos dran pa'i sgo nas yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon bshad pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the master DignƒÅga explained the fault that there is no transference to another object through memory.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the object of the fundamental consciousness.

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang po gang yin pa de'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang po gang yin pa de'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it is the object of the first sense consciousness.

original: thams cad pa thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad pa thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is all and at all times and in all ways.

original: yul thams cad la dus thams cad dngos po thams cad skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa //
analyzed: yul thams cad la dus thams cad dngos po thams cad skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa //
translated: because it would follow that all objects would arise at all times and from all things.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthat which is characterized as the object of perception‚Äù

original: nye ba skyed byed ces bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha yin te /
analyzed: nye ba skyed byed ces bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha yin te /
translated: is a part of a verse.

original: thams cad kyis blo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyis blo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: All cognitions are characterized as the object of perception.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi yul yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi yul yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the object is also characterized as the object of perception,

original: de'i phyir nye ba ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye ba ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then the phrase ‚Äúthat which is proximate‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te nye ba nyid ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nye ba nyid ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask how it is proximate,

original: skyed byed ces bya ba smos te /üîΩmtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid kyi skyed par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: skyed byed ces bya ba smos te / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid kyi skyed par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: the phrase ‚Äúthat which generates‚Äù is stated.üîΩIt is maintained that the object is the generator of the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: rgyud gcig la gnas pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang sngar skyes ma thag pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyud gcig la gnas pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang sngar skyes ma thag pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is maintained that the similar and immediately antecedent condition that exists in a single continuum is the immediately preceding state.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi skyed par byed pa nyid @248a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi skyed par byed pa nyid @248a * //
translated: Such is the definition of a producer.üîΩ

original: kyis rang gi blo nye ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis rang gi blo nye ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Such a producer would be the proximity of one's own cognition.

original: de ltar na rang gi blo nye bar len par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi blo nye bar len par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the proximity of one's own cognition is explained.

original: de nyid ni nye ba nyid skyed byed yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni nye ba nyid skyed byed yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That very proximity is the producer - this is explained by because of this and so on.

original: skyed byed ces bya ba 'das ma thag pa ston par byed pa'i tshig 'dis ni rgyud gcig la gnas pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyed byed ces bya ba 'das ma thag pa ston par byed pa'i tshig 'dis ni rgyud gcig la gnas pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word producer indicates the immediately preceding condition, which means existing in the same continuum.

original: skyes bu 'gas bdag gi blo myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu 'gas bdag gi blo myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: No person would experience their own cognition,

original: thams cad du don nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad du don nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because the object is always proximate, he thinks.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although this is accepted,üîΩhe says, But it is not tenable that the cognition is the object.

original: don gang nye bas blo snga ma rang gi blo skye pa la gags byed pa'i don gang yin pa de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo nges don dang blo snga ma nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gang nye bas blo snga ma rang gi blo skye pa la gags byed pa'i don gang yin pa de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo nges don dang blo snga ma nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the former cognition is apprehended by the cognition that apprehends the meaning that obstructs the arising of the former cognition, then the former cognition would be experienced.

original: de'i phyir don dang blo cig car blo gcig gi nyams su myong ba 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang blo cig car blo gcig gi nyams su myong ba 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe simultaneous experience of the meaning and the cognition by a single cognition is refuted.‚Äù

original: srid par rgyu ba can lnga la //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid par rgyu ba can lnga la // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five who wander in existence

original: rgyu ba can zhes bya ba ni phung por grags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba can zhes bya ba ni phung por grags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWanderer‚Äù is known as the aggregates.

original: srid par rgyu ba lnga gang la yod pa ni srid par rgyu ba can no //
analyzed: srid par rgyu ba lnga gang la yod pa ni srid par rgyu ba can no //
translated: The five who have wandering in existence are those who wander in existence.

original: de lta bu yang de yin la srid pa yang yin pas na srid par rgyu ba can lnga ste /
analyzed: de lta bu yang de yin la srid pa yang yin pas na srid par rgyu ba can lnga ste /
translated: And since they are such and also exist, they are the five who wander in existence.

original: srid pa phung po lnga can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa phung po lnga can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that existence has five aggregates.

original: blo'i zhes bya ba ni drug pa ste /
analyzed: blo'i zhes bya ba ni drug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOf the mind‚Äù refers to the sixth.

original: blo'i dran pa gang yin pa de rtsa nas bton pa can te /
analyzed: blo'i dran pa gang yin pa de rtsa nas bton pa can te /
translated: The memory of the mind is that which is extracted from the root.

original: blo nyams su myong ba med pa la dran pa skyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo nyams su myong ba med pa la dran pa skyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no capacity to generate memory in the absence of an experience of the object.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni nyams su myong ba'i blo rtsa nas bcom pa can 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni nyams su myong ba'i blo rtsa nas bcom pa can 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not only the destruction of the experience of the object that interrupts the continuity of memory;

original: blo'i dran pa yang rgyun chad pa yin no //
analyzed: blo'i dran pa yang rgyun chad pa yin no //
translated: the continuity of memory of the object is also interrupted.

original: phyi rol gyi don la reg pa med pa'am nye ba la ltos pa med pa rnams la zhes bya ba la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don la reg pa ma yin te don med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la reg pa med pa'am nye ba la ltos pa med pa rnams la zhes bya ba la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don la reg pa ma yin te don med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúwith regard to those that do not touch external objects or that do not depend on a present object,‚Äù the conceptual thoughts of the past, future, and rabbit‚Äôs horns, etc., do not touch an object because they do not exist.

original: bum pa la sogs pa nye ba dag la yang rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag don yod na yang de la ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa nye ba dag la yang rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag don yod na yang de la ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: Even though the conceptual thoughts of present objects such as pots, etc., exist, they do not depend on them.

original: de nye ba med par yang nang las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye ba med par yang nang las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from within without depending on the external object.

original: rnam par rtog pa yul med pa can nyid yin par bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yul med pa can nyid yin par bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has already been established that conceptual thoughts do not have objects.

original: shes pa 'dzin pa las gzhan du 'pho ba'i rgyu don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma snga ma 'dzin pa gang yin pa de las gzhan du ste phyi rol gyi don dpyod par byed pa la 'pho ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i don
analyzed: shes pa 'dzin pa las gzhan du 'pho ba'i rgyu don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma snga ma 'dzin pa gang yin pa de las gzhan du ste phyi rol gyi don dpyod par byed pa la 'pho ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i don
translated: There is no object that is a cause for consciousness to transfer to another object.

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is this: The former consciousness that apprehends the former object does not have as its cause an object that is different from it, that is, an external object that is analyzed.

original: de'i tshe / blo yi nus pa zad yin na //
analyzed: de'i tshe / blo yi nus pa zad yin na //
translated: At that time, the potency of the mind is exhausted.

original: gang las don blo'i de nyid yin //
analyzed: gang las don blo'i de nyid yin //
translated: What is the reality of the mind that apprehends the object?

original: zhes bya ba ni mthar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can @248b gyi blo blo 'dzin par byed pa blo de ni phyis 'byung ba'i skyed pa la nus pa zad pa yin na don gzhan la 'pho ba'i ngang tshul can gyi blo de gang las yin zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can @248b gyi blo blo 'dzin par byed pa blo de ni phyis 'byung ba'i skyed pa la nus pa zad pa yin na don gzhan la 'pho ba'i ngang tshul can gyi blo de gang las yin zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the mind that apprehends the mind that has the nature of abiding to the end is exhausted in the production of the subsequent mind, then what is the mind that has the nature of transferring to another object?

original: to // 'di snyam du 'di ltar blo snga ma rang gi blo skyed pa la nus pa med pa de ltar yul gzhan gyi blo skyed par byed pa la nus pa med pa yin na 'di la nges par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: to // 'di snyam du 'di ltar blo snga ma rang gi blo skyed pa la nus pa med pa de ltar yul gzhan gyi blo skyed par byed pa la nus pa med pa yin na 'di la nges par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: It is not tenable that the former cognition is the cause of the latter cognition, because the former cognition does not exist at the time of the latter cognition.

original: gang gis na blo bdag nyid la shes pa skyed pa de'i nus pa zad pa yin gyi don gzhan gyi blo la ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na blo bdag nyid la shes pa skyed pa de'i nus pa zad pa yin gyi don gzhan gyi blo la ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: If you think that the former cognition is the cause of the latter cognition, then why is the former cognition not the cause of the cognition of other objects?

original: de bas na spyir shes pa skyed pa de la nus pa zad pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na spyir shes pa skyed pa de la nus pa zad pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, in general, the former cognition is the cause of the latter cognition.

original: yul gcig la skyes pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin na zhes bya ba ni blo snga ma snga ma blos dmigs pa'i sgo nas blo phyi ma phyi ma rnams kyi blo'i yul can nyid shes pa'i brgyud pa yin na'o //
analyzed: yul gcig la skyes pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin na zhes bya ba ni blo snga ma snga ma blos dmigs pa'i sgo nas blo phyi ma phyi ma rnams kyi blo'i yul can nyid shes pa'i brgyud pa yin na'o //
translated: If the cognition that arises in regard to one object is the continuum of cognition, then the former cognition is the object of the latter cognition.

original: de la chags pa yod na yang yul gzhan la shes pa 'jug par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la chags pa yod na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa la yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la chags pa yod na yang yul gzhan la shes pa 'jug par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la chags pa yod na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa la yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: If there were attachment, then consciousness would engage other objects.

original: yul gzhan la shes pa 'jug par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan la shes pa 'jug par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If there were attachment to mental consciousness, then consciousness would engage other objects because the potential would exist in the foundation consciousness.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: nus pa med par byas pa can //üîΩkun gzhi las rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ba med ces bya ba la sogs pas zhar la 'ongs pa'i lan btab nas /
analyzed: nus pa med par byas pa can // kun gzhi las rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ba med ces bya ba la sogs pas zhar la 'ongs pa'i lan btab nas /
translated: it is said that consciousness would not be without potential.üîΩHaving responded to the objection that it is untenable that consciousness arises from the foundation consciousness, he applies the response to the main point.

original: de de ltar na rnam par shes pa nus pa med pa ma yin na snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal ma la sbyor bar byed do //üîΩmtshungs zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni nus pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar na rnam par shes pa nus pa med pa ma yin na snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal ma la sbyor bar byed do // mtshungs zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni nus pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: If consciousness is not without potential, then the former...üîΩThe explanation of this ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù is that it is potential.

original: nus pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nus pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is devoid of potential. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yid snga ma 'di las yin te nus pa med pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yid snga ma 'di las yin te nus pa med pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the so-called eye consciousness, etc., arise from this prior mind, because they are not devoid of potentiality.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yul ji ltar nye ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yul ji ltar nye ba bzhin du'o //
translated: In accordance with the conditions means in accordance with the object that is present.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag ni rim bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag ni rim bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams te /
translated: The mental consciousnesses arise in sequence means that the conceptual thoughts arise in sequence.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because two conceptual thoughts do not occur simultaneously.

original: sems pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is intention is conceptual thought.

original: blo gcig po snga ma'i nus pa so sor nges pa las ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo gcig po snga ma'i nus pa so sor nges pa las ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not from the potentiality of the single prior mind that is differentiated, etc.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las blo snga ma ni rigs mthun pa'i blo gcig skyed pa la nus pa nges pa las so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las blo snga ma ni rigs mthun pa'i blo gcig skyed pa la nus pa nges pa las so //
translated: This is because the prior mind that is the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition is ascertained to generate a single subsequent mind of the same type.

original: sngar yang rab tu bsgrubs zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar yang rab tu bsgrubs zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This has already been established earlier.

original: 'dir don kun dang cig car ni //
analyzed: 'dir don kun dang cig car ni //
translated: Here, ‚Äúall objects‚Äù and ‚Äúsimultaneously‚Äù are in the verse.

original: 'dus can dbang rnams yod na @249a * //üîΩyang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'dus can dbang rnams yod na @249a * // yang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the sense faculties are present‚Äù is the context.

original: gang gi tshe yul shin tu gsal ba ma yin pa thag nye ba na yod pa zhes bya ba ni yul shin tu gsal ba thag nye ba na yod pa yul gyi stobs las dbang po gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yid nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul shin tu gsal ba ma yin pa thag nye ba na yod pa zhes bya ba ni yul shin tu gsal ba thag nye ba na yod pa yul gyi stobs las dbang po gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yid nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: When an object is not very clear, but is nearby, then the mind associated with another sense faculty is ascertained from the power of the object.

original: de'i sgo nas sam zhes bya ba ni yul gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas sam zhes bya ba ni yul gyi sgo nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThrough that‚Äù means through the object.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu bdag nyid 'dod pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu bdag nyid 'dod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy oneself‚Äù means by the person himself.

original: bdag yid dang ni ldan tsam las //
analyzed: bdag yid dang ni ldan tsam las //
translated: ‚ÄúMerely by the mind being present‚Äù means that the mind is present, but the other sense faculties are not present.

original: skyes rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: skyes rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sense faculties that have arisen‚Äù means the sense consciousnesses that have arisen.

original: yid kyi go rims kyi rgyu zhes bya ba la yid kyi 'di ni yid kyi ste /
analyzed: yid kyi go rims kyi rgyu zhes bya ba la yid kyi 'di ni yid kyi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe order of the mind‚Äù means the order of the mind.

original: de'i go rims kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i go rims kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for the order of the mind.

original: de ltar na yid bdag dang ldan pa cig car 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yid bdag dang ldan pa cig car 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the mind is present simultaneously with the self.

original: bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the identity of the self.

original: dbang rnams bzhin du bdag la yang rim bzhin du ldan pa khas len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang rnams bzhin du bdag la yang rim bzhin du ldan pa khas len pa ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not accepted as being endowed with the faculties in the same way that they are endowed with the faculties.

original: gang na yid kyi shes pa skye ba la go rims kyi rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: gang na yid kyi shes pa skye ba la go rims kyi rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that there is no reason for the order of the faculties.

original: byed pa gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni byed pa po bdag nyid la ltos nas byed pa'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: byed pa gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni byed pa po bdag nyid la ltos nas byed pa'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby a single action‚Äù means that the convention of action is in relation to the agent, the self.üîΩWhy is it that many lamps

original: ci phyir mar me du mas mthong //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'dis gzugs la sogs pa mthong bas na mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ci phyir mar me du mas mthong // zhes bya ba ni 'dis gzugs la sogs pa mthong bas na mthong ba'o //
translated: are seen?

original: lta ba po du ma'i mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa na ci ltar byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba po du ma'i mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa na ci ltar byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that when the visual consciousnesses of many viewers arise simultaneously, how can there be a single action?

original: mar me skyes bu du mas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: mar me skyes bu du mas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with the passage beginning ‚ÄúMany people can see the flame of a lamp.‚Äù

original: ci ste yang lta ba po du ma'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la 'di snyam du byed pa dag gi bya ba bsgrub pa la rang rgyud du yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang lta ba po du ma'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la 'di snyam du byed pa dag gi bya ba bsgrub pa la rang rgyud du yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: then the action of seeing does not exist in the continuum of each viewer.

original: de dag ni byed pa po'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa po'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, the action of seeing occurs by the power of the agent.

original: de bas na gang la byed pa po gcig yin pa de la bya ba gcig skyed par 'gyur zhing gang la byed pa po du ma yin pa de la byed pa gcig gis kyang bya ba du ma skyed par byed do zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang la byed pa po gcig yin pa de la bya ba gcig skyed par 'gyur zhing gang la byed pa po du ma yin pa de la byed pa gcig gis kyang bya ba du ma skyed par byed do zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, you think that in the case of a single agent, a single action arises, and in the case of many agents, a single action is generated by each agent.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBut if the action of seeing is established by the power of the agent‚Äù is the response of the proponent of the thesis.

original: 'di snyam du gal te byed pa po'i dbang gis bya ba yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te byed pa po'i dbang gis bya ba yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: He thinks: If the action of seeing is established by the power of the agent,

original: lta ba po'i ming can rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rgyud khyad par can gyi nus pa dang 'brel pa mthong bar nus pa can las rnam par shes pa rnams rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin na nus pa mthong ba med pa can gyi yid tsam gyis
analyzed: lta ba po'i ming can rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rgyud khyad par can gyi nus pa dang 'brel pa mthong bar nus pa can las rnam par shes pa rnams rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin na nus pa mthong ba med pa can gyi yid tsam gyis
translated: If consciousnesses arise in sequence from a prior continuum of consciousness, which is associated with the special potency of the seer, and is capable of seeing, then what is the use of a mere mind that is not associated with seeing?

original: ci zhig bya zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ci zhig bya zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is what he means.

original: de nyid ni 'on kyang rnam par shes pa rnams bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs @249b pa smos te rnam par shes pa'i rgyud ma gtogs par lta ba po gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'on kyang rnam par shes pa rnams bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs @249b pa smos te rnam par shes pa'i rgyud ma gtogs par lta ba po gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHowever, consciousness itself . . . ,‚Äù and so forth. Apart from the continuum of consciousness, there is no other seer.

original: de ltar na sems nyid ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems nyid ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if it is not the mind itself, it is not the seer, like form and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa yin na yang phul du dbyung bar byar med pa ni lta ba po nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa yin na yang phul du dbyung bar byar med pa ni lta ba po nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it is associated with consciousness, it is not suitable to be the seer, because it cannot be enhanced.

original: bdag nyid sems yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni rnam par shes pa nyid lta ba po nyid yin pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid sems yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni rnam par shes pa nyid lta ba po nyid yin pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self were the nature of the existence of mind, then consciousness itself would be the seer.

original: 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par nyid bag chags yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par nyid bag chags yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: The special nature of the self that is capable of producing an effect is the full maturation of the latent impressions.

original: 'bras bu skyed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i bag chags de'i khyad par de'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i bag chags de'i khyad par de'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The special nature of that latent impression that is directed toward the production of an effect is the nature of consciousness that exists in that.

original: de ltar na de zhes bya ba ni yid tsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar na de zhes bya ba ni yid tsam mo //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the mere mind.

original: yid kyi rtags ni cig car shes pa mi skye ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyi rtags ni cig car shes pa mi skye ba yin par brjod do //
translated: The sign of the mind is the non-arising of simultaneous cognition.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi nye bar len pa nyid las rnam par shes pa snga ma rnams mi skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi nye bar len pa nyid las rnam par shes pa snga ma rnams mi skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the prior consciousnesses do not arise from their own appropriation,

original: 'dis yid tsam rjes su dpag par bya ba tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis yid tsam rjes su dpag par bya ba tsam ma yin no //
translated: then it is not merely inferred that there is a mere mind.

original: gnas pa yod na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dag go //
analyzed: gnas pa yod na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is a basis‚Äù refers to the moments.

original: skyes bu bdag nyid la gnas pa yod na zhes bya ba 'du byed gnas pa yod na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu bdag nyid la gnas pa yod na zhes bya ba 'du byed gnas pa yod na'o //
translated: If there is a person who endures, then there is the endurance of formations.

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi zhes pa ni 'du byed kyi rgyu can rnams de la blo zhes bya ba ni blo las 'du byed gang yin pa 'byung zhing 'du byed de las blo yin no //
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi zhes pa ni 'du byed kyi rgyu can rnams de la blo zhes bya ba ni blo las 'du byed gang yin pa 'byung zhing 'du byed de las blo yin no //
translated: If that exists, then those that have the nature of arising, which are caused by formations, arise from the mind. The mind is that which is called ‚Äúmind.‚Äù Formations arise from the mind, and from those formations, the mind arises.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyis 'byung ba'i blo la nye bar len pa'i ngo bo tsam blo snga ma yin pa ni blo ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyis 'byung ba'i blo la nye bar len pa'i ngo bo tsam blo snga ma yin pa ni blo ste /
translated: This is how it is. The previous mind is the mere entity that is appropriated by the subsequent mind. It is not the case that it becomes something else that is apprehended.

original: gzhan gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhen zhes bya ba phyis 'byung ba'i blo la blo snga ma chos gzhan gzung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhen zhes bya ba phyis 'byung ba'i blo la blo snga ma chos gzhan gzung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The previous mind does not become something else that is apprehended by the subsequent mind.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzung pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzung pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúby the nature of the apprehended object‚Äù is that it is the nature of the apprehended object that generates consciousness having the nature of the apprehender.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis skyed par 'gyur pa gzung ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i dngos pos rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba ni gzung ba nyid yin no //üîΩ'dzin pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ring por gnas pa dang chod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la nye
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis skyed par 'gyur pa gzung ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i dngos pos rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba ni gzung ba nyid yin no // 'dzin pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ring por gnas pa dang chod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la nye
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúby the nature of the apprehended object, it would be the apprehended object‚Äù is that the entity that generates consciousness having the nature of the object of observation would be the apprehended object.üîΩBecause it has the nature of the appropriated of the apprehender,

original: bar len pa'i ngo bo srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar len pa'i ngo bo srid pa ma yin no //
translated: because it has the nature of the appropriated of the consciousness that arises later, it is not possible that it has the nature of the appropriated of that which is distant, that which is obstructed, and so on.

original: bdag nyid ji @250a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji @250a * //
translated: Just as they are grasped by the grasping of the self.

original: lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa dag gis gzugs shes pa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa dag gis gzugs shes pa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If form, etc. are characterized by being grasped,

original: gzung ba nyid las skyed byed ni //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid las skyed byed ni //
translated: then the producer of that which is grasped is not different.

original: gzhan min zhes bya ba la gzugs shes pa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan min zhes bya ba la gzugs shes pa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Form, etc. are characterized by being grasped.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that form, sound, etc. and the collection of mind and mental factors are grasped.

original: gang gis gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: By what are they grasped?

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa dag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa dag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: They are grasped by the grasping of the self just as it is.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de lta bu de la gzung ba nyid las skyed par byed pa ni gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de lta bu de la gzung ba nyid las skyed par byed pa ni gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: That which is characterized by being grasped is not different from the producer of that which is grasped.

original: 'on kyang rang gi shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid gzung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid gzung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the producer of one‚Äôs own consciousness is the grasper.

original: gzung ba nyid mtshan nyid las yul la sogs pas bskal pa la sogs pa ma yin pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa can gyi lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid mtshan nyid las yul la sogs pas bskal pa la sogs pa ma yin pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa can gyi lnga pa yin no //
translated: The genitive case in ‚Äúof the object‚Äù is a genitive of content, not a genitive of separation, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra dang pos ni ma chod pa dang rang bzhin khyad par can dang / rgyu gzhan lhan cig byed pa mig la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra dang pos ni ma chod pa dang rang bzhin khyad par can dang / rgyu gzhan lhan cig byed pa mig la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The first ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the unobstructed, the special nature, and the other causes, such as the eye, etc., which are the cooperating conditions.

original: gnyis pas ni rang bzhin khyad par can mngon du phyogs pa dang tshogs pa dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rang bzhin khyad par can mngon du phyogs pa dang tshogs pa dag gzung ngo //
translated: The second ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the special nature that is directed toward the object and the assemblage of conditions.

original: des na dag gi don ni yul gyis ma bskal ba dang / chod pa med pa dang rang bzhin khyad par can mngon du phyogs pa dang rkyen gzhan tshogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na dag gi don ni yul gyis ma bskal ba dang / chod pa med pa dang rang bzhin khyad par can mngon du phyogs pa dang rkyen gzhan tshogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the compound is: because the object is not separated from the sense faculty, is not obstructed, is directed toward the special nature, and the other conditions are assembled.

original: 'di lta ste 'dzin par nyer len dang myong ba zhes bya ba la 'dzin par byed pas na 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dzin par nyer len dang myong ba zhes bya ba la 'dzin par byed pas na 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is the appropriator of the grasping and the experiencer‚Äù means that it is the experiencer because it is the appropriator of the grasping.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the consciousness that grasps.

original: 'dzin pa'i nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i nye bar len pa ste /
translated: The appropriator of the grasping is the sense faculty.

original: de nas myong ba'i sgra dang zlas dbye ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas myong ba'i sgra dang zlas dbye ba bya'o //
translated: Then, the sound of ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is to be analyzed.

original: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gtso bor bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gtso bor bshad pa yin no //
translated: The appropriator is the primary thing.

original: dbang po yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the sense faculty is also a thing that has the characteristic of being grasped.

original: dbang po de ni bdag po'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po de ni bdag po'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the sense faculty the dominant condition of consciousness?

original: de ni bden te gzhan gyis khas blangs nas de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bden te gzhan gyis khas blangs nas de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: That is true, but I say this in accordance with the assertions of others.

original: gzhan dag ni dbang po yang nye bar len par 'dod pa de ltar na sems med pa las rnam par ldang ba'i rnam par shes pa dbang po nyid kyi nye bar len pas skyed pa yin no zhes phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba 'dod pa yin
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dbang po yang nye bar len par 'dod pa de ltar na sems med pa las rnam par ldang ba'i rnam par shes pa dbang po nyid kyi nye bar len pas skyed pa yin no zhes phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba 'dod pa yin
translated: Others assert that the sense faculty is also an appropriator. In that case, the consciousness that arises from a mindless state is generated by the appropriator that is the sense faculty itself. This is the assertion of the proponents of external objects.

original: no // de'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba nyid la sogs pa med pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: no // de'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba nyid la sogs pa med pa gzung ngo //
translated: because it is not the nature of the appropriator, etc. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the absence of a single meaning, the absence of a contact that is a coming together, and so on.

original: nye bar len pa nyid @250b 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid @250b 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The appropriator is the collection.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because it is the entity that appropriates.

original: gal te 'di ltar rnam par shes pa tha dad pa'i nus pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar rnam par shes pa tha dad pa'i nus pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can there be a different capacity of consciousness?

original: nye bar len pa'i nus pa gzhan yin zhing zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i nus pa gzhan yin zhing zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said that the capacity of the appropriator is different.

original: nye bar len pa dang gzung ba nyid dag gi phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang gzung ba nyid dag gi phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the appropriator and the grasped are mutually different in their characteristics, it is not logical that they are not different. This is the meaning.

original: nus pa dngos por gyur pa phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag gis gcig 'bras bu du ma byed cing du ma dag kyang nus pa dngos por gyur pa gcig dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu gcig byed pa yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so
analyzed: nus pa dngos por gyur pa phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag gis gcig 'bras bu du ma byed cing du ma dag kyang nus pa dngos por gyur pa gcig dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu gcig byed pa yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so
translated: Others think that a single entity that is a cause produces many effects, because different entities that are causes have different powers, and many entities that are causes have a single power that is an entity.

original: // nus pa gcig dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
analyzed: // nus pa gcig dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf they have a single power, etc.‚Äù is the opinion of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúentity‚Äù is understood.

original: skabs gzhan du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skabs gzhan du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis has been explained in another context‚Äù refers to the following.

original: de ni gcig kyang du ma byed //
analyzed: de ni gcig kyang du ma byed //
translated: ‚ÄúEven a single entity does not produce many effects.

original: de dngos yongs su bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dngos yongs su bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is so,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúBecause a single entity does not have many powers.‚Äù

original: de la ro la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa'i gzugs skyed pa la ro la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de la ro la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa'i gzugs skyed pa la ro la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúTaste, etc., are also like that‚Äù means that taste, etc., are cooperative conditions for the production of form that is of the same type.

original: tshogs pa gcig po 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig po 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis very same collection‚Äù refers to the collection of form, taste, etc.

original: gnas pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The context is the discussion of form.

original: de la yang rnam par shes pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang rnam par shes pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd consciousness is the appropriating cause‚Äù means that

original: tshogs pa gzhan la gnas pa'i gzugs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa de la rnam par shes pa skyed pa de nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan la gnas pa'i gzugs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa de la rnam par shes pa skyed pa de nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the form that exists in another collection, which produces visual consciousness, is the appropriating cause of the production of that consciousness.

original: de la gnas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la gzugs de mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la gzugs de mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de la gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is as if it were the basis of that‚Äù means that form is the basis of that collection of eye, etc.

original: de la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the dominant condition of that.

original: de ltar na rtag tu shes pa gzhan dang gzhan skyes pas 'di yul gzhan la 'pho ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ci ltar shes pa snga ma gzung ba dran pa yin pa de ltar dran pa de yang dran pa gzhan nye bar len par gyur
analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu shes pa gzhan dang gzhan skyes pas 'di yul gzhan la 'pho ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ci ltar shes pa snga ma gzung ba dran pa yin pa de ltar dran pa de yang dran pa gzhan nye bar len par gyur
translated: Just as the former consciousness is the memory of the object, so too that memory is generated by another memory that is its appropriated object.

original: pa des bskyed par bya ba yin zhing de yang gzhan gyi yin pa de ltar na dran pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin no //
analyzed: pa des bskyed par bya ba yin zhing de yang gzhan gyi yin pa de ltar na dran pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin no //
translated: Since that memory is also generated by another memory, the continuum of memory is established.

original: 'di skad du shes pa'i nyams su myong bar gyur pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis 'dod pa gnag yin pa de la ltos nas bstan bcos mdzad pas ci'i phyir thug pa med pa'i rtsod pa mdzad kyi dran pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin zhes stonüîΩpar @251a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du shes pa'i nyams su myong bar gyur pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis 'dod pa gnag yin pa de la ltos nas bstan bcos mdzad pas ci'i phyir thug pa med pa'i rtsod pa mdzad kyi dran pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin zhes ston par @251a * //
translated: In this way, the author of the treatise presents the argument of infinite regress in terms of the desire to experience consciousness, but he does not present it in terms of memory.

original: 'gyur ro // snga phyi snang ba can nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // snga phyi snang ba can nyid phyir //
translated: Why is that? Because the former and latter moments of consciousness are associated with the appearance of the object.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang la don snga phyi snang ba'i tshul yod pa de ni snga phyi snang ba can te de'i dngos po yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang la don snga phyi snang ba'i tshul yod pa de ni snga phyi snang ba can te de'i dngos po yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that which has the mode of appearance of prior and subsequent objects is one that has prior and subsequent appearances, and that is its entity.

original: de nyid ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that beginning with ‚Äúat the time, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe consciousness that has the mode of apprehending the letter a is the apprehender, and the consciousness that has the mode of apprehending the subsequent letter i, etc., is the apprehender.

original: yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa phyi ma yi ge ai la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes pa gcig nyid kyi shes pa snga ma dang yul gzhan 'dzin
analyzed: yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa phyi ma yi ge ai la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes pa gcig nyid kyi shes pa snga ma dang yul gzhan 'dzin
translated: When one consciousness is asserted to be the apprehender of a prior object and a different object,

original: par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa phyis 'byung ba yi ge ai la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa phyis 'byung ba yi ge ai la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa yin no //
translated: the consciousness that has the mode of apprehending the letter a is the apprehender, and the subsequent consciousness that has the mode of apprehending the letter i, etc., is the apprehender.

original: de bas na yi ge ai 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa de la yi ge ai ni phyi rol gyi yul yang yin zhing /
analyzed: de bas na yi ge ai 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa de la yi ge ai ni phyi rol gyi yul yang yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the letter i is an external object for the consciousness that has the mode of apprehension of i.

original: shes pa snga ma la yod pa'i yi ge aa ni yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa snang bar gyur pa na yi ge aa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma la yod pa'i yi ge aa ni yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa snang bar gyur pa na yi ge aa yin no //
translated: And the letter a that exists in the previous consciousness is the letter a when the consciousness that has the mode of apprehension of a appears.

original: de ltar na yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa ni 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa gnyis pa dang / yi ge aa dang snang bar snang 'gyur ba de bas na yi ge aa yang snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yi ge aa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa ni 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa gnyis pa dang / yi ge aa dang snang bar snang 'gyur ba de bas na yi ge aa yang snang ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the consciousness that has the mode of apprehension of a is the second consciousness that is asserted to be the apprehender, and the letter a also appears as the appearance that appears to the consciousness that has the mode of apprehension of a.

original: de ltar na blo gcig la brjod pa gnyis su 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na blo gcig la brjod pa gnyis su 'gyur na'o //
translated: Thus, if one consciousness were to have two expressions,

original: yi ge 'dzin pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni byang bu la sogs par bris pa'i yi ge'i bkod pa mig gi rnam par shes pas cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge 'dzin pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni byang bu la sogs par bris pa'i yi ge'i bkod pa mig gi rnam par shes pas cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äúother than the apprehension of the letter‚Äù means that the arrangement of letters written on a tablet and so on is apprehended simultaneously by the eye consciousness. That is the meaning of the text.

original: la lar gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: la lar gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa'o //
translated: For some, it is different, such as smell, etc.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, why?

original: yul la 'jug pa'i nges pa med pa can gyi shes pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul la 'jug pa'i nges pa med pa can gyi shes pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
