analyzed: gang la yul la 'jug pa'i nges pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is said because there is no certainty as to the engagement with the object.üîΩIn the case of a consciousness that has the mode of apprehending the eye consciousness, there is the appearance of form and the appearance of sound.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la gzugs kyi snang ba dang sgra'i snang ba ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la gzugs kyi snang ba dang sgra'i snang ba ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe
translated: When the consciousness of appearance arises immediately after the eye consciousness, at that time

original: des sgra yongs su gcod cing gzugs su snang pa can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa snga ma yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: des sgra yongs su gcod cing gzugs su snang pa can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa snga ma yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: it determines the sound and determines the previous eye consciousness that has the appearance of form.

original: de bas na mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid gzung ba yin pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i gzugs kyi snang ba dang / phyi rol gyis sgra snang ba 'di gnyis mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang bar 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: de bas na mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid gzung ba yin pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i gzugs kyi snang ba dang / phyi rol gyis sgra snang ba 'di gnyis mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang bar 'gyur na'o //
translated: Therefore, because the eye consciousness itself is the apprehended object, the appearance of form that exists in it and the appearance of sound that exists in the external object would appear to the ear consciousness that has the mode of apprehending the eye consciousness.

analyzed: gcig kyang gnyis gnyis snang ba @251b ni ; / zhes bya ba gzung ba re re gnyis su snang ba 'di'o //
translated: The appearance of two in one

analyzed: bdag dang de blo snar phyir ro //
translated: is because of the self and the cognition of that.

original: zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rang gi ngo bo ni bdag yin pa de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni de'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rang gi ngo bo ni bdag yin pa de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni de'i sgras bstan to //
translated: The nature of the object itself is the self. The consciousness that observes that is indicated by the word that.

original: bdag dang de'i blo ni bdag dang blo dag la ste /
analyzed: bdag dang de'i blo ni bdag dang blo dag la ste /
translated: The self and the cognition of that are the self and the cognition of that.

original: yul gyi shes pa dang shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa dang shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, the consciousness of the object and the consciousness of the consciousness.

original: de ni bdun ba'i tshig gi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bdun ba'i tshig gi gnyis pa'o //
translated: That is the second part of the seventh verse.

original: dus gcig gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAt one time‚Äù and so on is the explanation of this.

analyzed: rang gi shes pa la yod par zhes bya ba ni yi ge a'i shes pa la yod par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn one‚Äôs own consciousness‚Äù means in the consciousness of the letter A.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa gcig la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rang gi shes pa'am shes pa'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //

translated: ‚ÄúLikewise, in one form‚Äù and so on means that in the same way, as was explained, it appears in one‚Äôs own consciousness or the consciousness of consciousness.

original: de bas na gnyi ga 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig gis yul gzhan dang shes pa snga ma 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig gis yul gzhan dang shes pa snga ma 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, it does not apprehend both‚Äù means that one consciousness does not apprehend another object or earlier consciousness.

original: shes pa gang las 'pho ba de zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mthar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can shes pa gzhan gyis nyam su myong ba ma yin pa las yul gzhan du 'pho ba de ni rang rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gang las 'pho ba de zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mthar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can shes pa gzhan gyis nyam su myong ba ma yin pa las yul gzhan du 'pho ba de ni rang rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness from which it moves‚Äù means that the consciousness that is the final state of the mental consciousness, which is not experienced by another consciousness, moves to another object, and that is self-consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not experienced by another consciousness.

original: shes pa snga ma dag kyang tha ma'i shes pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma dag kyang tha ma'i shes pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The earlier consciousnesses are like the final consciousness.

original: de'i tshe / thams cad myong med thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe / thams cad myong med thal bar 'gyur //
translated: At that time, it follows that nothing is experienced.

original: zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i shes pa ni mngon sum nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yod du zin kyang med pa dang 'dra bar shes pa snga ma nyams su myong ba la nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i shes pa ni mngon sum nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yod du zin kyang med pa dang 'dra bar shes pa snga ma nyams su myong ba la nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since the final consciousness is not direct perception, even if it exists, it is powerless with respect to the experience of the earlier consciousnesses, just as if it did not exist.

original: des shes pa snga ma nyams su myong ba med pa de ltar na thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des shes pa snga ma nyams su myong ba med pa de ltar na thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not experience the earlier consciousness, then it follows that nothing is experienced.

original: dper na gzhan gyi shes pa'am yul nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yul lam shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba bdag nyid mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na rang gi
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi shes pa'am yul nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yul lam shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba bdag nyid mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na rang gi
translated: For example, the experience of another‚Äôs consciousness or object is not an experience because it is not direct perception, just as the experience of an object or another consciousness is not an experience because it is not direct perception.

original: shes pa yang gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes pa yang gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: And when cognition is not perception, then

analyzed: de nyams su myong ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /

original: nyams su myong ba nyid la rang dang gzhan gyi shes pa dag bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid la rang dang gzhan gyi shes pa dag bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For experience itself does not have the distinction of being either one‚Äôs own or another‚Äôs cognition.

original: lkog tu gyur pa dmigs pa can shes par dka' ba yin na zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang la lkog tu gyur pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa dmigs pa can shes par dka' ba yin na zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang la lkog tu gyur pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

original: gsal ba'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba ni blo'i rgyu ni'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba ni blo'i rgyu ni'o //

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa @252a * //

analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa las so // gsal ba ni rab tu gsal ba ste don 'dod pa ni'o //

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: ‚ÄúClarity‚Äù means ‚Äúvery clear.‚Äù ‚ÄúOne who desires the object‚Äù is one who desires the object.üîΩCommentary on Valid Cognition

analyzed: slob dbon sh'akya blos sbyar ba las mngon sum grub pa ste /
translated: by ƒÄcƒÅrya ≈öƒÅkyabuddhiüîΩEstablishing Perception

analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /

analyzed: bam po drug cu rtsa gcig pa /

analyzed: rang gi yin pas na rang gi don de //

analyzed: gang gis bdag nyid kyis rjes su dpag par bya ba khong du chud pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na de yang shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid du khas blangs pa des na gang la de gzhan gyi don nyid yin te /

translated: When it is taught that the first chapter of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika explains the chapter on inference for oneself from the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å asamuccaya, then at that time

analyzed: gzhung 'dir 'di skad du bshad par bya ba yin te /

analyzed: rjod par byed pa la brjod par bya ba nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la 'dir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs su bab @252b pa zhes bya ba ni rnam 'grel gyi le'u gsum pas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mngon sum gyi le'u bshad nas 'dir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u bshad par bya
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúthe occasion of inference for one‚Äôs own sake‚Äù means that, having explained the chapter on perception in the Compendium of Valid Knowledge in the third chapter of the Thorough Exposition of Valid Knowledge, the occasion has now arrived to explain the chapter on inference for one‚Äôs own sake.

original: ba nyid kyi skabs su bab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba nyid kyi skabs su bab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de sngar bstan zin pa zhes bya ba ni le'u dang po nyid du bshad zin pa'o //

analyzed: mthong ba ni rnam par nges pa ste tshad mas khong du chud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù means ascertainment, that is, understanding by means of valid knowledge.

original: don ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: don ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù is the reason that has the three modes.

translated: Because it is said that when the proof is being established, the application itself does not exist, it is not accepted here.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the ability, the word is designated as an inference, but it is not able to demonstrate the object of inference. By what means would that also be an inference of the meaning of another's words, because it grasps the meaning?üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.

original: nus pa bstan pa'i phyir tshig la rjes su dpag pa la nye bar btags pa yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa la nus pa ni ma yin na gang gis na de yang don gyi sgras gzung ba'i phyir de'i tshig gzhan gyi don gyi rjesüîΩsu dpag pa nyid yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: nus pa bstan pa'i phyir tshig la rjes su dpag pa la nye bar btags pa yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan pa la nus pa ni ma yin na gang gis na de yang don gyi sgras gzung ba'i phyir de'i tshig gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.

original: gal te brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa sgrub par byed pa dang sun 'byin pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam de ci'i phyir /üîΩrang gis don mthong gsal byed yin //
analyzed: gal te brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa sgrub par byed pa dang sun 'byin pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam de ci'i phyir / rang gis don mthong gsal byed yin //
translated: If it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.üîΩIf it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood, then it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not understood.

original: zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If it is argued that it is not so, because it is not the case that the meaning of the words is not

original: skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault.

original: rang gis mthong ba nyid kyis don gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba nyid kyis don gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It is because the meaning is clarified by what one sees for oneself,

original: ma mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and not by what one does not see, that the exclusion of non-possession is ascertained.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid kyis ma mthong na yang gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstsal ba'i phyir rang gis mthong ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid kyis ma mthong na yang gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstsal ba'i phyir rang gis mthong ba smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even if one does not see for oneself, one establishes what is seen by another. In order to explain this, the phrase ‚Äúwhat one sees for oneself‚Äù is used.

original: de la rang gis mthong ba nyid yin gyi mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges par gzung ba ni rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rang gis mthong ba nyid yin gyi mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges par gzung ba ni rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this case, the ascertainment that ‚Äúit is what one sees for oneself, and not what one sees‚Äù is consistent.

original: de kho na nyid du na ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis sngar tshad mas nges pa'i don sgrub par byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis sngar tshad mas nges pa'i don sgrub par byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: In reality, the proponent and opponent do establish the meaning ascertained by valid cognition previously.

original: 'on kyang phyir rgol bas gzung ba rnam par brjed pa yang tshig gi ngan pa'i yul nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir rgol bas gzung ba rnam par brjed pa yang tshig gi ngan pa'i yul nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the opponent, who has forgotten what he has apprehended, engages in the domain of bad reasoning.

original: gang zhig gis rang nyid kyis mthong ba zhes de skad du nges par gzung bar byed pa des ni gzhan gyis mthong ba bzlog @253a * //üîΩpa'i don du nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gis rang nyid kyis mthong ba zhes de skad du nges par gzung bar byed pa des ni gzhan gyis mthong ba bzlog @253a * // pa'i don du nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: One who definitely asserts I see is asserting for the sake of refuting another's seeing.

original: de'i tshe 'di dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: At that time, this should be analyzed:

original: gal te rgol bas tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa las sngar rang nyid kyis mthong ba zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin na de yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgol bas tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa las sngar rang nyid kyis mthong ba zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin na de yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: If the proponent definitely asserts I see prior to stating the trimodal logical reason, then that is not correct,

original: gnyis ka la nges pa'i don brjod pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka la nges pa'i don brjod pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the statement of the ascertained object is itself the proof.

original: ci ste sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i dus na rang nyid kyis mthong ba yin gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i dus na rang nyid kyis mthong ba yin gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: But if one says, I see at the time of stating the proof, then that is not correct,

original: de'i tshe de gzung ba brjed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de gzung ba brjed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because at that time one has forgotten the object to be ascertained.

original: nges par gzung ba'i don de yang 'bras bu med pa can yin te /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i don de yang 'bras bu med pa can yin te /
translated: That ascertained object is also fruitless.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i sgra nyid kyis 'di thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i sgra nyid kyis 'di thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the very statement that makes it known causes one to obtain it.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te rgol ba bzhin du phyir rgol ba yang sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i dus na tshig med par rtags nges pa yin zhing gzung ba rnam par brjed pa ma yin pa de'i tsho gsal bar byed pa nyid don med pa canüîΩdu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te rgol ba bzhin du phyir rgol ba yang sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i dus na tshig med par rtags nges pa yin zhing gzung ba rnam par brjed pa ma yin pa de'i tsho gsal bar byed pa nyid don med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the opponent, like the proponent, ascertains the reason without words at the time of stating the proof, and does not forget what is to be apprehended, then making it known would be pointless.

original: bdag mthong min yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa rjod par byed pas ma nges pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag mthong min yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa rjod par byed pas ma nges pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is not seen by oneself means that even though it is uncertain because the proof is stated by another.

original: gzhan dag gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang la sgrub par byed pa brjod pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang la sgrub par byed pa brjod pa de dag gis so //
translated: Seen by others means by those to whom the proof is stated.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni gzhan dag gis lus las shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni gzhan dag gis lus las shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on this is ‚ÄúAny cognition of the body by others.‚Äù

original: gal te lung las shes pa tshigs su bcad par smos pa med na ci ltar thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung las shes pa tshigs su bcad par smos pa med na ci ltar thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: If knowledge from scripture is not mentioned in the verse, how is it obtained?

original: gzhan gyi sgra smos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra smos pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the words of another are mentioned.

original: lung la grub pa nyid gzhan dag gis mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: lung la grub pa nyid gzhan dag gis mthong ba yin te /
translated: Others see that it is established by scripture,

original: tshad mas grub pa ni gnyi gas mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ni gnyi gas mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is established by a valid cognition is seen by both.

original: kha cig ces bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni grangs can zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni grangs can zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on the word ‚Äúsome‚Äù is ‚Äúthe SƒÅ·πÉkhya.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'di skad khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di skad khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Thus this is what is being asserted:

original: blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni sems med pa yin te skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni sems med pa yin te skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: mind, pleasure, and so on are not mental because they possess arising.

original: bstan par bya ba ni phyir rgol ba yin te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni phyir rgol ba yin te /
translated: The opponent is the one to be taught.

original: de la yang rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang rjes su dpag par bya ba bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: And also for him, the object to be taught is inference.

original: de lta na yang lung las grub pa rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lung tshad ma yin na ni rtags tshad mas grub pa nyid yin par 'gyur na lung grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang lung las grub pa rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lung tshad ma yin na ni rtags tshad mas grub pa nyid yin par 'gyur na lung grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Even so, it is not the case that what is established by scripture is a reason. If scripture were a valid cognition, then it would be established by a valid cognition, but scripture is not established.

original: de bas na skye ba dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa tshad mas grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa tshad mas grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore arising and so on are established by a valid cognition.

original: lung tshad mas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung tshad mas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by valid scripture.

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang sems nyid yin pa lung gis grub pa yang tshad mas grub pa nyid yin te lung tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang sems nyid yin pa lung gis grub pa yang tshad mas grub pa nyid yin te lung tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, the establishment by scripture of pleasure, etc. as just the mind is also established by valid cognition, because it is established by valid scripture.

original: de bas na sems nyid la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma brjod par bya ba @253b ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar lung gi yul 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na sems nyid la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma brjod par bya ba @253b ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar lung gi yul 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that it is not proper to cite a valid cognition that contradicts the mind itself, he says, ‚ÄúIn this regard, the object of scripture,‚Äù etc.

original: tshad mas khas blangs pa'i lung la'o //
analyzed: tshad mas khas blangs pa'i lung la'o //
translated: [It is] in regard to scripture accepted by valid cognition.

original: tshad mas grub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lung tshad mar gyur bas don grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lung tshad mar gyur bas don grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished by valid cognition,‚Äù etc. means that the object is established because it is established by scripture that is valid cognition.

original: lung gi tshad ma nyid kyis grub pa'i don la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma nyid kyis grub pa'i don la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object established by the validity of scripture is not contradicted.

original: lung gis mthong ba'i don la sgrub par byed pa dang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma brjod pa de'i phyir lung tshad ma ma yin pa de bas na lung tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lung gis mthong ba'i don la sgrub par byed pa dang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma brjod pa de'i phyir lung tshad ma ma yin pa de bas na lung tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: because it is not a means of valid cognition that establishes the meaning perceived by scripture or that expresses a means of valid cognition that contradicts it. Therefore, scripture is not a means of valid cognition.

original: de bas na lung gis grub pa ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na lung gis grub pa ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intended meaning that what is established by scripture is not established.

original: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a restatement of what is thoroughly examined.

original: lung tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: lung tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: It is the intended meaning that scripture is not a means of valid cognition.

original: / yongs su brtags pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: / yongs su brtags pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúBecause it is a restatement of what is thoroughly examined,‚Äù and so on.

original: dang por tshad mas yongs su brtags pa 'jug par 'gyur zhing brtag pa de las dus phyis khas len pa dang 'dod pa dang lung yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang por tshad mas yongs su brtags pa 'jug par 'gyur zhing brtag pa de las dus phyis khas len pa dang 'dod pa dang lung yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: First, a means of valid cognition thoroughly examines, and after that examination, it is accepted, asserted, and stated in scripture.

original: gal te lung yang rang rgyud kyis tshad mar 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshad mas yongs su brtags pa'i yul rnam par 'jog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lung yang rang rgyud kyis tshad mar 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshad mas yongs su brtags pa'i yul rnam par 'jog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If scripture were a means of valid cognition by itself, then the object thoroughly examined by a means of valid cognition would not be established.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //üîΩrang gi rgyud kyis tha dad pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa bzhin no // rang gi rgyud kyis tha dad pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: like perception and inference.üîΩIt is not the case that the other is not established by that, because it is not the case that the other is not engaged in the individual nature of the other.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis yongs su mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis yongs su mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Because one valid cognition does not engage the object that is perceived by another valid cognition,

original: yongs su brtags pa'i yul la rnam par gzhag pa yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i yul la rnam par gzhag pa yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: and because it is established in relation to the object that is examined, therefore it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'dis kyang lung gis grub pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'dis kyang lung gis grub pa ma yin te //
translated: This also is not established by scripture.

original: rtags zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: rtags zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The context is that of a reason.

original: lung gis grub pa'i rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung gis grub pa'i rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not a reason that is established by scripture.

original: lung la gnod phyir gzhan la ni //
analyzed: lung la gnod phyir gzhan la ni //
translated: Because it contradicts scripture, it is not a reason.

original: sgrub par byed pa smra ba ni //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa smra ba ni //
translated: The statement that it is a proof

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is to be supplied.

original: de ltar na sems yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i lung gis grub pa la gnod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa brjod pa lung la gnod pa'i phyir bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sems yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i lung gis grub pa la gnod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa brjod pa lung la gnod pa'i phyir bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because it contradicts scripture, which establishes the existence of mind, and so on, the statement that it is a proof is contradicted by scripture.

original: 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba gnyi ga dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba gnyi ga dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no valid cognition that establishes the relation‚Äù means that neither the nature of that nor the arising from that exist.

original: de dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lung dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa lung de nyid kyis ni ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lung dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa lung de nyid kyis ni ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúAccepting what contradicts that‚Äù and so on. How could a contradiction with scripture be established by that very scripture?

original: de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa sems med pa nyid sangs rgyas pa'i lung dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa sems med pa nyid sangs rgyas pa'i lung dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Thus the nonexistence of mind in pleasure and so on contradicts the scriptures of the Buddhists.

original: lung la sems nyid khas blangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩgal te lung gis grub pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas lung @254a * //
analyzed: lung la sems nyid khas blangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // gal te lung gis grub pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas lung @254a * //
translated: This is because the scriptures accept mind itself.

original: des grub pa'i sems nyid med pa gzhan la bsgrub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: des grub pa'i sems nyid med pa gzhan la bsgrub pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the nonexistence of mind established by the scriptures, such as impermanence, establishes the nonexistence of mind established by those scriptures for others,üîΩthen at that time,

original: de dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa //
translated: accepting what contradicts that

original: de nyid kyis ni ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could that very thing be established?

original: gang zhig lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is called body‚Äù and so on explains that.

original: de la gnas pa'i skyes bu lung byed pa'am rgyu de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i skyes bu lung byed pa'am rgyu de nyid kyis so //
translated: The person who is in that state is the speaker, or the reason.

original: de las gzhan pa khas len na zhes bya ba ni lung de la grags pa'i sems gang yin pa de las gzhan sems med pa khas len na'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa khas len na zhes bya ba ni lung de la grags pa'i sems gang yin pa de las gzhan sems med pa khas len na'o //
translated: If one accepts that there is no other mind than the one that is known in that scripture,üîΩthen one is reduced to the position of the Carvakas.

original: dor ba la brten zhes bya ba ni dor ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: dor ba la brten zhes bya ba ni dor ba'i yan lag go //
translated: The ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is the basis of the rejection.

original: rang nyid kyis shes nas brjod bya ba ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan nges pa ni bdag nyid nges pa sngon du song ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis shes nas brjod bya ba ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan nges pa ni bdag nyid nges pa sngon du song ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving understood it oneself‚Äù means having understood it by means of one‚Äôs own knowledge.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis khas blangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni gnyi ga la grub pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis khas blangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni gnyi ga la grub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccepted by oneself and others‚Äù means established for both.

original: gal te kho bos zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te kho bos zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf I say . . .‚Äù is a hypothetical situation.

original: lung la sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: lung la sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúscripture‚Äù and so on include inference and so on.

original: sbyor bar byed pa ni 'brel par bye de cing rab tu sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa ni 'brel par bye de cing rab tu sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo apply‚Äù means to connect, to employ.

original: grags pas zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi lung nyid du rab tu grags pa yin no zhes sngon rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: grags pas zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi lung nyid du rab tu grags pa yin no zhes sngon rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of fame means that the scriptures of the Buddhists are well known to be the most famous.

original: rigs pas 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis lung sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ci ltar nus pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pas 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis lung sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ci ltar nus pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can they be powerless, since they are accepted on the basis of reason and they establish the scriptures?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of the power to establish.

original: sgrub pa dang dbang po las 'byung zhes bya ba la sgrub pa ni dbang po las 'das pa'i yul gyi mngon sum du byed pa'i thabs yin pa de'i 'bras bu dbang po las 'das pa'i yul gyis mngon sum gyi skye ba'i dbang po las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dbang po las 'byung zhes bya ba la sgrub pa ni dbang po las 'das pa'i yul gyi mngon sum du byed pa'i thabs yin pa de'i 'bras bu dbang po las 'das pa'i yul gyis mngon sum gyi skye ba'i dbang po las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase from proof and from the senses means that proof is the means of producing the direct perception of a transcendent object. The result of that proof is the arising of the direct perception of a transcendent object. It arises from the senses.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni go rims bzhin du byed pa dang mngon sum zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni go rims bzhin du byed pa dang mngon sum zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary explains this as from the cause and from the effect, respectively.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang ma rig pa'o //
translated: The phrase of those two refers to craving and ignorance.

original: spyis kyang shes pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: spyis kyang shes pa ma yin pa //
translated: The phrase not by the general means that the scriptures are not known by the general public.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyir shes pas brjod pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyir shes pas brjod pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is to say, in general, the expression of consciousness does not operate.

original: 'brel pa chad pa can ni zhes bya ba ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa chad pa can ni zhes bya ba ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is disconnected is extremely hidden.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i sems med pa nyid ces bya ba dgongs so //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i sems med pa nyid ces bya ba dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that such a mind is non-existent.

original: dper na me la kun du brtags pa'i du ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni du ba med du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na me la kun du brtags pa'i du ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni du ba med du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis sgro btags pa'o //
translated: For example, like smoke imagined in fire, even though there is no smoke, it is imputed by mere conceptualization.

original: gnyis 'brel phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos gang yin pa gzhan gyis khas len pa des de mi 'dod pa yin yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis 'brel phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos gang yin pa gzhan gyis khas len pa des de mi 'dod pa yin yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the connection with the two, that which is the property to be established is accepted by another, and by that, even though it is not accepted, because of the connection with the property to be established.

original: gcig med na ni gzhan med phyir //
analyzed: gcig med na ni gzhan med phyir //
translated: Because without one, the other does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni @254b bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni @254b bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because without the existent property to be established, the property to be proven does not exist.

original: skabs 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni spyi la sogs pa 'gog pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: skabs 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni spyi la sogs pa 'gog pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: In some contexts, in the context of refuting universals and so on.

original: sgra las byung ba tshad ma nyid du bzhed pa yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba ni rjes su dpag pa las tshad ma gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba tshad ma nyid du bzhed pa yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba ni rjes su dpag pa las tshad ma gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: what is derived from verbal testimony is not a means of valid cognition that is different from inference.

original: gtan tshigs don gyi yul nyid kyis //
analyzed: gtan tshigs don gyi yul nyid kyis //
translated: Because the reason is the object of the matter.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa las bstan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa las bstan pas so //
translated: This is taught in the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa la sgrub par bya ba grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba la nus pa med pa de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa la sgrub par bya ba grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba la nus pa med pa de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúthis is because . . . ,‚Äù the object of proof is not capable of establishing the proof because the object of proof is established.üîΩThe reason is the same for both.

original: 'jug pa gcig pa can nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang shes par 'dod par 'dod pa la sogs pa ni don gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig ni de'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa gcig pa can nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang shes par 'dod par 'dod pa la sogs pa ni don gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig ni de'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is the same for both because doubt and the desire to know, etc., are the nature of the object, and words are not the nature of that, so they are not the same in being engaged.

original: na'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: na'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The suffix ni is used to indicate certainty and order.

original: nang gi yan lag nus nyid ni //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag nus nyid ni //
translated: The internal factor is the power itself.

original: zhes bya ba de las blangs la tshul gsum dag ni zhes bya bar lta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te //üîΩgal te 'o na ni don gyi bdag nyid can gyi tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa la nus pa yin na 'o na ci ltar rigs pa'i sgo la sogs par tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi shes pa la rjes su dpag par
analyzed: zhes bya ba de las blangs la tshul gsum dag ni zhes bya bar lta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te // gal te 'o na ni don gyi bdag nyid can gyi tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa la nus pa yin na 'o na ci ltar rigs pa'i sgo la sogs par tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi shes pa la rjes su dpag par
translated: This is taken from the passage, ‚ÄúThe three modes are‚Ä¶‚Äù and is viewed as ‚Äúthe three modes.‚Äù

original: bshad ce na /
analyzed: bshad ce na /
translated: If the evidence of the three modes, which has the nature of the object, is the power to understand the proposition, then how is it that in the doorways of reasoning and so on, the understanding of the evidence of the three modes is explained as inference?

original: de'i phyir de'i shes pa la nus pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i shes pa la nus pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe statement of the power of that understanding‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rtags shes pa'i nus pa nyid kyi tshig rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de med na mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rtags shes pa'i nus pa nyid kyi tshig rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de med na mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The statement that the power of the understanding of the evidence is itself inference is that which is not absent when there is the evidence.

original: shes pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis rtags mi shes pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na shes pa tsam nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis rtags mi shes pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na shes pa tsam nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the reason is not understood, then the cognition is not produced, and the reason does not make the cognition understood. Thus, it is not mere cognition.

original: de la dran pa skyed pa ni dran pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa skyed pa ni dran pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The production of memory is the production of memory.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang de'i tshig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang de'i tshig go //
translated: Both means the reason having the three modes and its words.

original: phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad du gang gi tshe slob dpon gyis bsgrub par bya bar bshad pa dam bca' ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad du gang gi tshe slob dpon gyis bsgrub par bya bar bshad pa dam bca' ba ste /

original: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa dam bca' ba yin no zhes bye brag pa dang rigs pa can dag gis phyogs kyi mtshan nyid smras pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i sgra grub pa bzlog pa la don yod pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The statement of the probandum is the thesis. Thus, the Vai≈õe·π£ika and NaiyƒÅyika state the definition of a position. The word probandum has a meaning that is the opposite of established.

translated: The statement ‚ÄúIn the case of one who advocates that there are three members of a proof, the characteristics of such a proof are not subject to the faults just explained‚Äù should be regarded as explained by the intention of the one who advocates three members of a proof.

analyzed: bum pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa ma grub pa byed pa la ste /

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba dang bcas pas de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba dang bcas pas de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //

translated: Anticipating the opponent‚Äôs thoughts, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf there is no difference in the words . . .‚ÄùüîΩIf the words of the refutation are of the nature of words, then it is explained that they are accompanied by a semblance of perception. If that is the case, then the refutation is not indeterminate because it is not of the nature of words.
