original: de lta na ni de dag rnams //
analyzed: de lta na ni de dag rnams //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIn that case, those . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma dgod pa bzhad gad nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma dgod pa bzhad gad nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the opponent‚Äôs position is shown to be ridiculous.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the definition of a correct reason is not stated‚Äù means that the definition of a reason that is the nature of the thesis or that is the nature of the result is not stated.

original: bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi rang bzhin @255b nyid yin na ltar snang ba dang bcas par bshad pa dang ldan pa nyid dang sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la
analyzed: bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi rang bzhin @255b nyid yin na ltar snang ba dang bcas par bshad pa dang ldan pa nyid dang sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no valid cognition that contradicts the reversed form of the reason‚Äù means that if the nature of the words is that they are deceptive, then it would follow that they are not the nature of the proof.

original: 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What contradiction is there in this?

original: 'dir sun 'byin pa nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bzhad gad nyid du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sun 'byin pa nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bzhad gad nyid du ston pa yin te /
translated: Here, ‚ÄúIf it is not a refutation . . .‚Äù and so on shows the answer to be ridiculous.

original: 'dir lan yang dag par brjod pa'i nus pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir lan yang dag par brjod pa'i nus pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúit is powerless to state a correct answer‚Äù is connected to this.

original: sun 'byin pa nyid ma yin na ltar snang ba dang bcas pa brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pas ma nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa na gal te gzhan tshig nyid dang sun 'byin pa nyid ma yin pa yin na /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa nyid ma yin na ltar snang ba dang bcas pa brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pas ma nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa na gal te gzhan tshig nyid dang sun 'byin pa nyid ma yin pa yin na /
translated: If you say that the refutation is not a refutation, then you are saying that you are stating a refutation that is not a refutation.

original: ltar snang ba dang bcas par brjod pa yin no zhes de ltar bye brag brjod pa de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltar snang ba dang bcas par brjod pa yin no zhes de ltar bye brag brjod pa de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that you are stating a refutation that is not a refutation, then you are not stating a distinction.

original: de ltar na gang la rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pas 'khrul par brjod pa de dang de la gzhan gyis kyang bye brag bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang la rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pas 'khrul par brjod pa de dang de la gzhan gyis kyang bye brag bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when someone is said to be mistaken because of the application of a principle, then another person should also state a distinction.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i khyad par brgyud pa dang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can 'god pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i khyad par brgyud pa dang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can 'god pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe statement of a series of distinctions such as this is called the statement of a nonerroneous distinction that contradicts the antecedent‚Äù is not a proof statement.

original: ma grub pa rjod pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pa'i tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa rjod pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pa'i tshig bzhin no //
translated: It is not established because it is stated in the example of an unestablished reason.

original: de bzhin du rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pas sgrub par byed pa bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pas sgrub par byed pa bshad pa /
translated: Likewise, the opponent is incapable of stating a proper response to the syllogism of the opponent, because he is incapable of stating a proper response to the syllogism of the proponent.

original: gal te gzhan gyis 'dir 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can gyi gtan tshigs 'god par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis 'dir 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can gyi gtan tshigs 'god par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If the opponent were to set forth a syllogism here that is nonerroneously contradictory,

original: gzhan gyis de 'god pa byed pa na nus pa med par 'gyur bas rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pa la lan yang dag par brjod pa'i nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de 'god pa byed pa na nus pa med par 'gyur bas rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pa la lan yang dag par brjod pa'i nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: then when the opponent sets it forth, he would be incapable of doing so, and so he is incapable of stating a proper response to the syllogism of the proponent.

original: gang gis de ltar bkod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis ma nges pa tshig nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir sun 'byin pas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar bkod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis ma nges pa tshig nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir sun 'byin pas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBy whom is it set forth?‚Äù is a response that is inconclusive because of the very words that express the uncertainty due to perception.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te nus par 'gyur ba de'i tshe gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang por ldog pa med pa nyid sun 'byin pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ci'i phyir mi brjod /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te nus par 'gyur ba de'i tshe gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang por ldog pa med pa nyid sun 'byin pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ci'i phyir mi brjod /
translated: Otherwise, if it were possible, then why would the opponent not state a response that is reasonable, since there is no valid cognition that contradicts it and since it is impossible to refute it in the beginning?

original: de bas na 'dis te rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pa gang gis phyogs snga ma'i lan ma btab pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis te rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pa gang gis phyogs snga ma'i lan ma btab pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is what is meant: by what means of this door of reasoning does one not reply to the opponent's position?

original: de bas na lan bzhad gad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lan bzhad gad du byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reply is a joke.

original: ma grub pa dang sgrub par byed ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni don gyis bshad pa dang rgol bas khas blangs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang sgrub par byed ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni don gyis bshad pa dang rgol bas khas blangs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words not established, not a proof, and so on include the intended meaning and the opponent's acceptance.

original: snga ma gnyis kyi don la zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang tshig phrad dag go //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis kyi don la zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang tshig phrad dag go //
translated: The meaning of the first two is own nature and verbal connection.

original: don gyis brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sgra la sogs pa'o //üîΩgal te go rims bzlog pa la dgos pa @256a * //
analyzed: don gyis brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sgra la sogs pa'o // gal te go rims bzlog pa la dgos pa @256a * //
translated: The words intended meaning and so on refer to the sound of desire and so on.

original: ci zhig yod ce na /üîΩbrjod bya mang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci zhig yod ce na / brjod bya mang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one reverses the order, what is the purpose?üîΩHe says because of the abundance of the expressed meaning and so on.

original: don gyi brjod ba la sogs pa'i don brjod bya mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi brjod ba la sogs pa'i don brjod bya mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the abundance of the expressed meaning and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra'i don bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra'i don bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa yin na yang /
translated: Now is the occasion to explain the meaning of the words of the treatise.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig zhar la 'ongs pa'i rgol ba la lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig zhar la 'ongs pa'i rgol ba la lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: But, in the passage beginning ‚ÄúIf one says that the self . . . ,‚Äù he first responds to an objection that is raised.

original: gzhan 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pa rang nyid kyis sam gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pa rang nyid kyis sam gzhan gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú All the assertions of others‚Äù are made by the author of the treatise himself or by others.

original: bstan bcos la ltos pa med par khas len par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i phyir sngar khas blangs pa bstan bcos bshad ba la ltos pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos la ltos pa med par khas len par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i phyir sngar khas blangs pa bstan bcos bshad ba la ltos pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äú Without relying on the treatise‚Äù means that the prior assertion is understood without relying on the explanation of the treatise, because it is close at hand.

original: de ci'i phyir sngar khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos la ltos pa nyid 'gog par byed /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir sngar khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos la ltos pa nyid 'gog par byed /
translated: Why does he refute the very reliance on the treatise that he previously asserted?

original: log par rtogs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos thams cad la mthong ba'i sngar bsgrub par bya ba de la gnod pa na gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos thams cad la mthong ba'i sngar bsgrub par bya ba de la gnod pa na gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba la gnod pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú One sees that there is a misunderstanding‚Äù means that when one sees that the prior proof is flawed in all the treatises, the reason and the thesis are flawed.

original: de'i tshe chos kyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rgol bas bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i chos gcig po de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rgol bas bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i chos gcig po de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the words ‚Äúto establish the specific property in a contradictory way‚Äù and so on mean that the one property that the opponent wishes to establish is the property to be established, and not another.

original: de ltar na de bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, because it is the opposite of that, the one would be contradictory.

original: de nyid ni gal te tshogs pa gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni gal te tshogs pa gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is precisely what is stated in the words ‚Äúif there were a single collection‚Äù and so on.

original: ltos pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzhan gyi don nyid yin na /
analyzed: ltos pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzhan gyi don nyid yin na /
translated: ‚Äú In dependence on‚Äù means that in this way, if it were for the sake of another,

original: de dag ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid 'dus pa'i yul can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ltos pa 'di la chos kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid 'dus pa'i yul can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ltos pa 'di la chos kyi bye brag ste /
translated: those would not be the objects of a cognition that has a composite object for the sake of another. This is the dependence on the specific property.

original: mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don du gyur pa 'dus pa'i don can ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don du gyur pa 'dus pa'i don can ma yin no //
translated: The eyes and so on are not the objects of a cognition that has a composite object for the sake of another.

original: chos can gyi tshig gi sgras don bstan pa la ltos pa la chos can gyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: chos can gyi tshig gi sgras don bstan pa la ltos pa la chos can gyi bye brag yin no //
translated: In the statement of the meaning by the word ‚Äúsubject,‚Äù the specific property of the subject is dependent on the statement of the meaning.

original: de la phyogs dang po la brten nas chos kyi bye brag 'gal ba rnam par 'jog pa na 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dod pas 'di skad du 'dis chos kyi bye brag ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos can gyi yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la brten nas chos kyi bye brag 'gal ba rnam par 'jog pa na 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dod pas 'di skad du 'dis chos kyi bye brag ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos can gyi yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, when one posits a specific property as contradictory on the basis of the first alternative, then at times one may assert that it is not a specific property of the property-possessor, but rather a specific property of the property.

original: de bzhin du phyogs gnyis pa yongs su gzung zhing 'gal bar brjod pas 'di chos can gyi bye brag ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs gnyis pa yongs su gzung zhing 'gal bar brjod pas 'di chos can gyi bye brag ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, when one posits a specific property as contradictory on the basis of the second alternative, then at times one may assert that it is not a specific property of the property-possessor,

original: 'on kyang chos kyi yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'gal ba'i khyad par ma nges pa byas pa ji lta ji ltar gzhan khyad par du byed pa de lta de ltar 'gal bar gzhag pa'i phyir thams cad du tshar gcad par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos kyi yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro // 'gal ba'i khyad par ma nges pa byas pa ji lta ji ltar gzhan khyad par du byed pa de lta de ltar 'gal bar gzhag pa'i phyir thams cad du tshar gcad par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: but rather a specific property of the property.üîΩSince one posits contradiction in such a way that the specific property of contradiction is not ascertained, then just as one distinguishes one thing from another, one posits contradiction in that way. Therefore, one would be refuted in every case.

original: de @256b nyid g-yo ba'i tha snyad ni khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du skyon bstan pa'i don to zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de @256b nyid g-yo ba'i tha snyad ni khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du skyon bstan pa'i don to zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúmotion‚Äù is used to indicate the fault in the same way that the distinction is made.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi yul can 'dod pa yis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi yul can 'dod pa yis so //
translated: ‚ÄúDesire‚Äù is the object of a desire that is not taught to be something to be accomplished.

original: 'dod pa ma brjod pa la gnod pa 'ba' zhig 'gal ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma yin gyi de bzhin du 'dod pas yul du byas pa dpe'i chos can la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa ma brjod pa la gnod pa 'ba' zhig 'gal ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma yin gyi de bzhin du 'dod pas yul du byas pa dpe'i chos can la med pa'i phyir /
translated: Not stating a desire is not a fault of the reason, which is contradictory only in the sense of being a mere contradiction. In the same way, taking the subject of the example as the object of desire, there is no pervasion by the example.

original: dpe rjes 'gro med pa'i yang skyon yin no //
analyzed: dpe rjes 'gro med pa'i yang skyon yin no //
translated: Not having a pervasion by the example is also a fault.

original: mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
translated: The eyes and so on are for the sake of another,

original: 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang bstan la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang bstan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are a collection, like a bed, a seat, and so on.

original: gzhan gyis brjod pa na slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan ni bdag tu 'dod pa yin pa de'i tshe bdag gi don yin no zhes bya ba ngag gi don yin pa de bas na
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pa na slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan ni bdag tu 'dod pa yin pa de'i tshe bdag gi don yin no zhes bya ba ngag gi don yin pa de bas na
translated: When others say this, Master Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúThe eyes and so on are for the sake of another,‚Äù and so on. In this, ‚Äúanother‚Äù is asserted to be the self. At that time, it is for the sake of the self. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: / gal te bdag gzhan de ma grub //
analyzed: / gal te bdag gzhan de ma grub //
translated: Therefore, if the self and the other are not established,

original: dpe la'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dpe la'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe example is not established.‚Äù

original: mal cha la sogs pa bdag gi don nyid byed pa sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mal cha la sogs pa bdag gi don nyid byed pa sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established for the Buddhist that bedding and so on serve one‚Äôs own purpose.

original: dpe de la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpe de la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon zhes bya ba la /
translated: The error of the nonexistence of the example

original: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yin na /üîΩ'dod pa gnod byed yin te 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yin na / 'dod pa gnod byed yin te 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is an error that the example does not exist,üîΩthen the thesis is undermined, for there is a contradiction.

original: bzlog pas khyab pa yin no zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pas khyab pa yin no zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The pervasion is the opposite of that.

original: phyi rol gyi don nyid kyis don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi nang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes kho bo cag sgra'i ngo bo 'dod pa de'i don du sgra'i bstan bcos las sgra'i ngo bo don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don nyid kyis don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi nang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes kho bo cag sgra'i ngo bo 'dod pa de'i don du sgra'i bstan bcos las sgra'i ngo bo don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: We assert that the nature of sound is meaningful because of external objects, not because of internal objects. For that purpose, the nature of sound is meaningful in the treatise on ≈õabda.

original: rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa la rnam par dbye ba'i rtags kyi ming can gyi rgyu can yin pa de yang don dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na rnam par dbye ba mthong ba ni don dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩsngar ming can dang 'brel pa las zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don dang ldan pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur te /üîΩgnas skabs de la phyi rol gyi don dang ldan pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa la rnam par dbye ba'i rtags kyi ming can gyi rgyu can yin pa de yang don dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na rnam par dbye ba mthong ba ni don dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin no // sngar ming can dang 'brel pa las zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don dang ldan pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur te / gnas skabs de la phyi rol gyi don dang ldan pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.üîΩThe word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.

original: de la 'dir sgra'i ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don dang ldan pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i tshig ma brjod pa yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir sgra'i ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don dang ldan pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i tshig ma brjod pa yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word only is used to exclude the word's relation to other words, but it does not exclude the word's relation to its object.

original: don dang ldan par yang 'dod do zhes bya ba ni sgra'i ngo bo don dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan par yang 'dod do zhes bya ba ni sgra'i ngo bo don dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dod pa'o //
translated: This means that the nature of the word is meaningful.

original: lhag mar gyur pa nyid kyis de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don gyis don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pa nyid kyis de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don gyis don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: At that time, it is meaningful because of the external object, since it is the remainder.

original: sgrub par byed pa smra ba bsgrub par bya @257a * //üîΩbar mi 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa smra ba bsgrub par bya @257a * // bar mi 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The proof would not be the object of proof.

original: ci ste phyi rol gyi don gyis dang ldan par mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang spyir yin pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa 'bras med 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: ci ste phyi rol gyi don gyis dang ldan par mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang spyir yin pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa 'bras med 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: If it is not maintained that it is meaningful because of the external object, but rather that it is meaningful in general, then the proof would be pointless.

original: dper na spyir gzhan gyi don nyid bsgrub par bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na spyir gzhan gyi don nyid bsgrub par bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa yin te /
translated: For example, it is like proving that the eyes and so on are for the benefit of another.

original: 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di la bdag gi don nyid bstsal nas dper na spyir gzhan gyi don tsam bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di la bdag gi don nyid bstsal nas dper na spyir gzhan gyi don tsam bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is a collection, in this case, having eliminated the meaning of self, in general, the establishment of the mere benefit of others would be fruitless.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid spyir grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid spyir grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the mere fact of being an aggregation, just as in general accomplishing the welfare of others is fruitless, because the welfare of others is accomplished in general.

original: rjes 'gro dang ni 'gal ba dag / ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rjes 'gro dang ni 'gal ba dag / ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the contradictory‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: de dag gi dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Their nature is just following and contradicting.

original: de nyid ni go rims bzhin du dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni go rims bzhin du dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that, respectively, by ‚Äúthe example is devoid of the probandum‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na bum pa chos can la //
analyzed: dper na bum pa chos can la //
translated: For example, with respect to the subject, the pot.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba 'di ni 'byung ba tsam du smra ba dag gi yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba 'di ni 'byung ba tsam du smra ba dag gi yin no //
translated: This syllogism is that of the proponents of mere elements.

original: de dag gis ni 'di ltar khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di ltar khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: They accept the following.

original: sems yod pa nyid ces bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems yod pa nyid ces bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is not the slightest existent called the existence of mind.

original: 'on kyang sems yod pa ni 'byung ba nyid kyi mngon par gsal ba'i bye brag yin te chang gi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems yod pa ni 'byung ba nyid kyi mngon par gsal ba'i bye brag yin te chang gi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: But the existence of mind is a particular manifestation of the elements, like the potency of wine.

original: mngon par gsal ba sems yod pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni mngon par gsal ba sems yod pa can nyid yod do //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba sems yod pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni mngon par gsal ba sems yod pa can nyid yod do //
translated: That which has the manifestation of the existence of mind has the existence of the manifestation of the existence of mind.

original: de dag kyang de yin la lus can yin pas na zhes bya ba las 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de yin la lus can yin pas na zhes bya ba las 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: And they are that, and they are embodied, thus it is to be construed.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin skyes bu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin skyes bu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The person who has the nature of such a body is so-called.

original: de nas bum pa'i sgra dang zlas dbye ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa'i sgra dang zlas dbye ba bya'o //
translated: Then the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù is to be distinguished.

original: de ni nges par gzung ba drug pa'am bdun pa'i gnyis pa'i tshig gam yan lag dang yan lag can gyi 'brel pa ni drug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges par gzung ba drug pa'am bdun pa'i gnyis pa'i tshig gam yan lag dang yan lag can gyi 'brel pa ni drug pa yin no //
translated: That is the sixth or seventh case, the second member of a compound, or the relation of whole and part.

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba ste bum pa dang skyes bu gnyis pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir gnyis pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba ste bum pa dang skyes bu gnyis pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir gnyis pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: From among those, it is the second, because it is engaged with the second, the pot and the person.

original: re zhig autpala ma yin pa'i bdag nyid cig shos bum pa gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid yod pa gcig dang yang gnyis pa yin na cig shos gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid spyir grub pa yin pa de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang rjes su 'groüîΩba med pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩde ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bum pa la yang bum pa ma lus pa phyogs su byed na de nyid gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid du rigs pa ma @257b yin pa de ltar na spyir sgrub par byed pa la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i
analyzed: re zhig autpala ma yin pa'i bdag nyid cig shos bum pa gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid yod pa gcig dang yang gnyis pa yin na cig shos gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid spyir grub pa yin pa de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid ma yin no // de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bum pa la yang bum pa ma lus pa phyogs su byed na de nyid gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid du rigs pa ma @257b yin pa de ltar na spyir sgrub par byed pa la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i
translated: First, the other, which is not a lotus, is established in general as having a second pot, and if it is a second, then the other, which has a second, is established in general. In that case, the probandum and the pervasion are not absent.

original: skyes bu gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par grub pa yin te /üîΩlhag mar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par grub pa yin te / lhag mar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: Thus, even in the case of the probandum, if the entire pot is taken as the subject, it is not reasonable for it to be a second. In that case, even in the case of the general proof, the person who is like that is established as having a second.üîΩBecause the remainder is taken as the subject, others think that it is established.

original: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
translated: Here, he refutes with If there were pervasion... and so on.

original: skyes bu de 'dra ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa ma brjod du zin kyang 'dod pas khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de yang ma grub pa'i phyir dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu de 'dra ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa ma brjod du zin kyang 'dod pas khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de yang ma grub pa'i phyir dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yod pa yin no //
translated: Even though a second such person is not mentioned, the subject is still pervaded by desire, and that is not established, so the example has the fault of not following.

original: lus khas len med ces bya ba la khas len pa med pa ni dam bca' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: lus khas len med ces bya ba la khas len pa med pa ni dam bca' ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúno assertion of a body‚Äù means no thesis.

original: de nyid ni lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that very point with the words ‚Äúa body‚Äù and so on.

original: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon gyi dogs pa khas ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon gyi dogs pa khas ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: He does not accept the fault of the example not following.

original: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu dang bum pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu dang bum pa dag la'o //
translated: Both means both the person and the pot as they have been explained.

original: gnyi ga la don gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu dang bum pa bsgrub par bya ba'i bum pa la ltos nas don gzhan du gyur pa yod pa gang yin pa de spyi gang
analyzed: gnyi ga la don gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu dang bum pa bsgrub par bya ba'i bum pa la ltos nas don gzhan du gyur pa yod pa gang yin pa de spyi gang
translated: Whatever exists as different objects in relation to the vase that is to be established, as explained in the case of the person and the vase, that is the universal.

original: yang rung ba nyid kyi rten du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rung ba nyid kyi rten du 'gyur te /
translated: It is the basis of either one.

original: spyi ni gsal ba tha dad pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni gsal ba tha dad pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal is based on different manifestations.

original: ji ltar na gnyi ga dag la don gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyi ga dag la don gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that both of them do not exist as different objects?

original: bum pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe vase, etc.‚Äù

original: bum pa'i spyi phyogs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bum pa'i spyi phyogs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because the universal of the vase is made into a part.üîΩBecause of the doubt that there is no concomitance, etc.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dogs pas zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sgra mi rtag pa nyid ni med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med par dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dogs pas zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sgra mi rtag pa nyid ni med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med par dogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the impermanence of sound does not exist in the vase, there is the doubt that there is no concomitance.

original: khas blangs la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'am zhes bya ba ni bum pa tha dad par rtogs pa na bum pa la yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid sgra la dam bca' ba byed pa na khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'am zhes bya ba ni bum pa tha dad par rtogs pa na bum pa la yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid sgra la dam bca' ba byed pa na khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Contradictory to what has been accepted, etc. means that when a pot is cognized as different, if impermanence, which is in the pot, is taken as the thesis in regard to sound, it contradicts what has been accepted.

original: sgra la bum pa'i mi rtag pa nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la bum pa'i mi rtag pa nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not accept the impermanence of the pot in regard to sound.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yang gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yang gzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes contradiction with inference.

original: gzhan gyi chos gzhan la bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos gzhan la bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the property of one thing is being established in another.

original: sgra tha dad par rtogs pa na bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra tha dad par rtogs pa na bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no //
translated: When sound is cognized as different, the thesis is empty.

original: 'jigs pa grub pa yis zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi khyad par can yongs su ma bzung bas 'jigs pa spyi grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa grub pa yis zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi khyad par can yongs su ma bzung bas 'jigs pa spyi grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: By the establishment of the mere fear means that because the mere fear is established by not apprehending the specific subject.

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid kyis gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la ma tshang ba la sogs pa bshad pa la khyed cag gis @258a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid kyis gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la ma tshang ba la sogs pa bshad pa la khyed cag gis @258a * //
translated: In the second syllogism, which has a different formulation, the explanation of the incompleteness, etc., is as follows.

original: rnam pa gzhan du kun du brtags nas skyon mtshungs par ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩkho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du kun du brtags nas skyon mtshungs par ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir / kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bum pa dang rtsig pa la gang yang rung ba don gzhan nyid de spyi'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bum pa dang rtsig pa la gang yang rung ba don gzhan nyid de spyi'o //
translated: we do not say that the property of the thesis is the mere property of the subject, but rather, we say that the property of the thesis is any property that is the object of the desire to prove, which is different from the subject, whether it is a universal or a particular.

original: gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa so sor gnas pa ma yin pa nye bar 'god pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa so sor gnas pa ma yin pa nye bar 'god pa'am /
translated: The property of the thesis is not established by a proof that is different from the subject, whether it is a proof that is desired to be established by the other party or a proof that is not present individually.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa gang yang rung ba don gzhan nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa gang yang rung ba don gzhan nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: The property of the thesis is any property that is the object of the desire to prove, which is different from the subject, whether it is present in the subject of the thesis or not.

original: dpe'i chos can la yod pa'am zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can la yod pa'am zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: present in the example subject.

original: de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i chos can tha dad pas nye bar bkod pa gang yang rung ba sna tshogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis brgyud pas rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir kho bo cag bsgrub par bya bas stong pa la sogs pa yin par ni mi
analyzed: de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i chos can tha dad pas nye bar bkod pa gang yang rung ba sna tshogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis brgyud pas rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir kho bo cag bsgrub par bya bas stong pa la sogs pa yin par ni mi
translated: Moreover, since the various subjects that have been explained as different are not related to the reason, we do not say that the probandum is empty, etc.

original: smra'o // de skad du brjod na skyon mtshungs par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra'o // de skad du brjod na skyon mtshungs par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that, then the fault is equally yours.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu dang bum pa la ltos nas gang yang rung ba don gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dpyad pa na ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu dang bum pa la ltos nas gang yang rung ba don gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dpyad pa na ma grub pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat probandum is similar‚Äù means that, in dependence on the man and the pot that have been explained, any other object that has the characteristic of being a different object, when analyzed in the way that has been explained, is not established.

original: de ldan bum pa yang zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni gang yang rung ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i bum par zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ldan bum pa yang zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni gang yang rung ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i bum par zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe pot that possesses that‚Äù is an analysis of ‚Äúthe pot that possesses any of the two.‚Äù

original: ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid de spyis sgra de dang ldan pa de ltar gang yang rung ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i bum par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid de spyis sgra de dang ldan pa de ltar gang yang rung ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i bum par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Just as sound is qualified by impermanence in general, so also a pot is qualified by a second thing, whatever it may be.

original: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya bas stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya bas stong pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not empty of the probandum, impermanence.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig la mi rtag pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mi rtag pa nyid dang khyad par gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig la mi rtag pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mi rtag pa nyid dang khyad par gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that one thing would have two impermanences, that is, the general impermanence and the particular impermanence.

original: gal te sgras zhes bya ba la sogs ba la sgra nyid mi rtag ces bya ba de ltar gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par can gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te sgras zhes bya ba la sogs ba la sgra nyid mi rtag ces bya ba de ltar gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par can gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su mi 'jug go //
translated: If you say that sound is impermanent, etc. , then, by the exclusion of the other, sound itself is impermanent, and thus particular impermanence is not entailed by general impermanence.

original: sngar bshad zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩphyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni //
analyzed: sngar bshad zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni //
translated: This has already been explained, etc.

original: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: This is explained in the section on the pervasion by the mode of the subject.

original: 'gyur par ni 'dod mod kyi mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i khyad par gyis kyang sgra mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa med pa'i phyir bum pa la rjes su 'gro ba
analyzed: 'gyur par ni 'dod mod kyi mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i khyad par gyis kyang sgra mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa med pa'i phyir bum pa la rjes su 'gro ba
translated: Although it is asserted that it is changeable, it is impermanent because it is sound, since it is qualified by the exclusion of non-possession.

original: med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since there is no exclusion of non-possession in the form ‚Äúimpermanent because it is sound,‚Äù it would not be concomitant with a pot.

original: de'i phyir gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du khyab pa ston @258b pa'i dus na chos can gyi bye brag yongs su 'dzin pa nyid yin pa de gang las chos can gyi sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba med pa dogs pa yin /
analyzed: 'di skad du khyab pa ston @258b pa'i dus na chos can gyi bye brag yongs su 'dzin pa nyid yin pa de gang las chos can gyi sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba med pa dogs pa yin /
translated: This is saying that when the pervasion is being taught, the specific subject is being held, and from that it is suspected that there is no concomitance in terms of the subject.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis spyi'i rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs kyi chos brjod pa na khyab pa'i shugs nyid kyis sgra mi rtag pa nyid grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis spyi'i rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs kyi chos brjod pa na khyab pa'i shugs nyid kyis sgra mi rtag pa nyid grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the general concomitance of impermanence and the expression of the property of the subject are stated, the pervasion is established by the force of the statement itself, and sound is impermanent.

original: phyis rjes su 'byung ba can gyi don 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du gtan tshigs 'dis chos can sgras khyad par du byas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid sgra la med do zhes sgrub par byed cing zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid bum pa la sogs pa byas pa la med pa de'i phyir
analyzed: phyis rjes su 'byung ba can gyi don 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // de bzhin du gtan tshigs 'dis chos can sgras khyad par du byas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid sgra la med do zhes sgrub par byed cing zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid bum pa la sogs pa byas pa la med pa de'i phyir
translated: Later, it will be shown that this meaning of the subsequent occurrence is not a fault in the concomitance with the probandum.üîΩSimilarly, this reason proves that impermanence, qualified by the subject sound, does not exist in sound.üîΩThis is because the impermanence of sound does not exist in the produced, such as a pot.

original: / byas pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis chos can sgras khyad par du byas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi med pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: / byas pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis chos can sgras khyad par du byas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi med pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: Therefore, this reason called ‚Äúproduced‚Äù proves the nonexistence of impermanence, qualified by the subject sound.

original: des ni chos can gyi khyad par byas pa'i chos med pa ston pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni chos can gyi khyad par byas pa'i chos med pa ston pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the property of the subject is stated.

original: de yang gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin te sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sbyor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin te sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sbyor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And that should be seen as an application such as ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent, and sound is produced.‚Äù

original: chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can med par ston pa bshad pa'i phyir de bzhin du chos mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can med par ston pa bshad pa'i phyir de bzhin du chos mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the subject is not qualified by the property, he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way, the property impermanence, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni chos can gtso bor gyur pa'i sbyor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni chos can gtso bor gyur pa'i sbyor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is produced is impermanent. Such should be regarded as an application in which the subject is primary.

original: chos can gyi sgra rnam par gzhag pa de la gzhan chos can gyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid dam chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can gyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can gyi sgra rnam par gzhag pa de la gzhan chos can gyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid dam chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can gyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In that formulation of the term ‚Äúsubject,‚Äù the other, i.e., the subject qualified by the property, is not the nature of the probandum, nor is the universal of the subject qualified by the property the probandum.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if impermanence alone were the probandum, then sound would not be impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not possess impermanence alone.

original: 'on ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: sgra mi rtag pa sgra la sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos can sgra la chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can gyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa sgra la sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos can sgra la chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can gyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Sound is impermanent would be the proof of the generality of the subject qualified by the property, because sound is the subject.

original: gang gi tshe sgra la chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe sgra la sgra mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra la chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe sgra la sgra mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, when sound is the subject qualified by the property, then sound is impermanent would be the proof of the property.

original: gcig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gcig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin no //
translated: The mention of one is for the purpose of illustration.

original: ji ltar khas blangs pa'i chos kyi tshogs las zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can de la bstan bcos byed pas nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi tshogs gang yin pa khas @259a * //
analyzed: ji ltar khas blangs pa'i chos kyi tshogs las zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can de la bstan bcos byed pas nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi tshogs gang yin pa khas @259a * //
translated: From the collection of properties as accepted means from the collection of properties such as being a quality of space, which the author of the treatise accepts as belonging to the subject sound and so on.

original: blangs pa de las so //
analyzed: blangs pa de las so //
translated: From that.

original: de ltar na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad du gal te bstan bcos byed pa 'dod pa'i chos can de tsam la skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i chos thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing de
analyzed: de ltar na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad du gal te bstan bcos byed pa 'dod pa'i chos can de tsam la skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i chos thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing de
translated: Thus, in the proof of sound as impermanent, and so on, this is what is being said: If the subject that the author of the treatise wishes to speak about is merely that, then all phenomena that are not relevant to the context are also the predicate of the probandum.

original: la yang gang yang rung ba la gnod pa na gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: la yang gang yang rung ba la gnod pa na gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba'i skyon yin no //
translated: And if any of those are undermined, then the reason and thesis are faulty.

original: de'i tshe chos gzhan gyi skabs la bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa byas pa'i chos la byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs des gnod pa nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba skabs ma yin pa las yang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstanüîΩpar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i tshe chos gzhan gyi skabs la bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa byas pa'i chos la byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs des gnod pa nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba skabs ma yin pa las yang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstanüîΩpar 'gyur ro ;
translated: At that time, since the author of the treatise wishes to speak about other phenomena, the reason, product, and so on, undermines the subject, sound, and so on. Therefore, even though the predicate of the probandum is not relevant to the context, the reason becomes contradictory.

original: / de ltar na bye brag pa'i bstan pa ces byed pas ci ltar sgra nam mkha'i yon tan nyid du 'dod pa de ltar dri la yang sa'i yon tan nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar na bye brag pa'i bstan pa ces byed pas ci ltar sgra nam mkha'i yon tan nyid du 'dod pa de ltar dri la yang sa'i yon tan nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Vai≈õe·π£ika doctrine is called. Just as sound is asserted to be a quality of space, so smell is asserted to be a quality of earth.

original: gal te ci ltar na sa'i yon tan nyid la byas pa de nyid kyis zlog par byed /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar na sa'i yon tan nyid la byas pa de nyid kyis zlog par byed /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it that the quality of earth is reversed, but not the quality of space?,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sa'i yon tan bzlog pas byas pa nyid la khyab pa med pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar sa'i yon tan bzlog pas byas pa nyid la khyab pa med pa yin te ;
translated: we reply: The quality of earth is reversed, but not the quality of space, because the quality of earth is reversed, but being a product is not pervaded by it.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: byas pa nyid dang sa'i yon tan nyid dag la 'gal ba 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zha na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang sa'i yon tan nyid dag la 'gal ba 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zha na /
translated: There is no contradiction between being a product and being a quality of earth.

original: brjod pa 'gal ba yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa 'gal ba yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: We reply: There is a contradiction.

original: de ltar na gzhan las grub pa'i yon tan sa la gnas pa'i phyir sa'i yon tan nyid yin par 'dod cing byas pa yang rang gi rgyu las skyes pa na bdag nyid thams cad kyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan las grub pa'i yon tan sa la gnas pa'i phyir sa'i yon tan nyid yin par 'dod cing byas pa yang rang gi rgyu las skyes pa na bdag nyid thams cad kyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the quality of something else is located in earth, it is asserted to be a quality of earth. Moreover, when a product arises from its cause, it arises with its entire nature.

original: de ci'i phyir gzhan la ltos shing ltos pa med pa yin na yang ji ltar na 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gzhan la ltos shing ltos pa med pa yin na yang ji ltar na 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: Why would it be dependent on another? And if it were not dependent, how could it abide in anything?üîΩWhy would the entity that is produced, which has the nature of disintegrating immediately upon arising, abide in dependence on another entity?

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyis byas pa'i dngos po sems pa de ci'i phyir dngos po gzhan la brten pa'i sgo nas gnas pa yin te ltar na sgra'i nam mkha'i yon tan bzlog pa la yang byas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel paüîΩbrjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyis byas pa'i dngos po sems pa de ci'i phyir dngos po gzhan la brten pa'i sgo nas gnas pa yin te ltar na sgra'i nam mkha'i yon tan bzlog pa la yang byas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù should be stated in the reversal of the quality of sound being space.

original: de bas na de bzlog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos can sgra na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bzlog par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos can chos sogs sgrub byed kyis //
analyzed: de bas na de bzlog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos can sgra na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bzlog par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // chos can chos sogs sgrub byed kyis //
translated: Therefore, because it is to be reversed means that the quality of sound being a quality of space is to be reversed.

original: zhes bya ba la chos can gyi chos ni chos can chos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos can gyi chos ni chos can chos so //
translated: The quality of the subject is the quality of the subject.

original: dngos po gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir chos can gyi chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed bdag gis zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir chos can gyi chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed bdag gis zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: The word own is used because the property of the subject is the principal thing.

original: skabs 'ga' yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩci chos 'di chos can la yod dam med ces rtsod pa'i sgo nas @259b 'ongs shing skabs su bab pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi rtsod pa'i gzhig gyur ba'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rgol ba dag 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs 'ga' yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / ci chos 'di chos can la yod dam med ces rtsod pa'i sgo nas @259b 'ongs shing skabs su bab pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi rtsod pa'i gzhig gyur ba'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rgol ba dag 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word sometimes is used because the reason is not always present.üîΩ The word also is used because the reason is not only present in the thesis, but also in the example.üîΩ The word therefore is used because the reason is the cause of the conclusion.üîΩ The word indeed is used to indicate that the reason is not only present in the thesis and example, but also in the conclusion.

original: de yang rgol ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa de yang ste 'dod pa de'i 'bras bu'i tshig med na gal te rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa de lta na yang skabs su bab ba de dag gis te rgyur gyur pa dag gis rtogs par 'gyur zhing phyir rgol
analyzed: de yang rgol ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa de yang ste 'dod pa de'i 'bras bu'i tshig med na gal te rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa de lta na yang skabs su bab ba de dag gis te rgyur gyur pa dag gis rtogs par 'gyur zhing phyir rgol
translated: The word thus is used because the conclusion is stated in accordance with the reason.

original: bas rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bas rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word therefore is used because the reason is the cause of the conclusion.

original: de yang rgyu tsam las rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na //
analyzed: de yang rgyu tsam las rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na //
translated: The word indeed is used to indicate that the reason is not only present in the thesis and example, but also in the conclusion.üîΩ The word thus is used because the conclusion is stated in accordance with the reason.

original: nus pa gags med pa can dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa gags med pa can dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: nus pa gags byed pa med pa can gyi rgyu skad cig mar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can rgol ba'i rgyud la yod pa phyir rgol bas nges par nus pa ma yin no //

translated: The opponent does not ascertain the capacity that exists in the continuum of the challenger, the cause that has the nature of arising in a moment without obstructing the capacity.

analyzed: de'i phyir de bas na rgyu las 'bras bu rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
